TEXT.English: Great Generals and Admirals
TEXT.German: Große Generäle und Admiräle

TEXT.English: [H1]GREAT GENERALS AND ADMIRALS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]After enough military victories you can get a [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Great General[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_ADMIRAL]Great Admiral[\LINK], depending on whether your [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]soldiers[\LINK] won their [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]battles[\LINK] on land or water. In the military advisor screen (F5) there’s a bar at the bottom where you can see how far you are from this target.[PARAGRAPH:1]When you have won the first[LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL] Great General[\LINK] or [LINK=GREAT_ADMIRAL]Admiral[\LINK], you can still get more, but each successive general or admiral requires twice the combat experience needed for the previous one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Using Generals and Admirals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can let the Great General [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]merge[COLOR_REVERT] with one particular military unit, giving a one-time experience bonus to every unit on the same tile. The unit absorbing the commander also gains the [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADER]Led by Great General[\LINK] or [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADER2]Led by Great Admiral[\LINK] promotion, which gives unique combat bonuses, as well as access to special [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] not otherwise available, such as [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN6]Veteran VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Surgeon III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_NAVIGATION3]Navigation III[\LINK]. These can be decisive in the War of Independence. Native Nations can win a Great Warrior in the same way.
TEXT.French: [H1]GÉNÉRAUX ILLUSTRES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les généraux illustres sont des chefs militaires qui apparaissent quand votre civilisation gagne de l'expérience au combat. Quand vous avez gagné assez de batailles et atteint le seuil d'expérience requis, un premier [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]général illustre[\LINK] apparaît dans une de vos colonies. Pour générer les généraux illustres suivants, il vous faut à chaque fois doubler votre expérience totale au combat. L'expérience qu'il vous reste à acquérir pour générer un nouveau général illustre est indiquée sur l'écran du conseiller militaire [F5].[PARAGRAPH:2]Lorsque vous avez généré un grand général, vous pouvez en faire un seigneur de guerre en lui faisant rejoindre une autre unité sur le champ de bataille. Cette action conférera par ailleurs un bonus d'expérience unique aux unités de la case. L'unité recevant le seigneur de guerre peut être améliorée gratuitement et sans perte d'expérience. Elle accède également à des [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] spéciales, qui ne sont pas disponibles normalement, comme [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT6]Vétéran VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_MEDIC3]Chirurgien III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Commandement[\LINK] et [LINK=PROMOTION_MORALE]Patriote III[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [H1]Große Generäle und Admiräle[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Durch eine gewisse Zahl siegreicher Kämpfe kann man - je nachdem die Siege an Land oder Wasser errugnen wurden - einen [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Großen General[\LINK] oder [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_ADMIRAL]Großen Admiral[\LINK] erhalten. Im Militärberater-Bildschirm [F5] gibt es am unteren Rand eine Punkteleiste, auf der man ablesen kann, wie weit man von diesem Ziel entfernt ist. Hat man den ersten Großen General oder Admiral gewonnen, kann man auch noch weitere erhalten; allerdings muss man von Mal zu Mal mehr Kämpfe dafür gewinnen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Man kann den Großen General über einen Befehlsbutton mit Einheiten "verschmelzen" lassen, die dadurch eine hohe Zahl von Erfahrungspunkten erhalten. Der Große General bzw. Admiral schaltet zudem einzigartige Beförderungen frei (zum Beispiel [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Wundarzt III[\LINK]), die im Unabhängigkeitskrieg spielentscheidend sein können. Die Ureinwohner können auf dieselbe Weise einen [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_CHIEF]Großen Krieger[\LINK] gewinnen.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]GRANDI GENERALI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I Grandi Generali sono condottieri militari che emergono dalle file del tuo esercito man mano che vinci degli scontri e superi certe soglie di esperienza: a quel punto in uno dei tuoi insediamenti verrà generato un [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Grande Generale[\LINK]. I punti esperienza necessari per generare il Grande Generale successivo si raddoppiano di volta in volta. Puoi visualizzare l'esperienza che ti manca al prossimo Grande Generale nella schermata del consigliere militare [F5].[PARAGRAPH:2]Una volta che hai a disposizione un Grande Generale, puoi trasformarlo in un Condottiero unendolo a un'altra unità sul campo. Così agendo distribuirai un bonus una tantum di esperienza alle unità presenti nella stessa casella. L'unità che riceve il Condottiero può essere aggiornata gratuitamente e mantenendo al contempo la propria esperienza. L'unità dà inoltre accesso a una serie di [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promozioni[\LINK] normalmente non disponibili, quali [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN6]Veterano VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Chirurgo III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Comando[\III] e [LINK=PROMOTION_MINUTEMAN3]Volontario rapido III[\LINK].
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]GRANDES GENERALES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Los Grandes generales son líderes militares que aparecen a medida que la civilización gana experiencia en combate. Cuando hayas ganado suficientes batallas para superar un umbral determinado de experiencia, aparecerá un [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Gran general[\LINK] en uno de tus asentamientos. Cada Gran general requiere el doble de experiencia en combate de la que fuera necesaria para generar al anterior. Para ver cuánta experiencia necesitas para que aparezca el próximo Gran general, consulta la pantalla del consejero militar [F5].[PARAGRAPH:2]Una vez generado, puedes convertir al gran general en un caudillo si lo unes a otra unidad en el campo. Esta acción también otorga una bonificación única en puntos de experiencia a las unidades que estén en la misma casilla. La unidad que reciba al Caudillo no podrá modernizarse a ningún coste y conservará toda su experiencia. La unidad también ganará acceso a algunos [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]ascensos[\LINK] especiales que no están disponibles normalmente, como [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN6]Veterana VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Cirujana III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Liderazgo[\III] y [LINK=PROMOTION_MINUTEMAN3]Miliciana III[\LINK].

TEXT.English: Guns, Cannons and Blades
TEXT.French: Armes à feu
TEXT.German: Schusswaffen
TEXT.Italian: Armi
TEXT.Spanish: Armas

TEXT.English: [H1]GUNS, CANNONS AND BLADES[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]cannons[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]blades[\LINK] are the tools of [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]victory[\LINK]. Without weapons, you run the risk of being overwhelmed by [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]rival colonies[\LINK] or later by your own [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] during the war for independence.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]blades[COLOR_REVERT] will arm your citizens. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cannons[COLOR_REVERT] are necessary for siege units like the [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]artillery[\LINK] and most [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]ships[\LINK]. Warships usually require blades as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Manufacturing Weapons[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Blades can be manufactured relatively easily in the [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_HOUSE]blacksmith's house[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. All that is required is [LINK=YIELD_ORE]ore[\LINK]. You then assign a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_BLADESMITH]bladesmith[\LINK] profession to turn [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ore[COLOR_REVERT] into [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]blades[COLOR_REVERT]. The [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]master blacksmith[\LINK] produces blades twice as fast as other colonists do.[PARAGRAPH:1]To produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]guns[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cannons[COLOR_REVERT], you must first have [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]tools[\LINK], along with an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armoury[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]magazine[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_ARSENAL]arsenal[\LINK] or [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_ARSENAL]great arsenal[\LINK]. Once you have tools, you can assign a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]gunsmith[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_CANNONSMITH]cannonsmith[\LINK] profession; that colonist will immediately begin turning tools into guns or cannons.[PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_GUNSMITH]Master gunsmiths[\LINK] are experts in both the gunsmith and the cannonsmith professions, producing guns and cannons twice as fast as other colonists would. The King regards the storage of unnecessarily large quantities of weapons in the colonies as a threat; likewise the establishment of an unnecessarily large military.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Using Weapons[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once you have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]guns[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]blades[COLOR_REVERT] available, [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]military professions[\LINK] can be equipped: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]blades[COLOR_REVERT] for the town guard;[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]guns[COLOR_REVERT] to arm a [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]colonial militia[\LINK]; or, with guns and [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]horses[\LINK] the [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]dragoon[\LINK]. [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Heavy cavalry[\LINK] need blades and horses.[PARAGRAPH:1]Guns and blades are also useful when not equipped. If you have enough weapons on hand when one of your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlements[\LINK] is attacked, the citizens will automatically arm themselves and do their best to fight off the onslaught.
TEXT.French: [H1]ARMES A FEU[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les armes à feu constituent l'une des clefs de la victoire. Sans elles, vous pouvez vous attendre à vous faire écraser, que ce soit par les indigènes, les colonies ennemies, ou l'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] elle-même. Elles permettent d'armer vos citoyens, mais aussi de construire des navires de guerre.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour fabriquer des armes à feu, vous devez d'abord disposer d'outils et avoir construit une [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armurerie[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]magasin[\LINK] ou un [LINK=BUILDING_ARSENAL]arsenal[\LINK]. Les outils vous permettent d'affecter une unité à la profession d'[LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]armurier[\LINK] ; cette unité commencera alors immédiatement à transformer des outils en armes à feu.[PARAGRAPH:2]Une fois en possession d'armes, vous pourrez former des [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]soldats[\LINK] ou des [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]dragons[\LINK] (vous ne pourrez affecter une unité à la profession de [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]dragon[\LINK] que si vous disposez de suffisamment de chevaux). En outre, si vous avez suffisamment d'armes à feu lorsque votre colonie est attaquée, vos citoyens s'en serviront automatiquement pour tenter de repousser l'ennemi. Elles servent également à produire les deux navires de guerre du jeu : la [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]frégate[\LINK] et le [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]galion de guerre[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [H1]Schusswaffen, Kannonen und Klingenwaffen[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Schusswaffen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kannonen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] sind der Schlüssel zum Sieg. Ohne Waffen, läuft man Gefahr von [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Rivalisierenden Kolonien[\LINK] oder später während des Unabhängigkeitskrieges von eigenen [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] überwältigt zu werden. [NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schusswaffen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Klingenwaffen[COLOR_REVERT] dienen vorallem als Ausrüstung des Truppen an Land. Während [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kannonen[COLOR_REVERT] vorallem für Belagerungseinheiten und [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Schiffe[\LINK] benötigt werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Herstellung von Waffen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Klingen können recht vergleichsweise unkompliziert in der [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_HOUSE]Dorfschmiede[\LINK] oder deren Ausbaustufen duch den Beruf [LINK=PROFESSION_BLADESMITH]Klingenschmied[\LINK] hergestellt werden. Benötigt wird dafür lediglich [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Eisenerz[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Herstellung von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schusswaffen[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kannonen[COLOR_REVERT] benötigt dagegen [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Werkzeuge[\LINK] und findet in der [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Waffenkammer[\LINK] oder deren Ausbaustufen statt. Die Berufe hierfür sind [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]Waffenschmied[\LINK] oder [LINK=PROFESSION_CANNONSMITH]Kannonenschmied[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Die Lagerung von unnötig grossen Mengen an Waffen in den Kolonien wird vom König ebenso als Bedrohung angesehen, wie der Aufbau eines unnötig grossen Militärs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Nutzung von Waffen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sobald [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schusswaffen[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Klingenwaffen[COLOR_REVERT] verfügbar sind, können Militärberufe ausgerüstet werden. Durch die Ausrüstung mit [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schusswaffen[COLOR_REVERT] eine [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Kolonialmiliz[\LINK], oder falls zusätzlich [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK] ausgerüstet werden [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK]. [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Kavalleristen[\LINK] benötigen sogar Pferde, Schusswaffen und Klingenwaffen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Sind im Lager der Stadt genügend Schusswaffen vorhanden, werden sich die Bürger automatisch bewaffnen und den Beruf Kolonialmiliz ergreifen, wenn ihre Siedlung angegriffen wird.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]ARMI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Le armi sono il segreto per vincere. Senza di esse le prenderai di sicuro, che sia dai nativi, dalle colonie nemiche o dalla stessa [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]. Le armi vengono utilizzate per armare i cittadini, oltre che per costruire navi da guerra.[PARAGRAPH:2]Per produrre armi devi avere a disposizione degli attrezzi, oltre ad avere un'[LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armeria[\LINK], una [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]santabarbara[\LINK] o un [LINK=BUILDING_ARSENAL]arsenale[\LINK]. Se hai gli attrezzi, puoi assegnare a un'unità la professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]armaiolo[\LINK]; in questo modo comincerà immediatamente a trasformare attrezzi in armi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Quando avrai a disposizione le armi, potrai assegnare unità alla professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]soldato[\LINK] e [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]dragone[\LINK] (puoi assegnare un'unità alla professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]dragone[\LINK] solo se hai abbastanza cavalli a disposizione). Inoltre, se hai a disposizione abbastanza armi, quando viene attaccato il tuo insediamento, i tuoi cittadini si armeranno automaticamente e tenteranno di respingere l'attacco. Le armi sono anche necessarie per costruire le due navi da guerra del gioco: la [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]fregata[\LINK] e la [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]nave da prima linea[\LINK].
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]ARMAS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Las Armas son la clave de la victoria. Sin ellas, solo cabe esperar una paliza por parte de los Nativos, las colonias enemigas o la misma [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]. Las Armas sirven tanto para pertrechar a tus ciudadanos como para construir barcos de guerra.[PARAGRAPH:2]Para construir Armas, primero tendrás que disponer de Herramientas así como de un [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Polvorín[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]Arsenal[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_ARSENAL]Fábrica de armas[\LINK]. Si tienes Herramientas, puedes asignar una unidad a la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]Armero[\LINK]; dicha unidad empezará a transformar Herramientas en Armas automáticamente. [PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando dispongas de Armas, podrás asignar unidades a las profesiones de [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Soldado[\LINK] y [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragón[\LINK] (solo puedes asignar a una unidad la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragón[\LINK] si cuentas con suficientes Caballos). Además, si cuentas con suficientes Armas en caso de que tu asentamiento sea atacado, los ciudadanos se pertrecharán automáticamente y tratarán de combatir la ofensiva. Las Armas también son necesarias para completar dos de los barcos de guerra del juego: la [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Fragata[\LINK] y la [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Corbeta[\LINK].

TEXT.English: Health and Medical Care
TEXT.French: Santé et soins médicaux
TEXT.German: Gesundheit und medizinische Versorgung
TEXT.Italian: Health and Medical Care
TEXT.Spanish: Health and Medical Care

TEXT.English: [H1]HEALTH AND MEDICAL CARE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]City Health[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A large [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]city population[COLOR_REVERT] makes the city's health decline, both from the difficulty of maintaining hygienic conditions and the fact that diseases spread more easily through large crowds living close together. This makes [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]city[\LINK] health drop.[PARAGRAPH:1]Medical care can, with the appropriate facilities and healers, counteract this effect, and even raise the health rate to an above-average level. The health rate affects the birth rate, productivity and even the rate at which garrisoned troops heal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Health Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement Screen[COLOR_REVERT], the current health rate and the expected change in the next round are shown in brackets. The health rate affects all yields in the settlement and, when it's negative, it decreases each yield by a percentage equal to the negative health.[PARAGRAPH:1]Negative health never causes the production to drop by more than 25%, and [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]units[\LINK] stationed within the settlement heal more slowly than they normally would. An increase through a very high health rate is also possible.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increasing Health[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] The use of [LINK=PROFESSION_HEALER]healers[\LINK] improves the rate by generating [LINK=YIELD_HEALTH]health[\LINK] when placed in a [LINK=BUILDING_MEDICAL_OFFICE]medical office[\LINK] or one of its upgrades, the [LINK=BUILDING_TOWN_HOSPITAL]town hospital[\LINK] or the [LINK=BUILDING_CITY_HOSPITAL]city hospital[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_DOCTOR]Renowned medics[\LINK] are the specialists for this profession, and generate twice as much health as a regular colonist would. Health is further improved by digging a [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_WELL]village well[\LINK], which adds 1 health per turn.[PARAGRAPH:1]This leads to a health rate above average, resulting in a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]production bonus[COLOR_REVERT] equal to the amount of positive health. Positive health can never be higher than 10%.
TEXT.French: [H1]SANTÉ ET MÉDECINE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Les villes en grandissant peuvent poser des problèmes d'hygiène et de maladie. Ainsi, la croissance de la population conduit à une baisse de son taux de santé. Il est possible de contrer cet effet en construisant des infrastructures appropriées qui emploient des soignants, pouvant même conduire votre taux de santé au-dessus de la moyenne. Le taux de santé d'une ville aura une conséquence sur votre taux de natalié, votre productivité et la guérison des troupes en garnison.
TEXT.German: [H1]Gesundheit und Medizinische Versorgung[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gesundheit einer Stadt[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Eine grosse Stadtbevölkerung führt dazu, dass die Gesundheitsrate der Stadt sinkt. Dies resultiert aus schlechten hygienischen Verhtälttnissen und dem Fakt, dass sich bei grossen, dicht zusammenlebenden Menschenmengen Krankheiten einfacher ausbreiten können. Durch eine medizinische Versorgung kann, mit den entsprechenden Einrichtungen und Heilern, diesem Effekt aber entgegen gewirkt werden, ja sogar die Gesundheitsrate auf ein überdurchschnittliches Niveau angehoben werden. Die Gesundheitsrate wiederum beeinflusst die Geburtenrate, die Produktivittät und sogar die Heilungsrate von stationierten Truppen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Anzeige[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Im Stadtbildschirm wird oben die aktuelle Gesundheitsrate und die erwartetet änderung in der nächsten Runde in Klammern angezeigt. Wie bereits erwähnt führt eine negative Gesundheitsrate zur Verminderung der Produktivität, jedoch nie um mehr als -25%. Auch eine Steigerung durch eine sehr hohe Gesundheitsrate ist möglich, allerdings auch nie um mehr als 10%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Anhebung der Gesundheit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Durch den Einsatz von [LINK=PROFESSION_HEALER]Heilern[\LINK] wird die Gesundheitsrate angehoben, indem diese [LINK=YIELD_HEALTH]Gesundheit[\LINK] erzeugen. Sie arbeiten in der [LINK=BUILDING_MEDICAL_OFFICE]Arztpraxis[\LINK], dem [LINK=BUILDING_TOWN_HOSPITAL]Stadtkrankenhaus[\LINK] oder dem [LINK=BUILDING_CITY_HOSPITAL]Bezirkskrankenhaus[\LINK]. Ein [LINK=UNIT_DOCTOR]Ausgebildeter Arzt[\LINK] ist der Spezialist für diesen Beruf. Es gibt auch einige wenige Gebäude, wie den [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_WELL]Dorfbrunnen[\LINK], die ebenfalls der Gesundheit der Stadt förderlich sind.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]HEALTH AND MEDICAL CARE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Large City Population will cause diseases to spread. Simply due to dirt and diseases spreading more easily. This will cause the Health Rate of the City to drop. It is possible though to counter that effect by building the appropriate Facilities and employing Healers, which could even lead to a Health Rate above average. Health Rate of the City will affect birth rates, productivity and healing of stationed troops.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]HEALTH AND MEDICAL CARE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Large City Population will cause diseases to spread. Simply due to dirt and diseases spreading more easily. This will cause the Health Rate of the City to drop. It is possible though to counter that effect by building the appropriate Facilities and employing Healers, which could even lead to a Health Rate above average. Health Rate of the City will affect birth rates, productivity and healing of stationed troops.

TEXT.English: Immigration
TEXT.German: Immigration

TEXT.English: [H1]IMMIGRATION[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] is no longer what it used to be. Many citizens of Europe long for a new beginning in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]New World[COLOR_REVERT]. For you as the colonial leader, this means free and inexhaustible labour on the other side of the sea.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Crosses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In order to bring [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]immigrants[COLOR_REVERT] into your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colony[\LINK], you must make [LINK=YIELD_CROSSES]crosses[\LINK], which represent the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]religious freedom[COLOR_REVERT] in your settlements.[PARAGRAPH:1]All settlements automatically produce a few crosses, but you can increase this amount by erecting a religious [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]building[\LINK] in your settlement, starting with the [LINK=BUILDING_CHAPEL]chapel[\LINK], progressing to the [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]church[\LINK], then the [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]abbey[\LINK], the [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_CATHEDRAL]cathedral[\LINK] and ultimately a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]National Wonder[COLOR_REVERT]: the [LINK=BUILDING_MINSTER]Cathedral of the Archbishop[\LINK], which can be built only once per game.[PARAGRAPH:1]To make [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]crosses[COLOR_REVERT] in one of these buildings, assign a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_PREACHER]preacher[\LINK] profession. This increases the rate at which crosses are created which increases the number of immigrants eager to join your colony. You'll get more crosses by installing [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]firebrand preachers[\LINK] (if you are Protestant) or [LINK=UNIT_PRIEST]devout priests[\LINK] (if you are Catholic) as preachers. In rare cases, the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] might reward you with a [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]bishop[\LINK] if you are a good Christian. Bishops are even better at generating crosses than are the firebrand preachers and devout priests, but they are very hard to come by.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Crosses and the Europe Screen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To see how many crosses you must collect to attract a new immigrant, visit the [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] Screen (F2). There four possible immigrants wait in the lower-right corner of the screen. When the Immigration Bar at the top of the screen fills, one of those immigrants appears on the Europe [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]dock[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]If you don't want to wait for the total cross requirement, you can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]hurry[COLOR_REVERT] an immigrant by [left-clicking] on him or her in the bottom right corner of the screen. Hurrying an immigrant does cost a certain amount of money, which depends on how many crosses you still need for that immigrant compared to the price of such a colonist recruited directly in Europe. The crosses bar will empty once you hurry an immigrant.[PARAGRAPH:1]You do not need to bring an immigrant to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]New World[COLOR_REVERT] if you do not need him or her. Multiple immigrants are waiting at the pier in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] and you may choose whomever you want. Just send a [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]ship[\LINK] with enough capacity to take them to the New World.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Immigration Bar becomes longer for every new colonist at the dock. However at a given point, which depends on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]difficulty[COLOR_REVERT] at which you play and which nation you've chosen, it will stop growing. Every immigrant from then on requires the same number of crosses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Stealing Immigrants[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Every once in a while, your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] may contact you with the message that an immigrant of another [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]colonial power[\LINK] might be willing to emigrate to your colonies instead of the colonies of your rival. You can recruit that immigrant for a small sum of gold, but your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomatic relations[\LINK] with that colonial power may suffer because of this.
TEXT.French: [H1]IMMIGRATION[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]L'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] n'est plus ce qu'elle était. Beaucoup de citoyens européens souhaitent commencer une nouvelle vie dans le Nouveau Monde. Pour vous, le chef de la colonie, cela signifie qu'il y a une main-d'oeuvre gratuite et illimitée de l'autre côté de l'Atlantique. Tout ce que vous avez à faire, c'est l'attirer, la transporter vers le Nouveau Monde et la mettre au travail.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour attirer des immigrants dans votre colonie, vous devez générer des croix. Toutes les [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonies[\LINK] génèrent automatiquement une petite quantité de croix, mais vous pouvez augmenter leur production en construisant une [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]église[\LINK] ou une [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]cathédrale[\LINK], ou en engageant un [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Prédicateur exalté[\LINK] dans n'importe lequel de ces bâtiments. Ainsi, vous augmenterez considérablement la vitesse de production des croix, ainsi que le nombre d'immigrants choisissant de rejoindre votre colonie.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour savoir combien de croix il vous reste à générer avant qu'un nouvel immigrant apparaisse, consultez l'écran d'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] [F2]. Sur cet écran, trois immigrants potentiels sont affichés dans le coin supérieur droit. Quand la jauge d'immigration au bas de l'écran est pleine, l'un de ces immigrants apparaît sur les docks de l'écran d'Europe. Si vous ne voulez pas attendre que la jauge se remplisse, vous pouvez également faire venir un immigrant en urgence en faisant un [clic gauche] sur son portrait dans le coin supérieur droit de l'écran. Attention cependant, faire venir un immigrant en urgence n'est jamais gratuit ![PARAGRAPH:2]Vous n'êtes pas obligé de transporter vers le Nouveau Monde un immigrant dont vous n'avez pas besoin. Choisissez les immigrants qui vous intéressent parmi ceux présents sur les quais d'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. Tout ce que vous avez à faire, c'est envoyer un bateau assez grand pour les transporter vers le Nouveau Monde.
TEXT.German: [H1]Immigration[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] ist nicht mehr das, was es einmal war. Viele Bürger [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europas[\LINK] sehnen sich nach einem Neuanfang in der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Neuen Welt[COLOR_REVERT]. Für Sie als Kolonialherrscher bedeutet das, dass es auf der anderen Seite des Meeres kostenlos und unerschöpflich Arbeit gibt. Das heißt: Leute anlocken, überführen und ran an die Arbeit.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um Immigranten in Ihre Kolonie zu holen, müssen Sie Kreuze produzieren. Alle [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlungen[\LINK] produzieren automatisch eine geringe Menge an Kreuzen, doch Sie können diese Menge steigern, indem Sie eine [LINK=BUILDING_CHAPEL]Kapelle[\LINK] oder [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]Kirche[\LINK] oder [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]Kathedrale[\LINK] oder [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_CATHEDRAL]Grosse Kathedrale[\LINK] oder sogar das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nationalwunder[COLOR_REVERT] die [LINK=BUILDING_MINSTER]Kathedrale des Erzbischofs[\LINK] bauen oder einen [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Mitreißenden Prediger[\LINK] als protestantische Nation bzw. einen [LINK=UNIT_PRIEST]Frommen Priester[\LINK] als katholishe Nation einsetzen. In seltenen Fällen schickt der [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Erzbischof[\LINK] sogar einen [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]Bischof[\LINK]. Dies steigert die Kreuzproduktion und damit die Zahl der Immigranten, die in Ihre Kolonie kommen wollen, erheblich.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wie viele Kreuze notwendig sind, damit ein neuer Immigrant kommt, können Sie im [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]-Bildschirm [STRG + E] sehen. Maximal sind 2.000 Kreuze notwendig. Unten rechts im Europa-Bildschirm werden drei mögliche Immigranten angezeigt. Wenn sich die Immigrationsanzeige oben im Bild füllt, erscheint einer der Immigranten am Europa-Bildschirm-Hafen. Wenn Sie nicht warten möchten, bis sich die Anzeige füllt, können Sie den Immigranten per [Linksklick] auf das Porträt oben rechts beschleunigen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Sie müssen keine Immigranten in die Neue Welt bringen, wenn Sie keine benötigen. Eine Vielzahl von Immigranten wartet an den Docks in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] und Sie können die auswählen, die Sie möchten. Schicken Sie einfach ein Schiff mit genügend Kapazität, das sie in die Neue Welt bringt.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]IMMIGRAZIONE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]L'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] non è più come una volta. Sono molti infatti i cittadini europei che desiderano cominciare una nuova vita nel Nuovo Mondo. Per te, il leader coloniale, ciò significa che oltremare c'è una fonte inesauribile e gratuita di lavoratori. Tutto ciò che devi fare è attirarli, portarli nel Nuovo Mondo e metterli al lavoro.[PARAGRAPH:2]Per attirare gli immigranti nella tua colonia, devi generare croci. Anche se tutti gli [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamenti[\LINK] generano una misera quantità di croci automaticamente, per aumentare il flusso puoi costruire una [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]chiesa[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]cattedrale[\LINK], oppure ancora impiegare un [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatore fanatico[\LINK] in uno di questi edifici. Così facendo aumenterai notevolmente il ritmo di produzione delle croci e di conseguenza il numero di immigranti che vorranno unirsi alla tua colonia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Per visualizzare le croci che ti mancano prima dell'arrivo di un nuovo immigrante, puoi visitare la schermata dell'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] [F2]. Sulla schermata dell'Europa sono visualizzati tre possibili immigranti, in alto a destra. Una volta che si sarà riempita la barra dell'immigrazione, in basso sullo schermo, uno di quegli immigranti apparirà sui moli della schermata dell'Europa. Se non vuoi aspettare che si riempia la barra, puoi velocizzare un immigrante [cliccando col pulsante sinistro] sul suo ritratto, in alto a destra sullo schermo. Velocizzare un immigrante ha un certo costo in oro, però.[PARAGRAPH:2]Non c'è bisogno di attirare immigranti nel Nuovo Mondo, se non ti servono. Si trovano numerosi immigranti in attesa sui moli d'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] e puoi semplicemente scegliere quelli che vuoi. Tutto quello che devi fare è inviare una nave abbastanza grande per portarli nel Nuovo Mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]INMIGRACIÓN[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sin duda, [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] ya no es la que era. No son pocos los ciudadanos de [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] que desean empezar de nuevo en el Nuevo Mundo. Esto para ti, el líder colonial, significa que existe una fuente de mano de obra gratis inacabable allende los mares. Todo lo que tienes que hacer es atraerlos, llevarlos al Nuevo Mundo y ponerlos a trabajar.[PARAGRAPH:2]Para atraer a los inmigrantes hacia tu colonia tienes que generar Cruces. Como todos los [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamientos[\LINK] generan de forma automática una escasa cantidad de Cruces, puedes construir una [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]Iglesia[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]Catedral[\LINK] o dar empleo a un [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicador exaltado[\LINK] en cualquiera de ambas para aumentar su producción. Esto incrementará en gran medida la velocidad a la que se generan Cruces y, por tanto, el número de inmigrantes deseosos de formar parte de tu colonia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Para ver cuántas Cruces necesitas generar para que aparezca un nuevo inmigrante, ve a la pantalla de [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] [F2]. En la pantalla de Europa se muestran tres posibles inmigrantes en el extremo superior derecho. Cuando se llene la barra de inmigración de la parte superior de la pantalla, uno de estos inmigrantes aparecerá en los muelles de la pantalla de Europa. Si no quieres esperar a que se llene la barra, puedes apremiar a un inmigrante haciendo clic izquierdo en su retrato, en el extremo superior derecho de la pantalla. Apremiar a un inmigrante cuesta cierta cantidad de Oro.[PARAGRAPH:2]No es necesario que traigas a un inmigrante al Nuevo Mundo si no lo necesitas. En los muelles de [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] hay muchos inmigrantes esperando y puedes seleccionar a los que quieras. Todo lo que necesitas es tener un barco lo bastante grande para llevarlos al Nuevo Mundo.

TEXT.English: Improvements
TEXT.German: Pioniere und Geländeverbesserungen

TEXT.English: [H1]IMPROVEMENTS[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Developing terrain tiles with farms, lumbermills, mines and other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]improvements[COLOR_REVERT] increases the raw material yield. The plantation provides only one extra food unit, but three more raw materials.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]How to Build Improvements[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Without pioneers it’s impossible to run large settlements effectively. You can assign the profession of [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioneer[\LINK] to any of your citizens in a settlement. They must be equipped with 50 tools, though the number of tools needed to equip a pioneer depends on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]game speed[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]Alternatively, any citizen who is waiting at the European home port to voyage to the New World can be given the profession of pioneer by double-clicking. The necessary tools are automatically bought in Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]The pioneer can upgrade certain areas of the terrain by building the right improvement. Mines will extract more ore and silver, forests more wood and fur, farms and plantations more food, tobacco, sugar and cotton. It takes a few rounds to complete these changes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Most improvements must be constructed inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]borders[\LINK]. Improvements built outside your borders don't provide extra raw materials.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Production speed[COLOR_REVERT] varies with the job, the terrain and certain leader bonuses. Speed is doubled by using [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]hardy pioneers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Upgrading a tile is not free. It usually costs 20 gold, though plantations are 40. Some jobs, like draining marshes, cost more than 100 gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT][BOLD]Types of Improvements[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Roads[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] help speed your units across the countryside. Moving along a road tile costs 1/2 the normal movement points. Roads can be built on any non-water plot. There are two road upgrades that can be built on plots once basic roads are there: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]country roads[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]plastered country roads[COLOR_REVERT]. These allow a unit to move 3 times and 4 times faster, respectively.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lodges[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges and lumbermills[\LINK] can only be built on tiles with trees. They increase the [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]lumber[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]valuable wood[\LINK] output of those tiles. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LUMBERJACK_CAMP]lumberjack camps[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mines[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Mines[\LINK] can be built on all hill and peak tiles, as well as on [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]desert[\LINK] terrain. Mines increase yields for [LINK=YIELD_ORE]ore[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]rock salt[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SILVER]silver[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]gems[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]gold[\LINK], although usually a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bonus resource[COLOR_REVERT] has to be present for any yield at all. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_DEEP_MINE]large lines[\LINK] when your colonists work them over time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Farms[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]Farms[\LINK] can be built on nearly any flat, unforested tile (though tundra and snow tiles cannot support farms). Building a farm increases the tile's [LINK=VIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]barley[\LINK] output, and gives smaller boosts to other resources as well. Farms develop into [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_FARM]large farms[\LINK] if your colonists work them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Plantations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PLANTATION]Plantations[\LINK] can also be built on nearly any flat, unforested tile (except tundra and snow tiles). Building a plantation will greatly increase a tile's raw materials, less so for food and barley, although these receive minor boosts. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_PLANTATION]large plantations[\LINK] once your colonists work them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cocoa Plantations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COCOA_PLANTATION]Cocoa plantations[\LINK] can be built only in [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]jungles[\LINK]. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_FRUITS]cocoa pods[\LINK] and, to a smaller degree, [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] as well. They become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_COCOA_PLANTATION]large cocoa plantations[\LINK] if your colonists work there long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vinyards[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_VINEYARD]Vinyards[\LINK] are cultivated exclusively on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grassland[\LINK] terrain. They increase the [LINK=YIELD_GRAPES]grape[\LINK] harvest and, to a lesser degree, the production of [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_VINEYARDS]old vinyards[\LINK] after your colonists cultivate them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pastures[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PASTURE]Pastures[\LINK] can be built both on flat and on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grassland[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]savannah[\LINK] terrain. They increase herds of all three kinds of [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]livestock[\LINK] They become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_PASTURE]large pastures[\LINK] when your colonists work there over time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Collectors' Posts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST]Collectors' Posts[\LINK] can be built only on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK] terrain. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_RED_PEPPER]red pepper[\LINK] on these tiles, and also give a minor boost to [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_DEPOT]collectors' depots[\LINK] if your colonists work there long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trapper Huts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Trapper huts[\LINK] can be built in all forests except for jungles, as well as on [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]tundra[\LINK] and on plots with the [LINK=BONUS_BISON]bison[\LINK] bonus. They increase the quantity of [LINK=YIELD_FUR]fur[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]premium fur[\LINK] produced on such tiles. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_CAMP]trapper camps[\LINK] if your colonists are in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Quarries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_QUARRY]Quarries[\LINK] can be built only on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]peaks[COLOR_REVERT]. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_STONE]stone[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_QUARRY]large quarries[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Coca Posts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]Coca posts[\LINK] can be built only on hills in [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]savannah[\LINK] terrain. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]coca leaves[\LINK], and they also give a minor bonus for [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] production. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_DEPOT2]coca depots[\LINK] once your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FORT]Forts[\LINK] can be built on all tiles, and they can also be built outside your borders, but not inside the borders of another nation. They offer no bonuses for raw materials, but they give a large [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]defensive bonus[COLOR_REVERT] to units fortified inside. They also discourage Native warriors in the vicinity from [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVE_RAIDS]raiding[\LINK] your settlements. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_FORT]large forts[\LINK] if troops are stationed there long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY]Monasteries[\LINK] can be built on any land plot, and they can also be built outside your borders, but not inside the borders of another nation. They do not give bonuses to raw material yields. To be effective they need a [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]missionary[\LINK] in residence. Then they have several positive effects, listed on the Game Concept page for [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]monasteries[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_MONASTERY]large monasteries[\LINK] once missionaries live there long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT][BOLD]Other Pioneer Actions[\BOLD][COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Clearing Forests[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pioneer units can also cut down any kind of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]vegetation[COLOR_REVERT], permanently removing trees from a tile, providing a little [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]lumber[\LINK] to a nearby colony.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Plant Forest[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pioneers can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]plant trees[COLOR_REVERT]. [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] can be planted on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]grass[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]prairie[\LINK]; [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]jungles[\LINK] can be planted on [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]savannah[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]marsh[\LINK]. [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK] can be planted on [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]tundra[\LINK]. This is an expensive project in terms of money, and it will also take quite some time to complete.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Drain Marsh[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marshes[COLOR_REVERT] can be drained by pioneers as well. This will turn them into [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]savannah[COLOR_REVERT]. Like planting forests, this is an expensive project and it will also take a long time to complete.
TEXT.French: [H1]AMÉLIORATIONS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pour dompter la nature sauvage du Nouveau Monde, vous pouvez construire des améliorations qui augmenteront la production de votre colonie. Construire des améliorations est une excellente façon d'augmenter à moindre coût votre production de matières premières. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Faire des améliorations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pour faire des améliorations, il vous faut avant tout un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK]. Vous pouvez attribuer la profession de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] à un de vos colons à partir de l'écran de village, mais uniquement si votre [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonie[\LINK] dispose de 50 outils.[PARAGRAPH:2]Lorsque vous disposez d'un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK], vous pouvez l'envoyer dans n'importe quelle case que vous contrôlez et commencer à construire des améliorations. Le [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] peut continuer à construire indéfiniment.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vous ne pouvez construire des améliorations qu'à l'intérieur de vos [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontières[\LINK]. Les améliorations hors de vos [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontières[\LINK] ne vous procurent pas de bonus. Les routes sont la seule exception, car elles peuvent aussi être construites et utilisées en territoire neutre. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Types d'améliorations[NEWLINE]Routes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les routes permettent à vos unités de se déplacer plus rapidement en terrain découvert. Traverser une case de route coûte moitié moins de points de mouvement. Une route peut être construite dans n'importe quelle case, à l'exception des cases maritimes ou montagneuses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cabane[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]cabanes[\LINK] peuvent être construites uniquement sur les cases de forêt ou de jungle, où elles augmentent la production de bois et de fourrures. Leur construction prend quelques tours et coûte une petite quantité d'or.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mine[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]mines[\LINK] peuvent être construites uniquement dans les cases de collines, où elles augmentent la production de minerai et d'argent. Leur construction prend plusieurs tours et coûte une petite quantité d'or.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ferme[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]fermes[\LINK] peuvent être construites sur toute case plane et non boisée (les cases de toundra et de neige ne sont pas compatibles avec ce type de construction), où elles augmentent considérablement la production de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]nourriture[\LINK], de tabac, de sucre ou de coton. Leur construction prend également plusieurs tours et coûte une petite quantité d'or.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Abattage des forêts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] peut aussi abattre les forêts et les jungles sur les cases où cette végétation est présente et la faire disparaître définitivement.
TEXT.German: [H1]Modernisierungen[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die Verbesserung von Geländefeldern durch [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]Bauernhöfe[\LINK], [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Holzfällerhütten[\LINK], [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Minen[\LINK] und anderen Geländeverbesserungen erhöht den Ertrag der jeweiligen Rohstoffe. Die neue Geländemodernisierung [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PLANTATION]Plantage[\LINK] liefert zwar nur eine zusätzliche Nahrungseinheit, aber gleich drei zusätzliche Kolonialrohstoffe. Ohne den Einsatz von [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionieren[\LINK] ist es also kaum noch möglich, große Siedlungen effektiv wirtschaften zu lassen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sie können jedem ihrer Bürger, der sich in einer Siedlung aufhält, den Beruf Pionier zuweisen. Dafür muss die Einheit einmalig mit 50 Eisenwaren aus dem Lager ausgestattet werden. Alternativ dazu kann man einem beliebigen Bürger, der im europäischen Heimathafen auf die Überfahrt in die Neue Welt wartet, per Doppelklick den Beruf Pionier zuweisen. Die dafür notwendigen Eisenwaren werden dabei automatisch in Europa gekauft.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Der Pionier kann bestimmte Geländefelder durch die Errichtung einer passenden Modernisierung aufwerten. Minen fördern dann mehr Erz und Silber, Lagerstätten mehr Holz und Pelze, Bauernhöfe und Plantagen mehr Nahrung, Tabak, Zucker und Baumwolle. Es dauert einige Runden, diese Modernisierungen zu bauen. Die Aufwertung eines Geländefeldes ist nicht gratis, sondern kostet jeweils 20 Gold (Plantage: 40 Gold). Nur Rodungsarbeiten sind kostenlos.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Straßen[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Landstraßen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]gepflasterte Straßen[COLOR_REVERT] reduzieren die Fortbewegungskosten für dieses Geländefeld. Das Roden von Wald oder Dschungel entfernt die Bäume dauerhaft von einem Geländefeld und liefert einer benachbarten Siedlung einmalig eine kleine Menge Holz.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_PIONEER][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kühne Pioniere[COLOR_REVERT][\LINK] sind die Spezialisten für diesen Beruf, sie arbeiten doppelt so schnell. Man bekommt sie in Europa, durch die Ausbildung in Siedlungen mit einer Schule oder manchen Indianerdörfern.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]MIGLIORAMENTI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Per sottomettere i territori selvaggi del Nuovo Mondo, puoi costruire miglioramenti atti a potenziare la produzione della tua colonia. Costruire miglioramenti è un modo eccellente per aumentare la produzione di materiali spendendo poco. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Come costruire miglioramenti[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Per costruire i miglioramenti hai bisogno di un[LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK]. Puoi assegnare uno dei tuoi coloni alla professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK] dalla schermata dell'insediamento, ma solo se il tuo [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK] ha a disposizione 50 attrezzi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dopo aver creato un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK], puoi spostarlo su qualsiasi casella controlli e cominciare a costruire miglioramenti. Il [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK] può continuare a costruire per un tempo indefinito.[PARAGRAPH:2]Puoi costruire miglioramenti solamente all'interno dei tuoi [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini[\LINK]. I miglioramenti al di fuori dei tuoi [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini[\LINK] non danno alcun bonus. Le strade sono l'unica eccezione a questa regola, dato che possono essere costruite e utilizzate anche in territorio neutrale. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tipi di miglioramenti[NEWLINE]Strade[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le strade aiutano a velocizzare il trasporto delle tue unità in terreno aperto. Spostarsi su una strada costa la metà dei normali punti movimento. Le strade possono essere costruite su qualsiasi casella che non sia d'acqua o di montagna.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Capanno[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Il miglioramento [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]capanno[\LINK] può essere costruito esclusivamente su caselle con foresta o giungla. Aumenta la produzione di pellicce e legname di quelle caselle. Per costruirlo ci vogliono un po' di turni e costa una piccola quantità d'oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Miniere [\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]miniere[\LINK] possono essere costruite solo sulle caselle di collina, ma aumentano la quantità di minerale e argento prodotta. La loro costruzione richiede diversi turni e costano una piccola quantità d'oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fattoria[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puoi costruire una [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]fattoria[\LINK] su qualsiasi casella piatta e senza foresta (le caselle innevate e di tundra non posso supportare le fattorie). Costruire una [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]fattoria[\LINK] potenzierà notevolmente la produzione di [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]cibo[\LINK], tabacco, zucchero o cotone di una casella. Anche la costruzione di questo miglioramento richiede diversi turni e costa una piccola quantità d'oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Abbattere le foreste[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]I [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionieri[\LINK] possono anche abbattere foreste e giungle, rimuovendole permanentemente dalla casella interessata.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Mejoras[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Para dominar la naturaleza salvaje del Nuevo Mundo puedes construir mejoras, que aumentan aún más el rendimiento de tu colonia. La construcción de mejoras es una manera excelente de aumentar a bajo coste la producción de materiales. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cómo realizar mejoras[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Para ello, primero has de tener a un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK]. Puedes asignar a uno de tus Colonos a la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK] en la pantalla del asentamiento, pero solo si el [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK] tiene 50 Herramientas disponibles.[PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando tengas un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK], podrás llevarlo a cualquier casilla que controles y empezar a construir mejoras. El [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK] puede seguir construyendo indefinidamente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Solo puedes construir mejoras dentro de tus [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]fronteras[\LINK]. Las mejoras que haya fuera de éstas no proporcionan bonificaciones. Las carreteras son la única excepción a esta regla, ya que también pueden construirse en territorio neutral. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tipos de mejoras[NEWLINE]Carreteras[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las carreteras ayudan a acelerar el transporte de las unidades por tierra. Moverse por una casilla de carretera cuesta la mitad de los puntos de movimiento normales. Las carreteras se pueden construir en cualquier casilla que no tenga agua ni montaña.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pabellón[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las mejoras de los [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]pabellones[\LINK] solo pueden construirse en casillas con bosques o selva. Aumentan el rendimiento de Pieles y Madera de esas casillas. Construir estas mejoras tarda unos cuantos turnos y cuesta una pequeña cantidad de Oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mina [\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Minas[\LINK] solo se pueden construir en casillas de colina, pero aumentan la cantidad de Mineral y Plata que éstas producen. Construirlas tarda varios turnos y cuesta una pequeña cantidad de Oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Granja[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Se pueden construir [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]Granjas[\LINK] en casi cualquier casilla llana y sin bosque (las casillas de tundra y de nieve no pueden albergarlas). Construir una [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]granja[\LINK] aumentará mucho el rendimiento de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK], Tabaco, Azúcar o Algodón de la casilla. Construirlas también tarda varios turnos y cuesta una pequeña cantidad de Oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Despejar bosques[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Los [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneros[\LINK] también pueden despejar bosques y selvas. Esto eliminará para siempre el accidente de bosque o selva de la casilla.

TEXT.English: War Of Independence
TEXT.French: Guerre d'indépendance
TEXT.German: Unabhängigkeitskrieg
TEXT.Italian: War Of Independence
TEXT.Spanish: War Of Independence

TEXT.English: [H1]WAR OF INDEPENDENCE[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The usual path to [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]victory[\LINK] in a "We The People" game is to achieve autonomy through the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War Of Independence[COLOR_REVERT] against your mother country. This war is usually the climax of the game, and also the most challenging part. Your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] isn't going to give up his colonies without a fight![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Declaring Independence[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The war of independence begins the moment a colony makes its [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Declaration of Independence[COLOR_REVERT]. This can happen once the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebel sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] of the entire colony surpasses 50%. For more information see [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebel Sentiment[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]When you declare independence, you also write your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]constitution[COLOR_REVERT]. The new nation will make five choices: on slavery, religion, security, Indigenous people and elections. Detailed information can be found in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT] section of the Colopedia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Preparing for the War of Independence[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Winning the war of independence takes more than just rebel sentiment. Most of all you need [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Advisor[COLOR_REVERT] (F3) will give you an overview. Here you can compare the troops you can lead into battle yourself to the force the king can send. On the left your own military units are listed, and the [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]weapons[\LINK] you have stored are displayed as well. On the right you can see the units your King will send against you once you declare independence.[PARAGRAPH:1] When rebel sentiment rises the King notices, and he will expand his troops. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military potential[COLOR_REVERT] (troops and stored weapons) and relationships also play a role here. The goods that qualify as armament are [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]guns[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]blades[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]horses[\LINK]. It's prudent not to store such large quantities that the King worries.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sometimes the King will add only a single unit to his army, but other times he adds [LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR]Man-o-Wars[\LINK] which also bring four land units with them.[PARAGRAPH:1]Before declaring independence, you must build up a large army to defeat your King. It is in this phase of the game that production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]guns and cannons[COLOR_REVERT] is vital, since before this phase you won't need that many weapons, while after this phase you will be embroiled in a continent-wide [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]war[\LINK], which can severely disrupt your ability to mass-produce weapons and military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Royal Counter-Attack[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The king's fleet consists of Man-o-Wars, fighting ships able to transport troops. After the declaration of independence, the king sends his troops to recapture his colony. This does not happen all at once, but in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]several waves[COLOR_REVERT] of ships disgorging invading forces to strike your colonies. Usually the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]largest[COLOR_REVERT] port cities which are the most rebellious, or lie closesst to Europe, bear the brunt of the Royal Army attacks, but expect Man-o-Wars to unload their deadly cargo across the entire New World. When planning for independence, it's wise to make sure your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]outlying settlements[COLOR_REVERT] are ready for invasion as well.[PARAGRAPH:1]The only [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]naval units[\LINK] your King uses are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT]. These are formidable warships that are much stronger than your strongest ship, the [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]ship of the line[\LINK], and they also have four cargo slots to transport the King's soldiers.[PARAGRAPH:1]On land the majority of the King's soldiers are [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]regulars[\LINK], strong troops who can take on the professions of [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]soldier[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]cavalryman[\LINK] or [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]dragoon[\LINK]. These have the same abilities as your own [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]soldiers[\LINK], except that they receive the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK] promotions, as well as a 50% bonus when attacking settlements. However, they do not receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]defensive bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]The King's army will include many [LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessian[\LINK] mercenaries. These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]elite units[COLOR_REVERT] receive a 50% settlement attack bonus, and start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] promotions. However they don't get defensive bonuses.[PARAGRAPH:1]The royal army also has a great number of [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]royal artillery[\LINK]. These are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]siege units[COLOR_REVERT] in the game, capable of breaking down the strongest walls. Once inside they receive a 50% city defense bonus as well, although they do not get other defensive bonuses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strengths and Weaknesses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The Royal Expeditionary Forces are very strong when attacking cities and on the open battlefield. It’s not always advisable to hide in your own cities, even with [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_BASTION]strong defences[\LINK]. fIf, on the other hand, you know how to lure enemy troops into the interior or the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], they lose a large share of their strength, since there your own troops can take advantage of defensive bonuses in the terrain, such as hills and forests, which usually do not apply to the royal troops. It should be noted that the royal army is usually much better at conquering cities than at defending them, since they are more offensive than defensive.[PARAGRAPH:1]Another big advantage for the colonies is that most battles will be fought on their own land or within their own [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]borders[\LINK], which means that the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]road network[COLOR_REVERT] gives you a [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]movement[\LINK]advantage.[PARAGRAPH:1]On the open sea it is very unlikely that your own ships will stand up against the huge [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Fleet[COLOR_REVERT].Here you can only try to delay the successful arrival of the king’s troops by damaging the royal ships. You might occasionally sunk a ship loaded with troops. This will be very important for the success of the fight on land. If one of your ships of the line can damage a Man-o-War, your second attack is often enough to sink it. However, due to the sheer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]number[COLOR_REVERT] of Man-o-Wars you are facing, it would take improbably many ships of the line to prevent the Royal Army from landing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Winning the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]win[COLOR_REVERT] the war for independence it's enough to destroy all your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]land units[COLOR_REVERT]. It's not necessary to sink every Man-o-War. At the moment the last unit of the Royal Army is wiped out, and none of your colonies is under royal control, you have achieved [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]victory[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]WAR OF INDEPENDENCE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The usual way to achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK] in a Colonization game is by becoming an Independent nation after winning a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War Of Independence[COLOR_REVERT] against your mother nation. This War is the climax of the Game, and usually it is the most challenging part, as your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] isn't going to let you off the hook easily![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Declaring Independence[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The Independence War starts on the moment you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Declare Independence[COLOR_REVERT]. You can declare Independence when the total [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel Sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] of all your colonies put together peaks above 50%. For information on how to achieve that, see [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebel Sentiment[\LINK].[NEWLINE]When you declare Independence, you can also write your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT]. You can choose a stance on each of five different issues: Slavery, Religion, Land Security, Natives and Elections. Go to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT] section of the Colopedia to see what every option does.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Preparing for the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you boost your Rebel Sentiment, you can declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], but to win the Independence War, you need more than a Rebellious Attitude: you need [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]At any given moment, you can visit the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Advisor[COLOR_REVERT] (F3) to see what awaits you if you declare Independence. On the left, all your own military units are listed, and the amounts of [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Weaponry[\LINK] you have in storage is displayed as well. On the right, you can see the units your King will send once you declare Independence.[NEWLINE] When your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel Sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] rises, your King will [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]add units[COLOR_REVERT] to his army. How many units he adds each time depends on your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Potential[COLOR_REVERT], which means your military [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]units[COLOR_REVERT] plus the amounts of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]weapons[COLOR_REVERT] you have in storage. The goods that counted as "weapons" in this instance are [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK]. So be careful when producing these: if you produce more than you can equip units with, your King will still increase his Army because of them, which tips the military balance even more in his favor.[NEWLINE]Sometimes the King will add only a single unit to his army, but sometimes, he adds [LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR]Man-o-Wars[\LINK], which also bring four land units with them.[PARAGRAPH:2]Before declaring Independence, you must build up a large army to defeat your King. It is in this phase of the game, that production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns and Cannons[COLOR_REVERT] is vital, as before this phase, you won't have many uses for large amounts of weapons yet, while after this phase, you will be embroiled in a continent-wide [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which can severely disrupt your ability to mass-produce weapons and military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Royal Army Offensives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once you declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], your King will start prepraing his punitive expeditions. The army of the King displayed in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Screen[COLOR_REVERT] will not be send to you int its entirety, but [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Multiple Waves[COLOR_REVERT] of invading forces will strike your colonies. Usually, the colonies that are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]largest[COLOR_REVERT], are the most [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellious[COLOR_REVERT], border the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ocean[COLOR_REVERT] or lie furthest in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]East[COLOR_REVERT] bear the brunt of the Royal Army attacks, but expect Man-o-Wars to unload their deadly cargo over the entire New World, so while you are preparing for Independence, it is wise to make sure your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]outlying settlements[COLOR_REVERT] are ready for invasion as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Royal Army consists of several types of units. The only [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Naval Units[\LINK] your King uses are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT]. These are formidable warships that are much stronger than your strongest ship, the [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Ship of the Line[\LINK], and they also have four cargo slots to transport the King's soldiers.[NEWLINE]the land army of your King consists of several different units. The majority of his soldiers are [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]Regulars[\LINK], very strong elite units who can adopt the [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketman[\LINK], the [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalryman[\LINK] or the [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoon[\LINK] professions. These have the same abilities as these profession have when adopted by [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Your Soldiers[\LINK], except that they receive the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK] promotions, as well as a 50% bonus when attacking Settlements. However, they do not receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] form a large part of your King's Army as well. These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] receive a 50% Settlement attack bonus, and start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] promotions. These units do not receive Defensive Bonuses either.[NEWLINE]The Royal Army also employs a great number of [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK] These are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] in the game, capable of obliterating even the best defended cities. When they have captured a city, they receive a 50% City Defense Bonus as well, although they do not receive other defensive bonuses. When these monsters attack a city, you do not want to be found inside![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strengths and Weaknesses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Your success in the Independence War depends for a great deal on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Theater of War[COLOR_REVERT]. The Royal Army is on its strongest when on the offensive, and when they attacck a settlement, these is usually little you can do to withstand them. So if you hole up in your colonies and trust in your [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_BASTION]Fortifications[\LINK] to withstand the onslaught, you are likely to be squashed. Instead, if you manage to draw the Royal Army out into the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], you will stand a much better chance of winning battles, as none of the King's units receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] from terrain features such as Hills or Forests. Additionally, while the Royal Army excels at capturing settlements, it has much more problems keeping them, due to the poor Defensive Capabilities of its units.[PARAGRAPH:1]A very large advantage you have is also that the large majority of the War will take place inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK], which means that you can use all the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT], but the Royal Army can't, which gives you a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]On the Ocean, it is very unlikely you stand a chance to sink the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Fleet[COLOR_REVERT], as it usually consists of many dozens of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with each wave of Royal Attacks. Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are much weaker than these vessels, but if one Ship of the Line can damage a Man-o-War by attacking it, a second one is usually sufficient to sink it. However, due to the sheer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]number[COLOR_REVERT] of Man-o-Wars you are facing, it would take a ridiculous amount of Ships of the Line to prevent the Royal Army from landing at all. However, for every Man-o-War you sink, you will have to face [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]four land units[COLOR_REVERT] less, so it definitely can pay off to keep a fleet of Ships of the Line ready.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Winning the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Win[COLOR_REVERT] the Independence War, you only have to destroy your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT], you don't have to sink every Man-o-War. At the moment the last unit of the Royal Army is annihilated, and none of your colonies is under Royal control, you have achieved [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [H1]Unabhängigkeitskrieg[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Der übliche Weg zum [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Sieg[\LINK] im Spiel ist die Erreichung der Unabhängigkeit durch den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unabhängigkeitskrieg[COLOR_REVERT] gegen das eigene Heimatland. Dieser Krieg ist üblicherweise der Höhepunkt des Spiels und auch der herausfordernste Teil, da der [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] die Kolonien nicht ohne Gegenwehr aufgibt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Unabhängigkeitserklärung[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der Unabhängigkeitskrieg beginnt in dem Moment da die Kolonien ihre [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unabhängigkeitserklärung[COLOR_REVERT] abgeben. Dies kann geschehen, wenn die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellische Stimmung[COLOR_REVERT] der gesmten Kolonie über 50% erreicht. Siehe hierzu auch [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebellische Stimmung[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Wenn die Unabhängigkeit erklärt wird, kann auch eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Verfassung[COLOR_REVERT] erstellt werden. Man kann die Haltung der neuen Nation zu fünf verschiedenen Sachverhalten festlegen: Sklaverei, Religion, Sicherheit, Ureinwohner und Politik. Im Bereich [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Verfassung[COLOR_REVERT] der Colopedia finden sich hierzu detaillierte Informationen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vorbereitung auf den Unabhängigkeitskrieg[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um den Unabhängigkeitskrieg zu gewinnen braucht es mehr als nur rebellische Stimmung. Man braucht vorallem [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Truppen[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Um einen überblick zu Erhalten kann der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolutionsberater[COLOR_REVERT] (F3) aufgerufen werden. Hier sieht man, welche Truppen man selbst in die Schlacht führen kann und welche Truppen der König entsenden wird. Die Menge der gelagerten [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Waffen[\LINK] wird ebenfalls angezeigt.[NEWLINE] Steigt die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellische Stimmung[COLOR_REVERT] so bleibt dies vom König nicht unbemerkt und er wird seine Truppen ausbauen. Auch das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]militärische Potential[COLOR_REVERT] (Truppen und gelagerte Waffen) und die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beziehungen[COLOR_REVERT] spielen hierbei eine Rolle. Die Güter, die als Bewaffnung gelten sind [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Schusswaffen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kannonen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK]. Daher sollte man hiervon nicht unnötige grosse Mengen lagern und so den König beunruhigen.[NEWLINE]Die Flotte des Königs besteht aus [LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR]Königlichen Linienschiffen[\LINK], die auch die Truppen transportieren können.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Der königliche Gegenschlag[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Nach der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unabhängigkeitserklärung[COLOR_REVERT] entsendet der König seine Truppen zur Rückeroberung. Dies geschieht aber nicht auf einen Schlag, sondern [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]in mehrerer Wellen[COLOR_REVERT] von Schiffen. Der genau Anlandeort der königlichen Truppen ist schwer vorhersagbar. Meist geschieht dies in der Nähe der grossen Hafenstädte, kann aber überall im weiteren Umland einer Kolonie geschehen. Daher sollten auch weiter entfernte Siedlungen auf die Invasion der Feinde vorbereitet sein.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die königliche Expeditionsstreitmacht besteht aus unterschiedlichen Truppen. Die [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Königlichen Linienschiffe[\LINK] die sie beherbergen sind die stärksten Schiffe im Spiel und auch den starken [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Linienschiffen[\LINK] überlegen.[NEWLINE]Die Mehrheit der Soldaten besteht aus [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]Regulars[\LINK], starken Elitetruppen, die sowohl in den Berufen [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Soldat[\LINK], wie auch [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalryman[\LINK] oder [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK] auftreten können. [NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessische Söldner[\LINK] sind meist ebenfalls in grösserer Zahl unter den Truppen des Königs zu finden. [NEWLINE]Auch [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Königliche Artillerie[\LINK], die stärkste [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Belagerungseinheit[COLOR_REVERT] des Spiels ist unter den Truppen. Diese kann auch den besten Verteidigungsanlagen gefährlich werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Stärken und Schwächen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die königlichen Expeditionsstreitkräfte sind sehr stark im Angriff von Städten und auf dem offene Schlachtfeld. Ein einigeln in den eigenen Städten, selbst wenn diese über starke Verteidigungsanlagen verügen, ist daher nicht immer ratsam. Wenn man es dagegen versteht, die feindlichen Truppen in das Innenland beziehungsweise die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wildnis[COLOR_REVERT] zu locken, verlieren sie einen Grossteil ihrer Gefährlichkeit, da dort die eigenen Truppen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensivbonusse[COLOR_REVERT] im Terrain, wie Hügel und Wälder, ausnutzen können, die für die königlichen Truppen meist nicht gelten. Ansonsten ist zu bemerken, dass die königlichen Truppen in der Eroberung von Städten meist viel besser sind, als in deren Verteidigung, da diese Truppen allgemein eher offesiv als defensiv ausgerichtet sind.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ein weiterer grosser Vorteil der Kolonien ist, dass die Meisten Kämpfe auf dem eigenen Land bzw. innerhalb der eigenen [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] ausgetragen werden, wodurch das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Strassen- und Schienennetz[COLOR_REVERT] einen Vorteil in Bezug auf [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobilität[\LINK] gewehrt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Auf dem offenen Meer ist es sehr unwahrscheinlich, dass die eigene Flotte gegen die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]riesige Königliche Flotte[COLOR_REVERT] stand hält. Hier kann man höchstens versuchen die erfolgreiche Ankunft der gegnerischen Landtruppen zu verringern oder zu verzögern indem man die königlichen Schiffe soweit eben möglich beschädigt und gelegentlich auch ein mit Truppen beladenes Schiff versenkt. Aber auch dies ist für den Erfolg des Kampfes an Land sehr wichtig.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gewinnen des Unabhängigkeitskrieges[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um den Krieg zu gewinnen reicht es aus, alle [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]königlichen Landtruppen[COLOR_REVERT] zu zerstören. Eine Vernichtung aller Schiffe ist nicht notwendig. Sobald einem dies gelingt, hat man den [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Sieg[\LINK] errungen.
