It is in this phase of the game, that production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns and Cannons[COLOR_REVERT] is vital, as before this phase, you won't have many uses for large amounts of weapons yet, while after this phase, you will be embroiled in a continent-wide [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which can severely disrupt your ability to mass-produce weapons and military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Royal Army Offensives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once you declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], your King will start prepraing his punitive expeditions. The army of the King displayed in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Screen[COLOR_REVERT] will not be send to you int its entirety, but [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Multiple Waves[COLOR_REVERT] of invading forces will strike your colonies. Usually, the colonies that are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]largest[COLOR_REVERT], are the most [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellious[COLOR_REVERT], border the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ocean[COLOR_REVERT] or lie furthest in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]East[COLOR_REVERT] bear the brunt of the Royal Army attacks, but expect Man-o-Wars to unload their deadly cargo over the entire New World, so while you are preparing for Independence, it is wise to make sure your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]outlying settlements[COLOR_REVERT] are ready for invasion as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Royal Army consists of several types of units. The only [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Naval Units[\LINK] your King uses are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT]. These are formidable warships that are much stronger than your strongest ship, the [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Ship of the Line[\LINK], and they also have four cargo slots to transport the King's soldiers.[NEWLINE]the land army of your King consists of several different units. The majority of his soldiers are [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]Regulars[\LINK], very strong elite units who can adopt the [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketman[\LINK], the [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalryman[\LINK] or the [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoon[\LINK] professions. These have the same abilities as these profession have when adopted by [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Your Soldiers[\LINK], except that they receive the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK] promotions, as well as a 50% bonus when attacking Settlements. However, they do not receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] form a large part of your King's Army as well. These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] receive a 50% Settlement attack bonus, and start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] promotions. These units do not receive Defensive Bonuses either.[NEWLINE]The Royal Army also employs a great number of [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK] These are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] in the game, capable of obliterating even the best defended cities. When they have captured a city, they receive a 50% City Defense Bonus as well, although they do not receive other defensive bonuses. When these monsters attack a city, you do not want to be found inside![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strengths and Weaknesses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Your success in the Independence War depends for a great deal on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Theater of War[COLOR_REVERT]. The Royal Army is on its strongest when on the offensive, and when they attacck a settlement, these is usually little you can do to withstand them. So if you hole up in your colonies and trust in your [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_BASTION]Fortifications[\LINK] to withstand the onslaught, you are likely to be squashed. Instead, if you manage to draw the Royal Army out into the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], you will stand a much better chance of winning battles, as none of the King's units receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] from terrain features such as Hills or Forests. Additionally, while the Royal Army excels at capturing settlements, it has much more problems keeping them, due to the poor Defensive Capabilities of its units.[PARAGRAPH:1]A very large advantage you have is also that the large majority of the War will take place inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK], which means that you can use all the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT], but the Royal Army can't, which gives you a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]On the Ocean, it is very unlikely you stand a chance to sink the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Fleet[COLOR_REVERT], as it usually consists of many dozens of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with each wave of Royal Attacks. Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are much weaker than these vessels, but if one Ship of the Line can damage a Man-o-War by attacking it, a second one is usually sufficient to sink it. However, due to the sheer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]number[COLOR_REVERT] of Man-o-Wars you are facing, it would take a ridiculous amount of Ships of the Line to prevent the Royal Army from landing at all. However, for every Man-o-War you sink, you will have to face [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]four land units[COLOR_REVERT] less, so it definitely can pay off to keep a fleet of Ships of the Line ready.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Winning the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Win[COLOR_REVERT] the Independence War, you only have to destroy your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT], you don't have to sink every Man-o-War. At the moment the last unit of the Royal Army is annihilated, and none of your colonies is under Royal control, you have achieved [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK].

TEXT.English: [H1]LEADERS[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]All cultures in "We The People" have one or two [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]leaders[COLOR_REVERT] available. When you start a game of "We The People", you will pick which [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nation[COLOR_REVERT] you want to lead. Each computer-controlled nation has its own leader as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Leader Personalities[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When you control a leader, you determine how your leader interacts with the world around him or her. Is the leader honest or shifty? Is the leader open or paranoid? Is the leader aggressive or peaceful? It's up to you.[PARAGRAPH:1]When the AI controls a leader, the AI determines the leader's behaviour. Often, the leader behaves like the historical counterparts - but don't count on it. [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] will USUALLY be peaceful and friendly, but he may from time to time turn out to be a warmongering backstabber. You have been warned![PARAGRAPH:1]Each leader, whether [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]colonial[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK], has a unique [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]character[COLOR_REVERT]. This character determines his attitude as a [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]trading[\LINK] partner, such as willingness to trade world maps, declare [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]war[\LINK] or make peace with other nations, but also the degree to which they are angered by your transgressions or pleased by your good acts. How often leaders declare war varies greatly. Some will attack whatever's in front of them, while others seek peace at any cost, and will not resort to violence even when severely mistreated.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Leaders and Diplomacy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A leader's personality and their interpretation of the current game situation determines how the leader [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]negotiates[\LINK] with you. Further, leaders have long memories; if you deal fairly with them, they'll remember it. If you betray them, they'll remember that as well. Check out [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACYDiplomacy[\LINK] for more information on this topic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Leader Traits[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Leader traits have their own Colopedia entry. Leaders of the same European nation always differ from one another in all three traits. Overall, each European trait gets a varied distribution to the extent possible.[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colonial leaders[COLOR_REVERT] each have one trait based on their homeland ( like "Seafarers" for the [LINK=CIVILIZATION_DENMARK]Danish[\LINK], for example) and two based on their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]personality[COLOR_REVERT] (like "Experienced Admiral" for the Danish leader [LINK=LEADER_MUNK]Jens Munk[\LINK]).[PARAGRAPH:2]Each [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native[COLOR_REVERT] leader also has three leader traits. Each Native leader has two traits that provide bonuses to their own settlements and [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]units[\LINK], and one that provides a bonus for [LINK=RIVAL_COLONIES]European[\LINK] civilizations that interact with them. For example, [LINK=LEADER_SERPENT_QUECHQUEMITL]Serpent Quechquemitl[\LINK], the leader of the [LINK=CIVILIZATION_MIXTEC]Mixtecs[\LINK], has two traits that favour herself and her subjects, the "Prosperous" and the "Raiders" traits, and one that favours European nations, the "Pupil" trait.[PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]Kings[\LINK] do not have any traits, and neither does the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK]. [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild animals[\LINK] do not even have a leader.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Attitudes of Other Leaders[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Leaders of the other colonies also have five attitudes each. These characteristics are not obvious. You should observe all important diplomatic and military decisions of these leaders. With experience you can see in the demands, offers and actions of the competitors what attitudes they have. This character system is based on five attitudes, varying along a five-point scale. Each leader’s mood shifts according to behaviour.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]European Attitudes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Basic trust: suspicious vs trusting[NEWLINE]Foreign policy: isolationist vs action-loving[NEWLINE]War as a means of politics: militaristic vs pacifist[NEWLINE]Temperament: erratic vs stable[NEWLINE]Indigenous relations: friendly vs hostile[NEWLINE]Cultural openness: adaptable vs traditional
TEXT.French: [H1]DIRIGEANTS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Chaque civilisation de Colonization dispose d'un ou deux héros. Lorsque vous lancez une partie, vous choisissez la civilisation que vous voulez jouer. Les civilisations contrôlées par l'ordinateur ont aussi un héros.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Personnalité du héros[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Lorsque vous contrôlez un héros, vous déterminez ses réactions par rapport au monde qui l'entoure. Est-il honnête ou sournois ? Ouvert ou paranoïaque ? Agressif ou pacifique ? A vous de décider. De la même manière, l'ordinateur détermine le comportement des héros qu'il contrôle. Généralement, un héros se comporte comme le personnage historique qu'il représente, mais ne comptez pas trop là-dessus. [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] sera a priori pacifique et amical, mais il peut de temps à autre se transformer en belliciste accompli. Vous voilà prévenu ! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Héros et diplomatie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La personnalité du héros et sa vision de la situation déterminent sa façon de négocier avec vous. En outre, les héros ont une mémoire d'éléphant : respectez vos engagements et ils s'en souviendront. Trahissez-les, et ils s'en souviendront aussi. Pour plus d'informations sur le sujet, consultez la section [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caractère des héros[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les traits de caractère des héros permettent de déterminer comment ils dirigent leur colonie. Chaque héros a deux des traits de caractère suivants (un dépend de sa personnalité et un autre de sa civilisation) :[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Commerçant[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] tous les héros [LINK=CIVILIZATION_DUTCH]hollandais[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les marchés hollandais d'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] ne sont pas affectés par les ventes sur les autres marchés européens.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tolérant[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] tous les héros [LINK=CIVILIZATION_ENGLAND]anglais[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] l'apparition d'immigrants sur les docks en Europe nécessite moins de croix.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Coopératif[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] tous les héros [LINK=CIVILIZATION_FRANCE]français[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] réduit la vitesse à laquelle les [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK] sont exaspérés par l'avancée des Européens sur leurs terres. Les unités apprennent de nouvelles [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professions[\LINK] des [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK] deux fois plus vite.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Conquistador[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] tous les héros [LINK=CIVILIZATION_SPAIN]espagnols[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] bonus de combat de +25 %% contre les unités [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Charismatique[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] le roi lève les [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]taxes[\LINK] deux fois moins vite.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Diligent[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_STUYVESANT]Peter Stuyvesant[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonies[\LINK] bénéficient de +25 %% de production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Discipliné[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les colons ont besoin de deux fois moins d'armes pour exercer la profession de [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]soldat[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Libertaire[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_ADAMS]John Adams[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonies[\LINK] produisent +25 %% de [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Cloches de la Liberté[\LINK] supplémentaires.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Entreprenant[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_CHAMPLAIN]Samuel de Champlain[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]missions[\LINK] produisent des [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]indigènes convertis[\LINK] deux fois plus vite.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Militariste[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_FRONTENAC]Louis de Frontenac[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les unités combattantes reçoivent l'amélioration [LINK=PROMOTION_GRENADIER1]Grenadier[\LINK] gratuitement, ce qui les rend plus efficaces contre les villages.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Déterminé[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_BOLIVAR]Sïmon Bolïvar[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] le bonus défensif procuré par les [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Cloches de la Liberté[\LINK] est doublé.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ingénieux[NEWLINE]Disponible pour :[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_SAN_MARTIN]José de San Martïn[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effet :[\BOLD] les unités doivent gagner deux fois moins d'expérience pour être promues.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caractéristiques des chefs indigènes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Chaque chef indigène dispose aussi de ses propes traits de caractère, qui leur font profiter de bonus, ainsi qu'à leurs unités et aux civilisations européennes avec lesquelles elles interagissent. Consultez les entrées consacrées aux chefs et dirigeants ci-dessous pour en savoir plus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Liste des héros[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Consultez la [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]liste des héros[\LINK] pour connaître la liste complète des héros de Colonization, ainsi que leur biographie et leurs traits de caractère.
TEXT.German: [H1]Oberhäupter der Nationen[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Alle Völker in Colonization werden von einem Oberhaupt geführt. Jedes Oberhaupt hat zwei bis drei Eigenschaften, die europäischen Konkurrenten zudem fünf Charaktermerkmale, die ihre Persönlichkeit ausmachen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Eigenschaften eines Oberhaupts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Jedes europäische Staatsoberhaupt hat drei Eigenschaften, jedes indigene zwei. Diese Eigenschaften sind in den Colopädieeinträgen der Oberhäupter aufgelistet. Oberhäupter derselben europäischen Nation unterscheiden sich immer in allen 3 Eigenschaften voneinander. Insgesamt wird jede Eigenschaft der Europäer dreimal verteilt und dabei möglichst selten mit derselben anderen Eigenschaft ein zweites Mal kombiniert.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die Eigenschaften der europäischen Oberhaupter geben ihren Nationen bestimmte Spielboni. Bei den Ureinwohnervölkern gewährt jede Eigenschaft immer zwei Boni: einen militärischen Bonus, der den Einheiten automatische Beförderungen und damit verbundene Kampfboni verleiht (zum Beispiel eine höhere Kampfstärke in Wäldern), und einen diplomatischen Bonus, der nicht den Ureinwohnern selber nützt, sondern den Europäern, die mit ihnen Umgang pflegen (z.B. einen Vorteil bei der Errichtung von Missionen).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Charaktermerkmale eines Oberhaupts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Oberhäupter der anderen Völker verfügen zusätzlich noch über je fünf Charaktermerkmale. Diese Charaktermerkmale sind zunächst nicht zu erkennen. Sie steuern alle wichtigen [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomatischen[\LINK] und [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]militärischen[\LINK] Entscheidungen dieser Oberhäupter. Mit wachsender Erfahrung erkennt man in den Forderungen, Angeboten und Handlungen der Konkurrenten, welchen Charakter sie haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grundlage dieses Charaktersystems sind fünf Merkmalklassen. Für jede dieser fünf Merkmalklassen gibt es eine fünfstufige Werteskala, die zwischen zwei Polen liegt. Jedem Oberhaupt wird bei diesen Werteskalen ein bestimmter Wert zugeordnet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Überblick über die Merkmalklassen bei den Europäern:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Grundvertrauen:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]misstrauisch vs. vertrauensvoll[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Außenpolitische Offenheit:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]isolationistisch vs. aktionsfreudig[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Krieg als Mittel der Politik:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]militarististisch vs. pazifistisch[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Temperament:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]sprunghaft vs. statisch[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Einstellung gegenüber Ureinwohnern:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]freundlich vs. feindlich[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Überblick über die Merkmalklassen bei den Ureinwohnern:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Wie oben, mit einem Unterschied: Der letzte Punkt wird ersetzt durch ...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kulturelle Offenheit:[\BOLD][NEWLINE]anpassungsfähig vs. traditionsbewusst
TEXT.Italian: [H1]LEADER[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In Colonization, ogni civiltà dispone di uno o due leader che possono guidarla. Quando inizi una partita di Colonization dovrai scegliere quale civiltà guidare. Anche le civiltà controllate dal computer hanno un leader.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Personalità dei leader[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Quando controlli un leader, decidi anche come il tuo leader può interagire con il mondo che lo/la circonda. Sarà onesto o ambiguo? Sarà di aperte vedute, o paranoico? Aggressivo o pacifico? Dipende solo da te. Quando è il computer a controllare un leader, è lui a stabilirne il comportamento. Spesso, il leader controllato dal computer tende a comportarsi come la sua controparte storica - ma non ci contare troppo. [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] sarà SOLITAMENTE pacifico e amichevole, ma potrebbe sporadicamente trasformarsi in un traditore guerrafondaio. Sei stato avvertito! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Leader e diplomazia[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La personalità di un leader e la sua interpretazione della situazione di gioco determinano il modo in cui negozierà con te. Inoltre, i leader hanno buona memoria: se tratti correttamente con loro, se lo ricorderanno. E se li tradisci, stai certo che non se lo dimenticheranno mai. Leggi la sezione relativa alla [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomazia[\LINK] per avere maggiori dettagli sull'argomento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caratteristiche dei leader[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]I leader presenti in Colonization hanno dei "punti di forza" che aiutano a capire come gestiranno la propria colonia. Ogni leader ha due tra le seguenti caratteristiche, una basata sulla sua personalità e una sulla civiltà a cui appartiene:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mercantile [NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] Tutti i leader [LINK=CIVILIZATION_DUTCH]olandesi[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] I mercati [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]europei[\LINK] d'Olanda non vengono affossati dalle vendite sugli altri mercati europei.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tollerante[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] Tutti i leader [LINK=CIVILIZATION_ENGLAND]inglesi[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Servono meno croci per far comparire immigranti sui moli europei[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cooperativo[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] Tutti i leader [LINK=CIVILIZATION_FRANCE]francesi[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Diminuisce la velocità a cui i [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] si arrabbiano a causa dell'invasione europea dei loro territori. Le unità imparano nuove [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professioni[\LINK] dai [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] nella metà del tempo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Conquistador[NEWLINE]Disponibile per: [\BOLD]Tutti i leader [LINK=CIVILIZATION_SPAIN]spagnoli[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] +25%% bonus di combattimento contro le unità dei [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Carismatico[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto: [\BOLD]Il re ci mette il doppio del tempo per aumentare le [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]tasse[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Industrioso[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_STUYVESANT]Peter Stuyvesant[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Gli [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamenti[\LINK] generano 25%% produzione extra.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Disciplinato[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] I coloni necessitano della metà del normale quantitativo di armi per intraprendere la professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]soldati[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Liberale[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_ADAMS]John Adams[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Gli [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamenti[\LINK] producono 25%% [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]campane della libertà[\LINK] extra.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Intraprendente[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_CHAMPLAIN]Samuel de Champlain[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Le [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]missioni[\LINK] producono [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]nativi convertiti[\LINK] al doppio della velocità.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Militarista[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_FRONTENAC]Louis de Frontenac[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Le unità militari ricevono gratuitamente la promozione [LINK=PROMOTION_GRENADIER1]granatiere[\LINK], che le rende più efficaci contro gli insediamenti.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Determinato[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_BOLIVAR]Simon Bolivar[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Il bonus difensivo delle [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]campane della libertà[\LINK] è raddoppiato.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ingegnoso[NEWLINE]Disponibile per:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_SAN_MARTIN]Jose de San Martin[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Effetto:[\BOLD] Le unità necessitano della metà del normale quantitativo di esperienza per ricevere le promozioni.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Caratteristiche dei leader nativi[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Anche i leader nativi hanno le proprie caratteristiche, che forniscono bonus a loro stessi e alle loro unità, così come alle civiltà europee con cui interagiscono. Dai un'occhiata alle voci relative ai singoli leader nella lista dei leader, per ulteriori informazioni.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lista dei leader[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Dai un'occhiata alla [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]lista dei leader[\LINK] per vedere la lista completa di tutti i leader di Colonization, le loro caratteristiche di gioco e le informazioni storiche.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]LÍDERES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]En Colonization, cada civilización cuenta con uno o dos líderes disponibles para que la guíen. Cuando empieces una partida, escogerás la civilización que quieras llevar. Cada civilización que lleve el ordenador también tendrá un solo líder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Personalidad de los líderes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cuando llevas a un líder, eres tú quien decide cómo se relaciona con el mundo que le rodea. ¿Es honrado o artero? ¿Abierto o paranoico? ¿Agresivo o pacífico? Queda en tus manos. Cuando el ordenador lleva a un líder, es éste quien decide el comportamiento del mismo. El líder suele comportarse como su homónimo histórico, pero no siempre ha de ser así. [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] será pacífico y amistoso NORMALMENTE pero, de vez en cuando, puede que se convierta en un traidor belicoso. ¡Te hemos avisado! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Líderes y diplomacia[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La personalidad de un líder y su interpretación de lo que esté ocurriendo en el mundo determinarán cómo negociará contigo. Además, los líderes tienen buena memoria: si te portas bien con ellos, lo recordarán. Si les traicionas, también lo recordarán. Repasa la [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomacia[\LINK] para obtener más información sobre este tema. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rasgos de los líderes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]En Colonization, los líderes tienen "rasgos" que ayudan a decidir cómo llevan su colonia. Cada líder tiene dos de los rasgos siguientes, uno en función de su personalidad y otro en función de su civilización:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mercantilista [NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] todos los líderes [LINK=CIVILIZATION_DUTCH]holandeses[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] las ventas de los mercados holandeses no bajan a consecuencia de las ventas en otros mercados [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]europeos[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tolerante[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] todos los líderes [LINK=CIVILIZATION_ENGLAND]ingleses[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] Se necesitan menos Cruces para que los inmigrantes aparezcan en los muelles de Europa.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Servicial[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] todos los líderes [LINK=CIVILIZATION_FRANCE]franceses[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] disminuye el ritmo al que los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] se enojan por la violación europea de sus tierras. Las unidades aprenden nuevas [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesiones[\LINK] de los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] en la mitad de tiempo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Conquistador[NEWLINE]Disponible para: [\BOLD]todos los líderes [LINK=CIVILIZATION_SPAIN]españoles[\LINK][NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] +25%% de bonificación al combate contra las unidades de [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Carismático[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos: [\BOLD]al rey le cuesta el doble de lo normal recaudar [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]impuestos[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Diligente[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_STUYVESANT]Peter Stuyvesant[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] los [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamientos[\LINK] dan un 25%% más de producción.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Disciplinado[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_WASHINGTON]George Washington[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] los Colonos necesitan la mitad de Armas requeridas para coger la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Soldado[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Libertario[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_ADAMS]John Adams[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] los [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamientos[\LINK] dan un 25%% más de [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Campanas de la libertad[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Emprendedor[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_CHAMPLAIN]Samuel de Champlain[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] las [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]misiones[\LINK] producen [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Nativos conversos[\LINK] al doble de la velocidad normal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Militarista[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] el [LINK=LEADER_FRONTENAC]conde de Frontenac[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] las unidades de combate reciben gratis el ascenso a [LINK=PROMOTION_GRENADIER1]Granadero[\LINK], que las hace más eficaces contra los asentamientos.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Decidido[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] libertad[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ingenioso[NEWLINE]Disponible para:[\BOLD] [LINK=LEADER_SAN_MARTIN]José de San Martín[\LINK] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Efectos:[\BOLD] Las unidades necesitan la mitad de experiencia para recibir ascensos.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rasgos de los líderes nativos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cada líder nativo tiene sus rasgos como tal. Dichos rasgos generan bonificaciones, tanto para los líderes y sus unidades como para las civilizaciones europeas que interactúan con ellos. Para obtener más detalles, consulta los artículos sobre cada líder en la lista de líderes que se incluye más adelante.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lista de líderes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Revisa la [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]lista de líderes[\LINK] para tener una visión completa de los líderes de Colonization, sus rasgos y trasfondos históricos.
