TEXT.English: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]war[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, or if you need to defend your colonies, you will need [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]military units[COLOR_REVERT]. This game features many different military units, each with strengths and weaknesses. Every unit with the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]attack[\LINK] other units is considered a military unit. .[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]land units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For naval units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]In term of availability, military units fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]core units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]elite units[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]The difference between the two lies in the fact that core units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced or equipped in the New World or recruited in Europe[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while elite units can only be acquired through other means, like special events or diplomatic interaction with other European nations or kings. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will mainly be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]core units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]military industry[\LINK] gets going. [NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The core units that are available for European nations in this game are: scouts, colonial militia, line infantry, dragoons and cavalrymen as well as light and heavy artillery. Braves, armed braves, mounted braves and armed mounted braves are available for Indigenous nations only.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]veteran soldiers[COLOR_REVERT]. That means that each of the military professions has its own special veteran unit that serves at its best when it's in its corresponding profession. The veteran units are the [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]seasoned scout[\LINK], the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]veteran infantry soldier[\LINK], the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_DRAGOON]veteran dragoon[\LINK] and the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_CAVALRY]veteran cavalryman[\LINK]. The [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]light artillery and heavy artillery[\LINK] are units, not professions. Light and heavy artillery can be produced in the armoury and its upgrades or they can be bought in Europe.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]elite units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game are: [LINK=UNIT_RANGER]rangers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC] Native mercenaries [\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]mounted conquistadores [\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]mortars[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]settler militias[\LINK]. The line infantry has an exceptional position. The [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]European line infantry[\LINK] is an elite unit, which can be acquired only in Europe, whereas the colonial line infantry is a military profession of the core units in the New World. The specialized unit is again the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]veteran infantry soldier[\LINK]. The colonial line infantry can be hired in the New World but cannot be acquired in Europe. However, both units have the same strength. The player can get certain units frequently, but others are rare. In general the elite units are rewards given for special diplomatic [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]events[\LINK] by your own King, the kings of other nations or Native leaders as long as the player is not at war with these parties. Furthermore the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Church[\LINK] can grant units as well when the player is willing to declare war on a heretical Native nation. Some of the [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] will also grant troops.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Individual units gain combat experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]battles[\LINK], and they can get [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units collect enough combat experience, a [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]great general[\LINK] will appear in one of your settlements. He gives your units combat bonuses, extra experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Different Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These units require only [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]horses[\LINK] to be equipped, and they have faster [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]movement[\LINK]. Scouts are relatively weak, so they should avoid combat against units stronger than [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]wild animals[\LINK]. Their main purpose is [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]exploration[\LINK]. After they have travelled throughout the New World they can be used as strong military units (change of specialisation will be required) since they should have collected a lot of [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] - assuming they have survived their adventures.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] and [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These elite units appear in various ways: by exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]ancient ruins[\LINK]; from [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK]; during a random [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]diplomatic event[\LINK] requiring you to go to war with a Native tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may offer you these units when he wants you to attack a particular Native tribe. Conquistadores get a bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]melee units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other conquistadores), and a further combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT]. That means they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who have mainly melee units. Other disciplined European military units are generally too strong for the conquistadores. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Rangers[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Rangers are rare elite units who are experts in wilderness fighting. They get a combat bonus when fighting in forests and jungles, both when attacking and defending. On top of that, they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]invisible[COLOR_REVERT] to nearly all enemy units (except Natives, other rangers or Native mercenaries), which makes them particularly useful as commandos in hostile territory.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rangers can be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]diplomacy[COLOR_REVERT] when your King offers to sell them to you, and also come from certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenaries[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Native mercenaries are elite units who fight exceptionally well in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], just like rangers. The difference between these two is that, while rangers get a significant [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]combat bonus[COLOR_REVERT] in forests both on attack and on defense, Native mercenaries only get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attack bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] in the wilderness, which in compensation are higher than the bonuses the ranger gets. These attack bonuses are equal to what [LINK= PROFESSION_BRAVE]Natives[\LINK] have. Native mercenaries can be found in places like [LINK=CONCEPT_GOODY_HUT]burial grounds[\LINK]. They can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native nations[COLOR_REVERT]. You can even get them from some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Settler Militia[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Though settler militias are technically elite units, since you cannot build them yourself, they are pretty weak for gunpowder units. They show up when a town feels [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]unprotected[COLOR_REVERT] due to a lack of military. To get them the colony will take [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] from the food stores and money from your treasury. Though settler militias are weak, they do get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]defense bonus[COLOR_REVERT] inside a settlement, which allows them to successfully fight off weaker attacks like Native raids. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIAL_MILITIA]Colonial Militia[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Colonial militias are the weakest but cheapest standard military unit. They are well-trained infantry troops which can be used for attack and defense. Colonial militias are your basic gunpowder units in the New World. Almost all colonists can adopt this profession, as long as there are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]guns[COLOR_REVERT] to equip them. They are stronger than most melee units. In the wilderness they have some disadvantages against Native warriors, so be careful there unless they have veteran promotions. Veteran infantry soldiers (in the colonial militia profession) can be hired in Europe. Some Founding Fathers will grant them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_LINE_INFANTRY]Line Infantry[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The colonial line infantry is the strongest infantry unit in the game and is well-prepared for war. Being a profession, colonial line infantry can be hired and equipped in your towns as long as enough weapons ([LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]guns[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]blades[\LINK]) are stored there. Colonial infantry cannot be hired in Europe. The colonial line infantry can gain veteran status after a while. Alternatively the [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]European line infantry[\LINK] can be hired in Europe. The European Line Infantry is a military unit with the same strength as the colonial line infantry. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoons[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Dragoons are mounted infantry units. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted units[COLOR_REVERT] wage war on horseback. With their movement bonus they are faster than other fighters and have the same strength as colonial militia, but they do not get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]defensive bonuses[COLOR_REVERT], so they are rather weak when not fighting in the open. You can make dragoons by equipping colonists with both [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]horses[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]guns[\LINK]. Veteran dragoons automatically get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]leadership[COLOR_REVERT] promotion, which doubles [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]experience[COLOR_REVERT] from winning battles. If you want your soldiers to gain experience quickly, letting them fight as dragoons is an excellent method. In addition to this, dragoons receive a bonus when attacking [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]artillery units[COLOR_REVERT] so they are strong against all artillery units. Dragoons can either be equipped in the colonies or they can be hired in Europe. In the end the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cost-value ratio of a dragoon is excellent[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Heavy Cavalry[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cavalrymen are the strongest mounted units you can have. Heavy cavalry is a military profession. To get them, equip a colonist with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]horses, guns and blades[COLOR_REVERT]. Heavy cavalry can be recruited in Europe as well. They have high combat strength, but a movement of only 1 until they can earn a promotion, which makes them slower than other mounted units. Due to their high combat strength, cavalrymen are useful in all kinds of warfare, whether in the open, attacking settlements or defending them. However, in the wilderness they are at a disadvantage against other units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards [\LINK][\BOLD]and [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These two are rare military units - don't risk them! Continental Guards are elite soldiers who can be acquired later in the game, as you prepare for [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]independence[\LINK]. They are offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]foreign kings[COLOR_REVERT], perhaps because your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomatic relations[\LINK] with their colonies have been good.[PARAGRAPH:1]Continental Guards have a very high combat strength, with four promotions present on arrival: [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK]. Additionally, they receive a combat bonus against other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]gunpowder units[COLOR_REVERT]. These soldiers are very strong, and can be decisive in your war of independence.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hessians are [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]European[\LINK] elite units who appear in great numbers in your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Expeditionary Force[COLOR_REVERT]. You can get a few of these soldiers yourself through some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] or as reinforcements sent by your King to fight against other colonies. Hessians do not receive defensive bonuses, but they get a combat bonus when [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacking settlements[COLOR_REVERT] and attacking in open fields, as well as the Veteran I, Leadership and Bayonet promotions which makes them a very strong unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Light Artillery [\LINK][\BOLD] and [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HEAVY_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Heavy Artillery[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These two siege units are your basic artillery in the New World. Siege units deploy [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]cannons[\LINK] to wage war against enemies. Except for the light artillery, none of them get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]defensive bonuses[COLOR_REVERT]. Light artillery are the cheapest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]siege units[COLOR_REVERT]. They get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]settlement defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. This makes them valuable defenders of your settlements, though offensive siege units like heavy artillery are stronger. Light artillery can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], where they are the cheapest units available, and they can also be produced in settlements with an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armoury[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Heavy artillery is your primary unit for [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacking settlements[COLOR_REVERT]. They can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bombard[COLOR_REVERT] the enemy defense to weaken them. Heavy artillery can be recruited in Europe, and they can also be built in settlements with a [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]magazine[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. There is one other rare heavy artillery unit: [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]mortars[\LINK][\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Mortars are elite units that may be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]foreign kings[COLOR_REVERT] if you have good relations with their colonies, just like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT]. When attacking settlements, they are even stronger than heavy artillery, because they start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_BOMBI]Explosives I[\LINK] promotion, but they truly excel in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bombarding[COLOR_REVERT] the fortifications of enemy settlements, reducing their defensive bonuses by 30% each turn. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Warriors[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Of course the Native Nations have no access to any of the above-named military units. They have their own [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]braves[\LINK][\BOLD]. These melee warriors are only available to Natives. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses against units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]jungles[\LINK]. When Native tribes are at war, they usually send masses of braves against their foes. [LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]Armed Braves[\LINK] are their gunpowder unit. Only Natives can have armed braves. These are stronger units and they also get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attack bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] of normal braves when attacking in the wilderness. This makes them particularly tough foes. They only require half as many [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]guns[COLOR_REVERT] as colonial militias, which means that Natives can equip several armed braves by trading for guns. However, they are not as strong as European colonial troops in the open.[PARAGRAPH:1]Once Natives manage to get some horses, warriors with horses become [LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]mounted braves[\LINK]. These are faster than regular braves. Mounted braves need only half the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]horses[COLOR_REVERT] to be equipped, compared to European mounted troops.[PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Armed Mounted Braves[\LINK] are the strongest units Natives can bring onto the field. They need both guns and horses, though only half what a dragoon would require. They have high combat strength and, combined with their wilderness attack bonuses, they can be a plague to colonial invaders in any terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other Melee Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wild animals[COLOR_REVERT] are melee units as well, with the same strength as non-military units like [LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIST]colonists[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioneers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]missionaries[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, or you need to defend your colonies, you will need some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] to do that for you. This game features many different kinds of military units, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each unit that has the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Attack[\LINK] other units is considered to be a military unit. .[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For Naval Units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In term of availability, military units in general fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The difference between these two groups lies in the fact that Core Units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced or equipped in the New World or recruted in Europe[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while Elite Units can only be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]other means[COLOR_REVERT], e.g. special events or diplomatic interaction with other European nations or kings. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will for the main part consist of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Military Industry[\LINK] gathers stamina. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available for European Nations in this game are: Scouts, Colonial Militia, Line Infantry, Dragoons, Cavalrymen as well as Light and Heavy Artillery. Braves, Armed Braves, Mounted Braves and Armed Mounted Braves are available for native nations only.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Veteran Soldiers[COLOR_REVERT]. That means that each of the military professions has ist own special veteran unit that serves at its best if it is put into its corresponding profession. The veteran units are the [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]seasoned Scout[\LINK], the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Infantry Soldiers[\LINK], the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_DRAGOON]Veteran Dragoon[\LINK] and the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_CAVALRY]Veteran Cavalryman[\LINK]. The [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Light Artillery and Heavy Artillery[\LINK] are units and not professions. Light and Heavy Artillery can be produced in the colonies if certain requirements are fulfilled (e.g. special buildings are required) or they can be acquired in Europe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game are: [LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Rangers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC] Native Mercenaries [\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores [\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Settler Militias[\LINK]. The Line Infantry has an exceptional position. The [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]European Line Infantry[\LINK] is an Elite Unit, which can be acquired in Europe only, whereas the Colonial Line Infantry is a military profession of the Core Units in the New World. The veteran unit is also the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Infantry Soldier[\LINK]. The Colonial Line Infantry can be hired in the New World but cannot be acquired in Europe. However, both units have the same strength. Of course the player will have the chance to get some of the units frequently, whereas some of the units are rare. In general the Elite Units will be achieved by special (diplomatic) [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Events[\LINK] with the own king, kings of other nations or native leaders as long as the player is not at war with this parties. Furthermore the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Church[\LINK] will sometimes grant some units as well in case the player is willing to declare war on a (heretical) native nation. Finally also some of the [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] will grant troops, in case they can be convinced to hook up with the own colonies.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD]Individual units gain Combat Experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK], and they can achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units gather enough Combat Experience, [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Great Generals[\LINK] may be born in your colonies, who give your units Combat Bonuses, extra Experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The different Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD] - These units require only [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] to be equipped, and they give additional [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement Speed[\LINK]. Scouts are relatively week, so they usually aren't useful in combat against units stronger than [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild Animals[\LINK]. Their main purpose is [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]Exploration[\LINK]. After they have explored the New World they can be used as stron military units (change of specialisation will be required) since they should have collected a lot of [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] in the meantime due to their journey through the New World - in case they have survived this journey.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] and [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These Elite Units can be acquired through multiple means: exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] as well as a [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Diplomatic Event[\LINK], as long as you are at war with a Native Tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may provide you with some of these units as well, when he urges you to exterminate a particular Native tribe. Conquistadores get a bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee Units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other Conquistadores), and a combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT] as well. As such, they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who employ mainly Melee units. Other disciplined European military units are generally too strong for the Conquistadores. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Ranger[\LINK][\BOLD] - Rangers are rare Elite Units that are experts in fighting in the Wilderness. They get a Combat Bonus when fighting in Forests and Jungles, both when attacking and defending. On top of that, they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Invisible[COLOR_REVERT] to nearly all enemy units (except natives, other Ranger or native mercenaries), which makes them particularly useful as Commandoes in hostile territory.[NEWLINE]Rangers can be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Events[COLOR_REVERT] in which your King offers you to buy these units, and are also provided by certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenaries[\LINK][\BOLD] - Native Mercenaries are Elite Units that can fight exceptionally well in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], just like Rangers. The difference between these two is that, while Rangers get a solid [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] in Forests both on attack and on defense, while Native Mercenaries only get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] in the Wilderness, although these are much higher than the bonuses the Ranger gets. These Attack Bonuses are equal to the attack bonuses [LINK= PROFESSION_BRAVE]Natives[\LINK] have. Native Mercenaries can be found in places like [LINK=CONCEPT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK], they can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribes[COLOR_REVERT], and they are provided by some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] as well. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Settler Militia[\LINK][\BOLD] - Though Settler Militias are technically Elite Units, as you cannot build them yourself, they are pretty weak for Gunpowder units, having only a low combat strength. They are generated when a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colony[COLOR_REVERT] feels unprotected due to a lack of military units, for which they take [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from their food stores and money from your treasury. Though Settler Militias are rather weak, they do get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defense Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] when defending a settlement, which allows them to successfully fight off weaker attacks such as Native Raids. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIAL_MILITIA]Colonial Militia[\LINK][\BOLD] - Colonial Militias are the weakest but cheapest standard military unit. They are well trained infantry troops which can be used for attack and defense. Colonial Militias are your basic Gunpowder units in the New World. Almost all colonist can adopt this profession, as long as there are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] present to equip them. They are stronger than most Melee units. In the wilderness they may have some disadvantages against native warriors, so be careful using them in the wilderness against natives until they have reached veteran status by combat! Veteran Infantry soliders (in the profession Colonial Militia) can be hired in Europe as well and some Founding Fathers will grant them as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_LINE_INFANTRY]Line Infantry[\LINK][\BOLD] - The Colonial Line Infantry is the strongest infantry unit in the game and is well trained for war. The Colonial Infantry can be hired and equipped in the colonies, since it is a profession, as far as enough weapons ([LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]muskets[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]blades[\LINK] are stored in the colony that intends to equip the infantry. The colonial infantry cannot be hired in Europe. The Colonial Line Infantry can get Veteran status after a while. However, alternatively the [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]European Line Infantry[\LINK] can be hired in Europe. The European Line Infantry is a military unit with the same strength as the Colonial Line Infantry. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoons[\LINK][\BOLD] - Dragoons are mounted infantry units. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT] are units who wage war while sitting on horseback. They are faster than other units and have the same strength as colonial militia, but they do not get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT], which makes them rather weak when not fighting in the open field. You can make Dragoons by equipping colonists with both [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK]. They get a movement bonus. Veteran Dragoons automatically get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leadership[COLOR_REVERT] Promotion, which doubles the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experience Points[COLOR_REVERT] they earn by winning Battles. So if you want to thoroughly train your soldiers in combat, letting them fight as Dragoons is an excellent method. In addition to this, Dragoons also receive a bonus when attacking [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Artillery Units[COLOR_REVERT] which makes them to be a strong unit against all artillery units. Dragoons can either be ecquipped in the colonies or they can be hired in Europe if enough money is in the treasury of the player. In the end the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cost-value ratio of a Dragoon is excellent[COLOR_REVERT] which makes them very usefull military units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Heavy Calavry[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cavalrymen are the strongest Mounted Units you can make. The Heavy Cavalry is a military profession as well. To make them, equip a colonist with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses, Guns and Blades[COLOR_REVERT]. Heavy Cavalry can be hired in Europe as well. They have a high combat strength, but they have a movement of only 1, which makes them slower than other Mounted Units. Due to their high combat strength, Cavalrymen can be useful in all kinds of Warfare, whether in the fields, attacking settlements or defending them. However, in the wilderness they may have some disadvantages against other units. .[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards [\LINK][\BOLD]and [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK][\BOLD] - These two units are very rare military units - don't hazard them! Continental Guards are Elite Units that can be acquired later in the game, as you prepare for [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK]. They are offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT], who might be inclined to make these offers if your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with their colonies is good.[NEWLINE]Continental Guards have a very high combat strength, but you recruit them with four promotions already present: [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK]. Additionally, they receive a combat bonus against other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT]. These units are very strong, and can be essential to the success of your War of Independence. Hessians are [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]European[\LINK] Elite Units that appear in great numbers in your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Expeditionary Force[COLOR_REVERT]. You can get a few of these units as well though, through some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] or as reinforcements sent by your King to conquer other colonies. Hessians do not receive defensive bonuses, but they get a combat bonus when [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT] and attacking in open fields, as well as the Veteran I, Leadership and Bayonet promotions which makes them a very strong unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Light Artillery [\LINK][\BOLD] and [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HEAVY_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Heavy Artillery[\LINK][\BOLD] - These two artillery respectively siege units are your basic artilley in the New World. Artillery ans Siege Units are units that deploy [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK] to wage war against their enemies. Except for the Light Artillery, none of them get any [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT]. Light Artillery is the cheapest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Unit[COLOR_REVERT] available, and the only one to receive Defensive Bonuses. They also receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. This makes them able defenders of your settlements, though offensive Siege Units like Heavy Artillery will usually be stronger. Light Artillery can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], where they are the cheapest units available, and they can also be produced in Settlements with an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Armory[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Heavy Artillery is your primary unit when it comes to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT]. They can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] the defenses of enemy settlements to weaken them, before moving in for the kill. Heavy Artillery can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] as well, and they can also be built in settlements with a [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]Magazine[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. There exists one other rare and heavy artillery unit: [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK][\BOLD] - Mortars are Elite Units that can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT] if you have good relations with their colonies, just like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT]. When attacking settlements, they are even stronger than Heavy Artillery, because they start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_BOMBI]Explosives I[\LINK] promotion, but they truly excel in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombarding[COLOR_REVERT] the fortifications of enemy settlements, reducing their Defensive Bonuses by 30% each turn. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Warrios[\BOLD] - Of course the Native Nations do not have any access tot he above named military units. They have their own [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Braves[\LINK][\BOLD]. These melee warriors are only available to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses when attacking units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. When native tribes are at war, they usually send swarms of countless braves to the lands of their foes. [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]Armed Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] are their gunpowder unit. Only Natives can make Armed Braves. These are stronger unitsand they also get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] of normal Braves when attacking units in the Wilderness. This can make them perticularly tough foes. They only require half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] as Colonial Militias, which means that Natives can equip several Armed Braves once they get their hands on Guns. However, they are not as strong as European colonial troops in the open field. Once Natives manage to get some Horses, they can equip warriors with horses to make [LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Mounted Braves[\LINK]. These are faster than regular Braves. Mounted Braves require only half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] to be equipped as European Mounted troops. [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Armed Mounted Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] are the strongest units Natives can bring in the field. They require both guns and horses, though only half the amounts of them that a dragoon would require. They have a high combat strength and, combined with their attack bonuses when attacking units in the wilderness, they can be a plague to colonial invaders in any terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other Melee Units[\BOLD] - [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wild Animals[COLOR_REVERT] are Melee units as well, just like non-military units like [LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIST]Colonists[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionaries[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [H1]Militäreinheiten[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Wenn man [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] führen will oder seine eigenen Siedlungen zu verteidigen, was irgendwann sicherlich der Fall ist, braucht man [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Militäreinheiten[COLOR_REVERT] um die Kämpfe auszutragen. Davon gibt es im Spiel eine beachtliche Zahl, mit unterschiedlichen Stärken und Schwächen. Jede Einheit die grundsätzlich die Fähigkeit zum [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Angriff[\LINK] hat, wird im weitesten Sinne als Militäreinheit betrachtet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dieser Eintrag ist als kurzer überblick zu den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Landeinheiten[COLOR_REVERT] gedacht. Für Schiffe lassen sich weitere Informationen im Eintrag [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Schiffe[\LINK] finden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Beschaffung von Militäreinheiten[\BOLD]In Bezug auf die Verfügbarkeit lassen sich die Truppen zunächst in zwei Kategorien unterteilen: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Haupttruppen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elitetruppen[COLOR_REVERT].Der Hauptunterschied ist der, dass die Haupttruppen durch grundlegende Mechanismen wie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kauf[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rekrutierung[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ausrüstung[COLOR_REVERT] oder auch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Produktion (z.B. bei Artillerie) [COLOR_REVERT] erlangt werden können, während Elitetruppen meist nur durch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]spezielle Ereignisse[COLOR_REVERT] erhalten werden können (z.B. Events mit dem eigenen König oder anderen Staatsoberhäuptern). Dadurch besteht der überwiegende Teil der Armee des Spielers aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Haupttruppen[COLOR_REVERT] und nur ein kleiner Teil aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elitetruppen[COLOR_REVERT], wodurch diese noch wertvoller sind und immer auch besondere Fähigkeiten haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Beispiele für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Haupttruppen[COLOR_REVERT] des Spielers sind: Scouts, Kolonialmiliz, Linieninfanterie, Dragoner, Kavallerie sowie leichte und schwere Artillerie. Es ist hier auffällig, dass es sich meist um [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Militärberufe[\LINK] handelt. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Jeder dieser Militärberufe hat eine eigene Einheit (im Grunde handelt es sich hierbei um Veteranen), die ihre jeweiligen Berufe am effektivsten beherrschen. Dazu gehören der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Scout[\LINK], der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Infanterist[\LINK], der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK] und der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_CAVALRY]Kavallerist[\LINK]. Die [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Artillerieeinheiten[\LINK] sind Einheiten und keine Berufe. Diese können daher in der Kolonie unter bestimmten Voraussetzungen produziert oder in Europa erworben werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elitetrupen[COLOR_REVERT] sind: [LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Ranger[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Ureinwohnersöldner[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Berittene Conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mörser[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessische Söldner[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Siedler Milizen[\LINK]. Eine Sonderstellung nimmt die Linieninfanterie ein. Die [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]Europäische Linieninfanterie [\LINK]zählt zu den Elitetruppen, welche nur in Europa erworben werden kann, während die koloniale [LINK=PROFESSION_LINE_INFANTRY]Linieninfanterie [\LINK]ein militärischer Beruf der Haupttruppen in der neuen Welt ist, die jedoch nur in den Kolonien ausgerüstet und nicht in Europa erworben werden kann. Natürlich kann man einige Einheiten relativ häufig erhalten, während andere sehr selten sind. Meist erhält man die Eiliteeinheiten durch besondere [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Events[\LINK] oder Interaktion mit dem eigenen König oder anderen Staatsoberhäuptern oder indianischen Stammesführern, solange man sich mit diesen nicht im Krieg befindet. Meist sind sie alle sehr stark spezialisiert. Die [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Kirche[\LINK] gewährt bisweilen ebenfalls Truppen, wenn man dafür gegen indianische Ureinwohner in den Krieg zieht. Zudem erhält man auch durch einige [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Gründerväter[\LINK] Truppen, wenn sich diese den eigenen Kolonien anschließen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE[BOLD]Kampf, Erfahrung und Generäle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Einheiten erhalten durch [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Kampf[\LINK] Erfahrung, und können dadurch auch [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Beförderungen[\LINK] erhalten. Wenn die gesamte Summe der von Einheiten gesammelten Erfahrung gewisse Schwellenwerte übersteigt, entstehen [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Grosse Generäle[\LINK] in den Kolonien. Diese geben den Einheiten denen sie sich anschliessen zusätzliche Kampfboni, weitere Erfahrungspunkte und Zugang zu besonderen Beförderungen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Die Militär-Einheiten im Einzelnen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD] - Scouts zählen nur im weitesten Sinne zu den militärischen Einheiten. Sie haben eine gewisse Stärke, damit sie bei ihren Erkundungsritten durch die Wildnis gegen wilde Tiere und andere Gefahren bestehen können. Sie benötigen [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK]. Sie sollten jedoch nicht im Kampf eingesetzt werden, sondern eignen sich am besten zur Erkundung der neuen Welt, allenfalls können sie zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonie eingesetzt werden, wenn sich dort keine anderen Militäreinheiten aufhalten. Berittene Scouts haben den Vorteil der Geschwindigkeit, da ihnen zusätzliche Bewegungspunkte zustehen, die durch Beförderungen nochmals erhöht werden können. Nach der Erkundung der neuen Welt eigenen sie sich hervorragend als Dragoner oder Kavalleristen, weil sie dann eine ganz erhebliche Anzahl an [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Beförderungen [\LINK]eingesammelt haben dürften.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] und [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Berittene Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - Conquistadores sind Militäreinheiten, die sich für eine frühe Eroberung der neuen Welt eignen. Es handelt sich um wenig disziplinierte und meist schlecht ausgebildete Truppen. Sie können gegen wilde Tiere und Krieger der Indianerstämme bestehen, gegen europäische Truppen sind sie jedoch nur bedingt einsetzbar - allenfalls wenn sie durch entsprechende Beförderungen Stärke und Erfahrung und Kampfboni gewonnen haben, sollte man sie gegen die stärkeren europäischen Truppen einsetzen. Ab und zu stößt man auf Conquistadores, wenn man [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]antike Ruinen[\LINK] durchstöbert. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Ranger[\LINK][\BOLD] - Ranger sind seltene Eliteeinheiten, die man nur durch diplomatische Interaktion mit dem König oder durch einige wenige Gründerväter erhält. Von Zeit zu Zeit fragen die Kolonisten nach militärischer Unterstützung (durch ein Event). Der König wird dann gegen entsprechende Bezahlung Ranger anbieten. Ranger haben besondere Vorteile außerhalb der Kolonie. Aufklärung und der Kampf gegen Indianer sind ihre Aufgaben. Sie sind bestens an die Wildnis gewöhnt, so dass sie auch vor anderen Truppen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]verborgen[COLOR_REVERT] bleiben. Nur andere indianische Kriege, Ranger und indianische Söldner können sie sehen. Mit den entsprechenden Beförderungen können sie natürlich auch die eigene Kolonie verteidigen, hierfür wird ihr Talent aber eigentlich verschwendet. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Indianische Söldner[\LINK][\BOLD] - Diese Einheit entspricht im Wesentlichen den Rangern, lediglich die Angriffs- und Verteidigungsboni unterscheiden sich ein wenig. Indianische Truppen erhalten höhere Angriffsboni in der Wildnis und gegen andere Indianer, wohingegen Ranger auch Defensivboni erhalten, die aber nicht ganz so hoch sind. Durch Beförderungen lässt sich dies ausgleichen. Die indianischen Söldner haben den Vorteil, dass sie häufiger zu erwerben sind. Befreundete Stämme bieten von Zeit zu Zeit diese Einheit zum Kauf an und auch in antiken Ruinen stößt man ab und zu auf sie. Sie eignen sich ebenfalls ganz besonders zur Aufklärung und Erkundung. Gegen europäische Truppen sind sie - wie auch die Ranger - aber etwas zu schwach. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Siedlermilizen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Siedlermiliz ist ein schwache Verteidigungseinheit der Kolonien. Sie können weder in Europa erworben noch in den Kolonien ausgerüstet werden. Sie entstehen, wenn der Gouverneur sie zu den Waffen ruft, d.h. im Spiel [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]entstehen[COLOR_REVERT] sie, wenn sich eine Kolonie - ab einer bestimmten Größe von Siedlern - ohne militärischen Schutz [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]unsicher[COLOR_REVERT] fühlt und keine anderen Militäreinheiten in der Kolonie vorhanden sind, die den Schutz gewährleisten kann. Die Chance liegt allerdings nicht bei 100% und da auch eine Miliz Geld kostet, benötigt der Spieler eine gewisse Summe [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Geld[COLOR_REVERT], ansonsten gibt es für einige Runden Aufruhr in der Kolonie (Produktion von Waren wird eingestellt) und es wird keine Miliz rekrutiert. Die Miliz erhält einen starken Verteidigungsbonus, solange sie sich innerhalb der eigenen Koloniegrenzen aufhält, sie sollte daher unbedingt nur als Verteidigungseinheit eingesetzt werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIAL_MILITIA]Kolonialmiliz[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Kolonialmiliz ist die schwächste, zugleich aber auch kostengünstigste richtige Truppengattung. Es handelt sich um ausgebildete Infanterietruppen, die sich sowohl für den Angriff auch andere Kolonien oder Indianerstämme eignen, als auch zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonien. Sie ist DIE Basiseinheit der kolonialen Truppen. In der Wildnis sind sie indianischen Kriegern unter Umständen unterlegen, ein Angriff führt daher nicht immer zum Sieg. Durch Beförderungen lassen sich diese Nachteile allerdings mit der Zeit ausgleichen. Es handelt sich hierbei um einen militärischen Beruf, den fast alle Kolonisten ergreifen können. Hierfür ist nur eine gewisse Anzahl von [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS] Feuerwaffen[\LINK] in der Kolonie erforderlich. Kolonialmilizen können außerdem bereits in Europa angeworben werden. Entweder man wirbt gleich den [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]erfahrenen Infanteristen[\LINK] an oder stattet einen Siedler am Kai mit den entsprechenden Waffen aus. Hierfür benötigt es allerdings etwas Kleingeld. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_LINE_INFANTRY]Linieninfantrie[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die koloniale Linieninfanterie ist die kampfstärkste Infanterieeinheit der Kolonien. Sie eignet sich besonders für den Angriff. Die koloniale Linieninfanterie kann in den Kolonien angeworben und ausgerüstet werden, wenn entsprechende Waffen, d.h. [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Feuerwaffen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] in der Kolonie vorhanden sind. Sie kann nicht in Europa angeworben werden. Hierfür kann man allerdings alternativ die [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]europäische Linieninfanterie[\LINK] anwerben. Sie entspricht von Stärke und Ausrüstung der kolonialen Variante, ist aber eine Einheit und kein Beruf. Ein Siedler im Beruf Linieninfanterie kann durch entsprechende Erfahrung im Kampf zum erfahrenen Infanteristen werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Dragoner sind im Wesentlichen berittene Infanterie. Sie haben daher auch dieselbe Kampfstärke, erhalten aber keinen Defensiv-Bonus. Sie bewegen sich zu Pferd und kämpfen zu Fuß. Ihr Vorteil ist die Schnelligkeit. In den riesigen Kolonien lassen sie sich daher schnell von A nach B verlegen und bieten so mehreren Kolonien gleichzeitig Schutz gegen Feinde aller Art. Außerdem erhalten Sie Angriffsboni beim Angriff auf feindliche Artillerieeinheiten. In Wäldern oder im Gebirge haben sie allerdings Nachteile. Ihren Vorteil im Kampf spielen sie im offenen Gelände aus. Es handelt sich hierbei um einen Militärberuf, den fast alle Kolonisten ergreifen können. Dragoner können sowohl in Europa angeworben, als auch in den Kolonien ausgerüstet werden. Hierfür sind jedoch [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Musketen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK] erforderlich. Durch Kampferfahrung stehen den Dragonern eine ganze Reihe von Beförderungen zur Verfügung. Dragoner sind unter Berücksichtigung von Kosten und Nutzen eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sehr effektive militärische Einheit[COLOR_REVERT], die sich gut zur Ausbildung von Truppen eignet. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Kavallerie[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Kavallerie ist eine schwere Kampfeinheit. Sie ähnelt den Dragonern, ist dafür kampfstärker, aber nicht so schnell unterwegs. Kavalleristen kämpfen zu Pferd. Einer solchen Kavallerieattacke hält nur wenig stand. Sie eignet sich daher besonders im Angriff gegen feindliche Infanterie und Artillerie im offenen Gelände oder zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonien. Wie die Dragoner auch hat die Kavallerie in den Wäldern oder im Gebirge allerdings Nachteile im Kampf. Es handelt sich ebenfalls um einen Militärberuf, der von fast allen Kolonisten ergriffen werden kann - die Ausrüstung ist sowohl in den Kolonien als auch in Europa möglich. Die Ausrüstung ist allerdings recht teuer. Es werden [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK] benötigt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Kontinentalgarde [\LINK][\BOLD]und [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessische Söldner[\LINK][\BOLD] - Diese beiden Elitetruppen sind im Spiel nur sehr selten anzutreffen. Es handelt sich um starke und erfahrene Infanterieeinheiten (keine Berufe), die man nur durch diplomatische Ereignisse oder Gründerväter erhalten kann. Sie starten mit starken Kampfboni. Die hessischen Söldner können zudem nur durch den König zur Verfügung gestellt werden - und zwar auch nur dann, wenn dieser einen zum Krieg gegen einen europäischen Nachbarn in der neuen Welt auffordert. Die Einheiten sind an Stärke mit den königlichen Truppen vergleichbar, so dass sie die Kerntruppe im Kampf um die [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Unabhängigkeit[\LINK] bilden können und daher nicht sinnlos geopfert werden sollten.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Leichte Artillerie [\LINK][\BOLD] und [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HEAVY_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Schwere Artillerie[\LINK][\BOLD] - Diese beiden Einheiten bilden die artilleristische Basis in den Kolonien. Während die Leichte Artillerie sich besonders zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonien eignet und gute Verteidigungsboni erhält, eignet sich die Schwere Artillerie besonders zum Angriff auf feindliche Forts und Kolonien. Durch die Fähigkeit, feindliche Verteidigung durch Bombardierung niederzukämpfen, eignet sich die Schwere Artillerie besonders dazu, der angreifenden Infanterie und Kavallerie den Weg zu ebnen. Gegen berittene Truppen im offenen Gelände ist die Artillerie sehr verwundbar, so dass sie immer durch Infanterie, Kavallerie oder andere Eliteeinheiten geschützt werden sollte. Leichte und schwere Artillerie können in Europa gegen Entgelt angeworben oder in den Kolonien ausgerüstet und hergestellt werden. Es handelt sich aber nicht um Berufe, so dass hierfür kein Siedler erforderlich ist. Die Produktion dauert allerdings eine Weile. Es hierfür besondere [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Gebäude[\LINK] erforderlich sowie eine stattliche Anzahl von [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kanonen[\LINK]. Neben der Leichten und Schweren Artillerie gibt es noch eine weitere sehr starke Artillerieeinheit, den [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mörser[\LINK][\BOLD]. - Mörser eignen sich besonders zur Bekämpfung feindlicher Verteidigungsanlagen, sind im Gelände aber genauso schwach wie andere Artillerieeinheiten und benötigen daher immer den Schutz anderer Militäreinheiten. Sie können in Europa nicht erworben und auch nicht in den Kolonien hergestellt werden. Sie werden einzig und allein durch diplomatische Beziehungen mit anderen europäischen Nationen erworben. Diese kommen nur selten vor, so dass die Einheiten sehr selten und daher besonders schützenswert sind.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Indianische Krieger[\BOLD] - Die Ureinwohner in der neuen Welt können auf die vorgenannten militärischen Einheiten selbstverständlich nicht zurückgreifen. Ihnen stehen naturgemäß ihre [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Krieger [\LINK][\BOLD]und [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Berittenen Krieger[\LINK][\BOLD] zur Verfügung. Diese haben Vorteile im Gelände außerhalb der europäischen Kolonien, sind insgesamt aber schwächer als die regulären Truppen der Europäer. Ihren Vorteil haben die Ureinwohner daher in der Anzahl. Gerade zu Beginn der Besiedlung in der Neuen Welt sollten die Europäischen Nationen sich besser zunächst nicht auf einen Krieg einlassen, wenn man noch wenig eigene Truppen besitzt. Die Ureinwohner versuchen von den Europäern Feuerwaffen zu erwerben oder sie stehlen diese bei überfällen. Damit können sie [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]bewaffnete Krieger[\LINK][\BOLD] ausrüsten oder [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Berittene Bewaffnete Krieger[\LINK][\BOLD], die stärkste Kampfeinheit der Ureinwohner, sofern Sie dazu ebenfalls Pferde zur Verfügung haben.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, or you need to defend your colonies, you will need some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] to do that for you. This game features many different kinds of military units, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each unit that has the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Attack[\LINK] other units is considered to be a military unit. .[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For Naval Units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In term of availability, military units in general fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The difference between these two groups lies in the fact that Core Units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced or equipped in the New World or recruted in Europe[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while Elite Units can only be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]other means[COLOR_REVERT], e.g. special events or diplomatic interaction with other European nations or kings. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will for the main part consist of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Military Industry[\LINK] gathers stamina. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available for European Nations in this game are: Scouts, Colonial Militia, Line Infantry, Dragoons, Cavalrymen as well as Light and Heavy Artillery. Braves, Armed Braves, Mounted Braves and Armed Mounted Braves are available for native nations only.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Veteran Soldiers[COLOR_REVERT]. That means that each of the military professions has ist own special veteran unit that serves at its best if it is put into its corresponding profession. The veteran units are the [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]seasoned Scout[\LINK], the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Infantry Soldiers[\LINK], the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_DRAGOON]Veteran Dragoon[\LINK] and the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_CAVALRY]Veteran Cavalryman[\LINK]. The [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Light Artillery and Heavy Artillery[\LINK] are units and not professions. Light and Heavy Artillery can be produced in the colonies if certain requirements are fulfilled (e.g. special buildings are required) or they can be acquired in Europe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game are: [LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Rangers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC] Native Mercenaries [\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores [\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Settler Militias[\LINK]. The Line Infantry has an exceptional position. The [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]European Line Infantry[\LINK] is an Elite Unit, which can be acquired in Europe only, whereas the Colonial Line Infantry is a military profession of the Core Units in the New World. The veteran unit is also the [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Infantry Soldier[\LINK]. The Colonial Line Infantry can be hired in the New World but cannot be acquired in Europe. However, both units have the same strength. Of course the player will have the chance to get some of the units frequently, whereas some of the units are rare. In general the Elite Units will be achieved by special (diplomatic) [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Events[\LINK] with the own king, kings of other nations or native leaders as long as the player is not at war with this parties. Furthermore the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Church[\LINK] will sometimes grant some units as well in case the player is willing to declare war on a (heretical) native nation. Finally also some of the [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] will grant troops, in case they can be convinced to hook up with the own colonies.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD]Individual units gain Combat Experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK], and they can achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units gather enough Combat Experience, [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Great Generals[\LINK] may be born in your colonies, who give your units Combat Bonuses, extra Experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The different Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD] - These units require only [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] to be equipped, and they give additional [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement Speed[\LINK]. Scouts are relatively week, so they usually aren't useful in combat against units stronger than [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild Animals[\LINK]. Their main purpose is [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]Exploration[\LINK]. After they have explored the New World they can be used as stron military units (change of specialisation will be required) since they should have collected a lot of [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] in the meantime due to their journey through the New World - in case they have survived this journey.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] and [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These Elite Units can be acquired through multiple means: exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] as well as a [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Diplomatic Event[\LINK], as long as you are at war with a Native Tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may provide you with some of these units as well, when he urges you to exterminate a particular Native tribe. Conquistadores get a bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee Units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other Conquistadores), and a combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT] as well. As such, they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who employ mainly Melee units. Other disciplined European military units are generally too strong for the Conquistadores. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Ranger[\LINK][\BOLD] - Rangers are rare Elite Units that are experts in fighting in the Wilderness. They get a Combat Bonus when fighting in Forests and Jungles, both when attacking and defending. On top of that, they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Invisible[COLOR_REVERT] to nearly all enemy units (except natives, other Ranger or native mercenaries), which makes them particularly useful as Commandoes in hostile territory.[NEWLINE]Rangers can be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Events[COLOR_REVERT] in which your King offers you to buy these units, and are also provided by certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenaries[\LINK][\BOLD] - Native Mercenaries are Elite Units that can fight exceptionally well in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], just like Rangers. The difference between these two is that, while Rangers get a solid [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] in Forests both on attack and on defense, while Native Mercenaries only get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] in the Wilderness, although these are much higher than the bonuses the Ranger gets. These Attack Bonuses are equal to the attack bonuses [LINK= PROFESSION_BRAVE]Natives[\LINK] have. Native Mercenaries can be found in places like [LINK=CONCEPT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK], they can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribes[COLOR_REVERT], and they are provided by some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] as well. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Settler Militia[\LINK][\BOLD] - Though Settler Militias are technically Elite Units, as you cannot build them yourself, they are pretty weak for Gunpowder units, having only a low combat strength. They are generated when a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colony[COLOR_REVERT] feels unprotected due to a lack of military units, for which they take [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from their food stores and money from your treasury. Though Settler Militias are rather weak, they do get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defense Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] when defending a settlement, which allows them to successfully fight off weaker attacks such as Native Raids. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIAL_MILITIA]Colonial Militia[\LINK][\BOLD] - Colonial Militias are the weakest but cheapest standard military unit. They are well trained infantry troops which can be used for attack and defense. Colonial Militias are your basic Gunpowder units in the New World. Almost all colonist can adopt this profession, as long as there are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] present to equip them. They are stronger than most Melee units. In the wilderness they may have some disadvantages against native warriors, so be careful using them in the wilderness against natives until they have reached veteran status by combat! Veteran Infantry soliders (in the profession Colonial Militia) can be hired in Europe as well and some Founding Fathers will grant them as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_LINE_INFANTRY]Line Infantry[\LINK][\BOLD] - The Colonial Line Infantry is the strongest infantry unit in the game and is well trained for war. The Colonial Infantry can be hired and equipped in the colonies, since it is a profession, as far as enough weapons ([LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]muskets[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]blades[\LINK] are stored in the colony that intends to equip the infantry. The colonial infantry cannot be hired in Europe. The Colonial Line Infantry can get Veteran status after a while. However, alternatively the [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]European Line Infantry[\LINK] can be hired in Europe. The European Line Infantry is a military unit with the same strength as the Colonial Line Infantry. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoons[\LINK][\BOLD] - Dragoons are mounted infantry units. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT] are units who wage war while sitting on horseback. They are faster than other units and have the same strength as colonial militia, but they do not get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT], which makes them rather weak when not fighting in the open field. You can make Dragoons by equipping colonists with both [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK]. They get a movement bonus. Veteran Dragoons automatically get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leadership[COLOR_REVERT] Promotion, which doubles the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experience Points[COLOR_REVERT] they earn by winning Battles. So if you want to thoroughly train your soldiers in combat, letting them fight as Dragoons is an excellent method. In addition to this, Dragoons also receive a bonus when attacking [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Artillery Units[COLOR_REVERT] which makes them to be a strong unit against all artillery units. Dragoons can either be ecquipped in the colonies or they can be hired in Europe if enough money is in the treasury of the player. In the end the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cost-value ratio of a Dragoon is excellent[COLOR_REVERT] which makes them very usefull military units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Heavy Calavry[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cavalrymen are the strongest Mounted Units you can make. The Heavy Cavalry is a military profession as well. To make them, equip a colonist with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses, Guns and Blades[COLOR_REVERT]. Heavy Cavalry can be hired in Europe as well. They have a high combat strength, but they have a movement of only 1, which makes them slower than other Mounted Units. Due to their high combat strength, Cavalrymen can be useful in all kinds of Warfare, whether in the fields, attacking settlements or defending them. However, in the wilderness they may have some disadvantages against other units. .[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards [\LINK][\BOLD]and [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK][\BOLD] - These two units are very rare military units - don't hazard them! Continental Guards are Elite Units that can be acquired later in the game, as you prepare for [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK]. They are offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT], who might be inclined to make these offers if your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with their colonies is good.[NEWLINE]Continental Guards have a very high combat strength, but you recruit them with four promotions already present: [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK]. Additionally, they receive a combat bonus against other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT]. These units are very strong, and can be essential to the success of your War of Independence. Hessians are [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]European[\LINK] Elite Units that appear in great numbers in your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Expeditionary Force[COLOR_REVERT]. You can get a few of these units as well though, through some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] or as reinforcements sent by your King to conquer other colonies. Hessians do not receive defensive bonuses, but they get a combat bonus when [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT] and attacking in open fields, as well as the Veteran I, Leadership and Bayonet promotions which makes them a very strong unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Light Artillery [\LINK][\BOLD] and [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HEAVY_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Heavy Artillery[\LINK][\BOLD] - These two artillery respectively siege units are your basic artilley in the New World. Artillery ans Siege Units are units that deploy [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK] to wage war against their enemies. Except for the Light Artillery, none of them get any [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT]. Light Artillery is the cheapest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Unit[COLOR_REVERT] available, and the only one to receive Defensive Bonuses. They also receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. This makes them able defenders of your settlements, though offensive Siege Units like Heavy Artillery will usually be stronger. Light Artillery can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], where they are the cheapest units available, and they can also be produced in Settlements with an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Armory[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Heavy Artillery is your primary unit when it comes to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT]. They can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] the defenses of enemy settlements to weaken them, before moving in for the kill. Heavy Artillery can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] as well, and they can also be built in settlements with a [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]Magazine[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. There exists one other rare and heavy artillery unit: [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK][\BOLD] - Mortars are Elite Units that can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT] if you have good relations with their colonies, just like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT]. When attacking settlements, they are even stronger than Heavy Artillery, because they start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_BOMBI]Explosives I[\LINK] promotion, but they truly excel in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombarding[COLOR_REVERT] the fortifications of enemy settlements, reducing their Defensive Bonuses by 30% each turn. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Warrios[\BOLD] - Of course the Native Nations do not have any access tot he above named military units. They have their own [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Braves[\LINK][\BOLD]. These melee warriors are only available to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses when attacking units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. When native tribes are at war, they usually send swarms of countless braves to the lands of their foes. [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]Armed Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] are their gunpowder unit. Only Natives can make Armed Braves. These are stronger unitsand they also get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] of normal Braves when attacking units in the Wilderness. This can make them perticularly tough foes. They only require half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] as Colonial Militias, which means that Natives can equip several Armed Braves once they get their hands on Guns. However, they are not as strong as European colonial troops in the open field. Once Natives manage to get some Horses, they can equip warriors with horses to make [LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Mounted Braves[\LINK]. These are faster than regular Braves. Mounted Braves require only half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] to be equipped as European Mounted troops. [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Armed Mounted Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] are the strongest units Natives can bring in the field. They require both guns and horses, though only half the amounts of them that a dragoon would require. They have a high combat strength and, combined with their attack bonuses when attacking units in the wilderness, they can be a plague to colonial invaders in any terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other Melee Units[\BOLD] - [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wild Animals[COLOR_REVERT] are Melee units as well, just like non-military units like [LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIST]Colonists[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionaries[\LINK].
