Per ulteriori informazioni su questo tipo di utile scorciatoia consulta la sezione [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE_ROUTE]Importazioni/esportazioni[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Inoltre, se hai dei cittadini automatizzati nell'insediamento, puoi decidere di accentuare determinati beni tramite questo comando. Per ulteriori informazioni consulta la sezione "Automazione dei cittadini e accentuazione nell'insediamento", più avanti.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Barra delle costruzioni[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sotto la finestra dei comandi dell'insediamento si trova la barra delle costruzioni. Mostra il numero di turni mancanti al completamento dell'attuale progetto di costruzione dell'insediamento. A sinistra della barra si trova il pulsante "Produzione accelerata", che ti permette di completare la produzione del progetto in corso quasi istantaneamente, ma a fronte di un costo elevato. Per ulteriori dettagli su "accelerare" fai riferimento alla voce [LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]produzione[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sentimento di ribellione[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Infilata tra la finestra dei beni e degli edifici c'è una barra colorata. Rappresenta la percentuale di [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]campane della libertà[\LINK] dell'insediamento, conosciuta anche come sentimento di ribellione. Questo numero, molto importante, fornisce alla colonia dei bonus alla produzione e alla difesa e determina se puoi scatenare la [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]rivoluzione[\LINK]. Se questa barra supera il 50%% in tutti i tuoi insediamenti, puoi dichiarare l'[LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]indipendenza[\LINK] dall'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] e cominciare l'ascesa finale verso la vittoria.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Automazione dei cittadini e accentuazione nell'insediamento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Solitamente assegni i coloni nell'insediamento a un ruolo specifico cliccando e trascinandoli nella schermata dell'insediamento. Quando assegni un'unità, quella continuerà a svolgere il ruolo che hai scelto fino a quando non la cambierai manualmente o deciderai di automatizzare i cittadini. Per indicare questa condizione, a fianco delle unità piazzate a mano appare l'icona di un lucchetto.[PARAGRAPH:2]Se preferisci che sia il governatore dell'insediamento a gestire la produzione di beni, puoi cliccare sul pulsante "Attiva automazione cittadini", in basso a destra nella finestra degli edifici. In questo modo permetterai al governatore di assegnare i diversi cittadini della colonia a svolgere diversi compiti, in modo di produrre i beni più redditizi. Puoi anche automatizzare unità individuali cliccando due volte sull'unità desiderata e selezionando "Automatizza" dalla lista delle professioni. Per disattivare l'automazione di tutti i tuoi cittadini puoi cliccare sul pulsante "Disattiva automazione cittadini".[PARAGRAPH:2]Se vuoi guidare le scelte del tuo governatore, puoi impostare le accentuazioni dell'insediamento. Cliccando sul comando "governatore", dell'insediamento, il pannello in alto a destra nella schermata dell'insediamento visualizzerà una lista di tutti i beni disponibili. Cliccando su uno qualsiasi di questi oggetti puoi scegliere di accentuare o de-accentuare la produzione di quel bene. Il governatore terrà conto delle tue scelte, quando dovrà decidere cosa produrre.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Interruttore evita crescita[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In alto a destra, nella schermata dell'insediamento, c'è il pulsante "Evita crescita". Se hai automatizzato i cittadini dell'insediamento, cliccando su questo pulsante dirai al governatore di evitare di aumentare ulteriormente le dimensioni dell'insediamento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Abandoning Cities[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cities may be abandoned by moving the last citizen (with Drag and Drop) out of the city. While doing so, you can assign a profession to this citizen (for example 'Scout' if horses are available). You may revert this decision before turn ends by putting the citizen (or another) back into the colony. If not, the city is destroyed at end turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]City Defenses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Building defenses in your cities will not only give defensive bonuses to your defending units. They will also allow your defenders to start an extra attack on enemies outside the cities without them being able to fight back.Infantry behind Stockades can fire on approaching enemies on land and Artillery in Citadels may fire on units on land as well as ships in range.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]ASENTAMIENTOS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Levantar un asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]El asentamiento es el corazón de tu colonia. Cualquier Colono puede construir un nuevo asentamiento. Basta con que envíes a uno de los intrépidos exploradores al lugar donde quieras construir tal asentamiento y selecciones la opción "Construir" en la lista de órdenes o pulses ["B"]. Inmediatamente, el Colono se convertirá en el primer habitante del nuevo asentamiento y empezará a generar [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK], materias primas o productos manufacturados.[PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando levantas un asentamiento, hay una serie de edificios que se construyen automáticamente. El nuevo asentamiento tendrá un [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]Ayuntamiento[\LINK], una [LINK=BUILDING_CARPENTER_SHOP]Ebanistería[\LINK] y todos los edificios de producción de productos manufacturados de nivel bajo, excepto el Polvorín y el Establo. Tendrás que construir el resto de edificios.[PARAGRAPH:2]A pesar de que, una vez construido el asentamiento, puedes llevar a los Colonos dentro y fuera de éste, como mínimo siempre tendrás que dejar a uno dentro. Si solo tienes un Colono en el asentamiento, no le podrás asignar ninguna de estas profesiones: [LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIST]Colono[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Batidor[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Soldado[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragón[\LINK] ni [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Misionero[\LINK]; porque todas implicarían dejar vacío el asentamiento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Elección del lugar[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Es de suma importancia elegir un buen emplazamiento para la colonia. Una buena localización da acceso a suficientes [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK], así como a materias primas y los recursos necesarios para aprovecharlas. Elegir la casilla en la que poner el asentamiento es clave. Dicha casilla proporcionará automáticamente [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] a tu nuevo asentamiento, así como cualquier tipo de materia prima que la casilla genere mejor sin necesidad de un Colono para que la produzca. Asentarse cerca de los recursos es siempre una buena idea, especialmente de la Plata, que no es frecuente y se aprovecha inmediatamente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ten en cuenta que no puedes levantar un asentamiento a menos de dos casillas de otro asentamiento europeo. Puedes, sin embargo, levantarlo tan cerca como quieras de un asentamiento indígena. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hacer crecer a tu asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Una vez has levantado el asentamiento, es posible que tengas la necesidad de meter en él tantos colonos como puedas. Puedes hacerlo, pero esto a menudo reduce mucho la productividad del asentamiento, ya que cada ciudadano necesita dos [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] para funcionar y seguramente no podrás producir [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] suficientes para mantener a todos tus nuevos Colonos. La clave para hacer crecer tu colonia es llevar [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]especialistas[\LINK], como [LINK=UNIT_FARMER]Agricultores expertos[\LINK] y [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]Pescadores expertos[\LINK], capaces de producir más [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] de los que consumen. ¡Con un solo [LINK=UNIT_FARMER]Agricultor experto[\LINK] o [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]Pescador experto[\LINK], un asentamiento puede mantener a varios Colonos más![PARAGRAPH:2]También puedes transportar [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] de un asentamiento a otro si tienes excedentes en cualquier parte de la colonia. Para ello has de tener un barco o una [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]Caravana de carromatos[\LINK] disponible para hacer el trabajo, pero puede ser un método excelente para mantener alimentada a tu gente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si el asentamiento no produce suficientes [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] para los ciudadanos, estos empezarán a marcharse hasta que haya suficientes [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] para la población que se haya quedado. Los ciudadanos en éxodo aparecerán fuera del asentamiento, en la pantalla principal del juego, y no podrán volver a él ni producir bienes hasta que la producción de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] crezca.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si incrementas lo suficiente la producción de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] en el asentamiento, incluso podrás crear nuevos colonos en ella. Si tus reservas llegan a 200 [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] (que, a diferencia de otros bienes, no requieren la construcción de un [LINK=BUILDING_WAREHOUSE]Almacén[\LINK]), recibirás automáticamente un nuevo [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Colono libre[\LINK] y tus reservas volverán a cero. [PARAGRAPH:2]Una vez que tengas suficientes [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK], podrás empezar a poner en marcha tu [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]economía[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Modernización del asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cuando tu colonia produzca suficientes [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] para mantener a un número de ciudadanos, el siguiente paso es empezar a construir [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]edificios[\LINK]. Los edificios son la clave para ganar, ya que te permiten producir mercancías para venderlas, unidades y armas para defenderte, así como [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Campanas de la libertad[\LINK] que te guíen hacia la [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Revolución[\LINK] y la victoria. [PARAGRAPH:2]Tu colonia empieza con un número determinado de edificios que representan la forma más primitiva de instalaciones de producción. Si realmente quieres hacer del asentamiento un centro neurálgico, deberás construir edificios modernizados. Las modernizaciones concretas dependen de lo que pretendas producir en el asentamiento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combate y asentamientos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La tuya no es la única colonia que quiere apoderarse de las riquezas del Nuevo Mundo. De vez en cuando, te encontrarás en [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] con el enemigo, y conocer los pros y contras del ataque y la defensa de asentamientos es indispensable para ganar en este tipo de conflictos. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Defensa de un asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si asignas a un colono las profesiones de [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Soldado[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragón[\LINK] o [LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Batidor[\LINK] ([LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesiones[\LINK] de combate), lo estarás enviando fuera del asentamiento para que defienda la colonia. Las unidades atacantes tendrán que luchar con todas las unidades que defiendan la colonia de este modo, así como con al menos uno de los ciudadanos de tu colonia si quieren tomarla. Los Cañones también son excelentes elementos de defensa.[PARAGRAPH:2]Por cierto, las unidades que defienden la colonia no consumen [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Sin embargo, no siempre necesitas tener a una unidad vigilando fuera de la colonia. Si sufres un ataque sin ninguna unidad fuera de la colonia y cuentas con Cañones, uno de tus ciudadanos tomará las armas automáticamente contra el atacante. Siempre que tengas Cañones y Colonos a tu disposición, estos últimos defenderán la colonia automáticamente. Cuando la colonia se quede sin cañones, un solo Colono desarmado tratará de contener el asalto. Tu asentamiento estará perdido solo después de que ese colono haya sido vencido. Esto se aplica a cualquier grupo de unidades en un apilamiento, incluyendo a las que estén fuera del asentamiento o aquellas que estén dentro de los asentamientos que intentas conquistar. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ataque a un asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]También puedes usar a las unidades asignadas a las [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesiones[\LINK] de combate para hacer la [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] contra tus enemigos. Sin embargo, debido a las muchas bonificaciones que reciben las unidades de defensa, tus unidades de ataque probablemente serán superadas cuando se aproximen a un asentamiento enemigo. La clave para tomar un asentamiento enemigo es el [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cañón[\LINK]. Esta unidad de combate suprema recibe una bonificación significativa cuando ataca asentamientos enemigos, por lo que se convierte en una pieza fundamental de cualquier asedio. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]La pantalla del asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Haciendo [double-clicking] en cualquiera de tus asentamientos, irás a su pantalla correspondiente. La pantalla de asentamiento es la más importante de la partida, porque desde ahí podrás gestionar la producción de mercancías del asentamiento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Visor de edificios[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La sección de la parte superior izquierda de la pantalla del asentamiento es el visor de edificios. Aquí es posible ver todos los edificios que se encuentren en el asentamiento, así como cuál de tus ciudadanos está trabajando en su interior en este momento y qué cantidad está dando éste de un producto específico. [PARAGRAPH:2]Haciendo [left-clicking] en uno de tus Colonos y arrastrándolo a uno de los edificios del visor de edificios o a una casilla en la ventana de terreno (véase más adelante), podrás asignar un trabajo al Colono que haya en ese edificio o casilla. También puedes hacer [double-click] en cualquiera de ellos para que aparezca el menú de elección de profesiones, que te permitirá asignar cualquier [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] disponible a ese colono.[PARAGRAPH:2]Puedes expulsar a un Colono del asentamiento haciendo [double-clicking] en él y escogiendo la profesión "Colono" en el menú de elección de [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesiones[\LINK]. Puedes hacer lo mismo si arrastras a una unidad del visor de edificios a la sección "Guarnición".[PARAGRAPH:2]Ten en cuenta que algunas [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesiones[\LINK] requieren que el asentamiento tenga a mano cierto número de mercancías: generalmente Armas, Caballos o Herramientas. Si el asentamiento no cuenta con los productos necesarios, no podrás asignar a las unidades dicha [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK]. [PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando asignas una profesión a una unidad, la limitas a ese cometido. Esto quiere decir que tu colono no cambiará de profesión sin tu supervisión. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ventana del terreno[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]En la parte superior derecha de la pantalla del asentamiento está la ventana del terreno. Aquí es posible ver las ocho casillas que rodean el asentamiento. Puedes poner a trabajar a tus colonos en esas casillas haciendo [left-clicking] en el Colono que desees del visor de edificios y arrastrándolo a la casilla del terreno en la que quieres que trabaje. Si haces [double-clicking] en un colono que ya esté trabajando en una casilla, podrás cambiar lo que esté recolectando en ella.[PARAGRAPH:2]Recuerda que no tienes por qué poner a trabajar una unidad en la misma casilla del asentamiento (de hecho, no puedes hacerlo): el asentamiento recibe el rendimiento de esa casilla de forma automática. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Visor de mercancías[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Debajo del visor de edificios se encuentra el de mercancías. Esta barra muestra todas las mercancías disponibles en la partida de Colonization, así como cuántas de cada tipo están en el asentamiento seleccionado, además del precio de venta y compra en [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] si mantienes el cursor sobre éstas. [PARAGRAPH:2]Debajo de cada icono de mercancía hay dos números. El número superior muestra la cantidad de cada mercancía que hay actualmente en el asentamiento. Debajo, está el ritmo de producción neto de cada artículo en concreto. Si este número es positivo, produces más bienes de los que consumes. Si es negativo, consumes más de lo que produces.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si haces clic en la imagen de cualquier mercancía del visor y la arrastras a un barco o una Caravana de carromatos de la pantalla de transporte (véase más adelante), podrás cargar cualquier unidad de transporte que esté en la misma casilla del asentamiento.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Visor de construcción[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Este visor muestra todos los edificios, unidades y puntos de Padres fundadores que el asentamiento puede construir en ese momento. Si pulsas en un elemento, se convertirá en el proyecto actual del asentamiento. Verás cuántos turnos tienen que pasar exactamente antes de que esté listo el proyecto si seleccionas la opción "Construir" en los controles del asentamiento (véase más adelante).[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Visor de transportes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Este visor muestra todas las unidades de transporte que ocupan en cada momento la misma casilla del asentamiento. Desde aquí puedes arrastrar y cargar en transportes navales cualquier tipo de mercancías y unidades del asentamiento. Si mantienes pulsada [Shift] mientras arrastras y sueltas podrás especificar qué cantidad exacta de mercancía deseas transportar.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Guarnición[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La guarnición muestra las unidades estacionadas actualmente en la misma casilla que tu asentamiento, en la pantalla principal del juego. Puedes arrastrar una unidad del visor de edificios a la guarnición para sacarla del asentamiento.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Controles del asentamiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Justo debajo de la ventana del terreno están los tres botones de control del asentamiento. Estos objetos te permiten poner a punto los trabajos en tu asentamiento. Los tres botones de control son "Mapa", "Construir" y "Gobernante".[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mapa[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si haces clic en este botón de control, aparecerá el minimapa para que te hagas una idea de qué lugar ocupa el asentamiento en la colonia y en el mundo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Construir[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si haces clic en el control "Construir", verás la cola de construcción del edificio en ese momento. Aunque el asentamiento producirá automáticamente una pequeña cantidad de productos para que los proyectos estén acabados a tiempo, deberás asignarle la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_CARPENTER]Carpintero[\LINK] a un Colono y asegurarte de que cuenta con suministro continuo de Madera.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [BOLD]Gobernante[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Este botón te permite elegir cualquier mercancía que quieras importar o exportar del asentamiento. Consulta el artículo [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE_ROUTE]Importación y exportación[\LINK] para conocer más detalles sobre estos atajos que te ahorrarán tiempo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Además, si tienes ciudadanos automatizados en el asentamiento, mediante este control podrás elegir las mercancías para favorecer. Para más información, consulta el apartado "Favorecimiento en la automatización de los ciudadanos y de los asentamientos", más adelante.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Barra de construcción[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Debajo de la ventana de controles del asentamiento se encuentra la barra de construcción. Esta barra indica el número de turnos que quedan hasta que se complete el proyecto de construcción en curso del asentamiento. En el extremo izquierdo de la barra se encuentra el botón "Acelerar la producción", que te permite completar el proyecto en curso casi al instante, pero a un coste importante. Para obtener más detalles sobre la aceleración, consulta el artículo de [LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]Producción[\LINK] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sentimiento de rebelión[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Entre los visores de mercancías y de edificios hay una barra de brillantes colores. Representa el porcentaje de [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Campanas de la libertad[\LINK] del asentamiento, su "sentimiento de rebelión". Este número tan importante proporciona a la colonia bonificaciones a la producción y la defensa del asentamiento, y determina si puedes iniciar una [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Revolución[\LINK]. Si la barra está por encima del 50%% en todos los asentamientos, puedes declararte [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]independiente[\LINK] de [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] e iniciar el ascenso final hacia la victoria.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Favorecimiento en la automatización de los ciudadanos y de los asentamientos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Normalmente, asignas cometidos específicos a los Colonos de tus asentamientos haciendo clic y arrastrándolos por la pantalla del asentamiento. Cuando asignas una unidad personalmente, dicha unidad permanecerá en el cometido que le hayas asignado hasta que la cambies o elijas automatizar a tus ciudadanos. Para indicar esto, aparecerá el icono de un candado al lado de las unidades que hayas puesto a mano.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si prefieres que el Gobernante del asentamiento gestione la producción de mercancías, haz clic en el conmutador "Activar la automatización de los ciudadanos", en la parte inferior derecha del visor de edificios. Esto le permitirá asignar a los ciudadanos de la colonia a diversos cometidos en el asentamiento para producir las mercancías más provechosas que haya disponibles. También puedes asignar unidades sueltas a la automatización si haces doble clic en la unidad deseada y seleccionas "Automatizar" en la lista de profesiones. Para quitar a todos los ciudadanos de la automatización, puedes hacer clic en el conmutador "Desactivar la automatización de los ciudadanos".[PARAGRAPH:2]Si prefieres orientar las elecciones del Gobernante, puedes configurar los favorecimientos del asentamiento. Si haces clic en el control "Gobernante" del asentamiento, el panel superior derecho de la pantalla del asentamiento mostrará una lista de todas las mercancías disponibles. Si haces clic en cualquiera de esos elementos, puedes optar entre favorecer o desfavorecer la producción de la mercancía elegida. El Gobernante tendrá esas elecciones en cuenta cuando decida qué se ha de producir.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Conmutador de evitar el crecimiento[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]En la parte superior derecha de la pantalla del asentamiento se encuentra el conmutador para restringir el crecimiento. Si has automatizado a los ciudadanos de ese asentamiento, hacer clic en este pequeño botón le dirá a tu Gobernante que evite aumentar más el tamaño del asentamiento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Abandoning Cities[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cities may be abandoned by moving the last citizen (with Drag and Drop) out of the city. While doing so, you can assign a profession to this citizen (for example 'Scout' if horses are available). You may revert this decision before turn ends by putting the citizen (or another) back into the colony. If not, the city is destroyed at end turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]City Defenses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Building defenses in your cities will not only give defensive bonuses to your defending units. They will also allow your defenders to start an extra attack on enemies outside the cities without them being able to fight back.Infantry behind Stockades can fire on approaching enemies on land and Artillery in Citadels may fire on units on land as well as ships in range.

TEXT.English: [H1]SHIPS[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Naval Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A significant part of "We The People" game action takes place at [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sea[COLOR_REVERT]. You need ships to move goods and [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]units[\LINK], seek out [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]shipwrecks[\LINK], discover new islands and continents, gather [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_WHALE_BLUBBER]whale blubber[\LINK], sink enemy ships; and trade with [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK], the [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] and other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]colonial powers[\LINK]. There are eighteen different ships in the game for these various tasks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ships' Cargo Capacity[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Many of the ships have one or more [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cargo slots[COLOR_REVERT]. These [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]transport[\LINK] vessels usually can carry both goods and units, though only goods can be sold in Europe, Africa or Port Royal.[PARAGRAPH:1]Every transport ship has a unique cargo capacity. For an overview of all ships, see below.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Movement and Combat Strength[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Besides cargo capacity, naval units also have [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]combat strength[\LINK] as well as a certain number of [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]movement points[\LINK] (MPs). Some ships have other special abilities. These differences determine the function of each type of ship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Building Ships[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several ways of obtaining ships. Many can be bought in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT], and many can be built in your coastal [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlements[\LINK] as well. They may also be taken as prizes by stronger military vessels.[PARAGRAPH:1]To build ships, your settlement must fulfill several conditions.[PARAGRAPH:1]First of all, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]harbour building[COLOR_REVERT] has to be present. The [LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT]fishing boat[\LINK] only needs a [LINK=BUILDING_DOCK]dock[\LINK]. Most merchant ships, [LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT]whaling boats[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SLOOP]sloops[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]privateers[\LINK] need a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]drydock[\LINK]; and the warships, the [LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]galleon[\LINK] and the [LINK=UNIT_WEST_INDIAMAN]West Indiaman[\LINK] can't be built without a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]shipyard[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Secondly, many resources go into building ships, in addition to basic [LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]production[\LINK]. Which resources and how much of each varies from ship to ship, but the resources most often needed are [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]tools[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]blades[\LINK].[NEWLINE][H2]TYPES OF SHIPS[\H2][NEWLINE][BOLD]Merchant Ships[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant ships[COLOR_REVERT] are vessels designed for transportation and [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]trade[\LINK]. They often have generous cargo space, but are weak in combat.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL][BOLD]Caravel[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Caravels are the weakest trading vessels, but also the cheapest. They have 5 MPs, but only 2 cargo spaces, and they have a combat strength of 20. They are primarily useful for early [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]exploration[\LINK] and trade. Later in the game they are less efficient due to limited cargo space and, because they are weak, they often need to be protected against pirates.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_FLUYT][BOLD]Fluyt[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Fluyts are slightly more expensive than caravels. They have a low combat strength and are slower, but they have a better cargo space of 3. Like caravels, fluyts are useful as cheap trade vessels, when you're not in a hurry.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CARAVELA_REDONDA][BOLD]Caravela Redonda[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Caravela redondas are more expensive than fluyts and caravels. They have 3 cargo slots, 5 MPs and a combat strength of 22 as well. In addition to this, they can attack other vessels, although their low combat strength doesn't make them useful as warships.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CARRACK][BOLD]Carrack[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Carracks are slow but efficient merchant ships. Though they only have 4 MPs, they have four cargo slots. This can be a huge advantage when trading with native villages, who usually offer several interesting goods at once, using one cargo slot each. Like caravelas redondas, carracks can attack other vessels, but they are still relatively weak.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_MERCHANTMAN][BOLD]Merchantman[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Merchantmen are efficient trading vessels at an average cost, either when purchased in Europe or when built in a settlement. They have 4 MPs and 4 cargo lots, and they can form the backbone of your merchant fleet. They are not very strong though, and need fighting ships to protect them from pirates or other enemy warships.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_BRIGANTINE][BOLD]Brigantine[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Brigantines have the same amount of MPs and cargo slots as merchantmen, but they are much stronger. They have a strength of 28 and, in addition to that, they receive a defense bonus against pirates. This makes it a much safer transport vessel than the merchantman and, where pirates are very active, they are a very good alternative.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_WEST_INDIAMAN][BOLD]West Indiaman[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The West Indiaman is the strongest merchant ship available. It offers 5 cargo slots and has 5 MPs, making it a very versatile transport unit and, in addition to that, it has a combat strength of 35, which makes it effective as a warship as well.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_GALLEON][BOLD]Galleon[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]With 6 cargo slots, galleons are the ultimate merchant vessels. They are the only ships that can carry [LINK=CONCEPT_CHANGES_TO_TREASURES]treasures[\LINK] to Europe, though only two at a time. They are relatively strong and can attack and sink weaker ships, and put up a worthy fight against pirates.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Military Vessels[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several strong warships in the game. These can engage in naval battles to establish your supremacy at sea, or they can protect your shipping lanes against pirates. Apart from the sloop and the Man-o-War, none of them have any cargo slots, so you can't use them as transport vessels.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_SLOOP][BOLD]Sloop[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The sloop is the fastest ship in the game. It is cheap and primarily useful as a naval scout because, with a few promotions, it explores uncharted oceans rapidly. It has the ability to attack but won't stand much of a chance against pirates or larger warships. It also has 1 cargo slot, so it can move units quickly from one landmass to another while evading stronger warships.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CORVETTE][BOLD]Corvette[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Corvettes are fast warships that are specialized in hunting pirates. They receive a large attack bonus against all pirate vessels. They are also stronger and faster than most merchant vessels, so they can be a scourge for your enemies' trade routes. They aren't much of a threat against the larger warships though.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE][BOLD]Frigate[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Frigates are as fast as corvettes, but they are slightly stronger. They function as all-round warships, useful both for pirate hunting and in a battle fleet.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE][BOLD]Ship of the Line[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Ships of the Line are the strongest warships you can buy or build. With a combat strength of 55 they are much stronger than frigates, but they are also slower. If you want to put a dent in the [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK]'s fleet during the [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]War of Independence[\LINK], ships of the line are your only option.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR][BOLD]Man-o-War[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Man-o-Wars are the strongest warships in the game, with a combat strength of no less than 65. They are mainly available to your King who uses their 4 cargo slots to carry the Royal Army to your shores. Only experienced ships of the line stand a chance against these formidable warships.[PARAGRAPH:1]Though you do not have any way to build Man-o-Wars yourself, there are certain [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]random events[\LINK] that can deliver one or two to you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pirates and Smugglers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You may also want ships that can ignore the treaties you have made with another nations and your own King. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pirates[COLOR_REVERT] can attack ships of other nations without having to declare [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]war[\LINK] and, if they are successful, they can capture valuable cargo as well.[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Smugglers[COLOR_REVERT] are able to sell goods in Africa or Europe without having to pay taxes. They do take a small payment though for bribery.[PARAGRAPH:1]Pirates and smugglers can only carry goods, not units. For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER][BOLD]Privateer[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The Privateer is a pirate ship that can be built in your settlements or bought in Europe. They have 5 MPs and a visibility bonus, and are experts in chasing smaller vessels and sinking them, but they will have a hard time going up against the stronger merchant ships such as the West Indiaman. They have 2 cargo slots to store their stolen loot.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE][BOLD]Pirate Frigate[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Pirate frigates are stronger than privateers, but they have one cargo slot less. They can sink any merchant vessel, and even stand a chance against some warships. They can be purchased only in Port Royal.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP][BOLD]Smuggling Ship[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The smuggling ship is the only smuggler in the game. They can be bought only in Port Royal. They are small and do not stand a chance against any naval attack, so you must use stealth and subterfuge to reap the rewards of smuggling.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gathering Boats[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are two [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]gathering boats[COLOR_REVERT] available in the game. These vessels can go to a bonus ocean resource and harvest fish or whale blubber from that plot. For information about how this works, see [LINK=CONCEPT_WHALING]Whaling and Fishing[\LINK].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT][BOLD]Fishing Boat[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Fishing boats can gather [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] from any bonus resource on the high sea that increases food production. They are the weakest ships in the game, but cheap to build, with only a dock needed.[PARAGRAPH:1]Due to their weakness, they are very vulnerable to attack by pirates or sea animals.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT][BOLD]Whaling Boat[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Whaling boats are the only way in the game to capture [LINK=YIELD_WHALE_BLUBBER]whale fat[\LINK]. This can only be harvested from the [LINK=BONUS_WHALE]sperm whales[\LINK] resource. Although slightly stronger than fishing boats, they are are still quite vulnerable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sea Animals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]On the ocean you can also encounter [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]sea animals[\LINK] of various kinds. They are weak, and most ships won't have much to fear from them, but they can be a hazard to fishing boats, whaling boats, caravels and fluyts.
TEXT.French: [H1]SHIPS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravels[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fluyts[COLOR_REVERT] are the most basic merchant ships: Caravels are slightly faster, fluyts can transport more cargo. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Merchantmen[COLOR_REVERT] are better merchant ships: They can carry more cargo than fluyts while still being as fast as caravels.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While these merchant ships can only defend themselves when attacked, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleons[COLOR_REVERT] are real all-purpose ships: They can be used to transport cargo and can attack enemy vessels. While carracks are slow and lacking military strength, they are cheap to build. Galleons on the other hand can carry more cargo than any other ship (including [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Treasure[COLOR_REVERT]) and can survive many naval actions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frigates[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are real warships: While frigates are fast, ships of the line are the most powerful warships of the colonial fleet. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Man-o-War[COLOR_REVERT], ruler of the seas, is Europe's most powerful ship and only available to the European monarchs and their expeditionary forces. Their design is a closely guarded secret, meaning no colony will ever be able to build one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Merchant ships can be built in any settlement with a drydock. All-purpose ships and warships require a shipyard. The amount of tools required for the construction of ships depends on the cargo space of a ship. The faster a ship type is, the more cloth is required to build it. Powerful ships require more guns to build than less powerful ships.
TEXT.German: [H1]Schiffen[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Seeeinheiten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ein Grossteil des Spieles geschieht auf dem Meer. Der Transport von Gütern und Einheiten von und nach [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] und [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK], die Untersuchung von [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]Schiffswracks[\LINK], die Entdeckung neuer Kontinente und Inseln, das Sammeln von [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Nahrung[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_WHALE_BLUBBER]Walspeck[\LINK] durch [LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT]Fischerboote[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT]Walfänger[\LINK], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piraterie[COLOR_REVERT] oder auch der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kampf gegen Piraten[COLOR_REVERT] und vieles mehr. Hierfür stehen dem Spieler [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]achtzehn unterschiedliche Schiffstypen[COLOR_REVERT] zur Verfügung. Natürlich unterscheiden diese sich alle in ihren Fähigkeiten, Stärken und Schwächen, wie auch in ihren Kauf- und Baukosten bzw. Bauvoraussetzungen. Details zu allen findet man im Bereich 'Einheiten' der Colopädie. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bau von Schiffen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der Bau von Schiffen benötigt je nach Schiffstyp unterschiedliche Mengen an [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kannonen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Eisenwaren[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Seilen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Segeltuch[\LINK] und manchmal auch [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK]. Je nach Schiffstyp sind auch unterschiedliche [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ausbaustufen des Hafens[COLOR_REVERT] notwendig.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Schiffstypen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karavellen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fluyten[COLOR_REVERT] sind die einfachsten Handelsschiffe: Karavellen sind etwas schneller, Fluyten können etwas mehr Güter transportieren. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Westindienfahrer[COLOR_REVERT] sind bereits bessere Handelsschiffe: Sie können soviele Güter transportieren, wie eine Fluyt und sind dennoch noch so schnell wie die Karavelle.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Während diese Handelsschiffe nur zur Verteidiung fähig sind, können [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karacken[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleonen[COLOR_REVERT] auch angreifen und sind somit Allzweckschiffe. Karacken sind zwar langsam und vergleichsweise schwach, dafür aber relativ günstig und einfach zu bauen. Galleonen andererseits können mehr Güter als jedes andere Schiff transportieren und auch [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schätze[COLOR_REVERT] transportieren.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fregatten[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Linienschiffe[COLOR_REVERT] sind echte Kriegsschiffe. Fregatten sind vergleichsweise schnell, aber Linienschiffe sind die mächtigsten Kriegsschiffe der Kolonien. Das [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Königliche Linienschiff[COLOR_REVERT], Herrscher der See, ist Europas mähctigstes Schiff und steht üblicherweise nur den Königen zur Verfügung. Der Bau in den Kolonien ist nicht möglich, aber es gibt sehr seltene Gelegenheiten, bei denen man vom König ein solches Schiff bekommen kann.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Handelschiffe benötigen zum Bau ein Trockendock, Allzweckschiffe und Kriegsschiffe bereits eine Schiffswerft.

[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Merchantmen[COLOR_REVERT] are better merchant ships: They can carry more cargo than fluyts while still being as fast as caravels.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While these merchant ships can only defend themselves when attacked, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleons[COLOR_REVERT] are real all-purpose ships: They can be used to transport cargo and can attack enemy vessels. While carracks are slow and lacking military strength, they are cheap to build. Galleons on the other hand can carry more cargo than any other ship (including [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Treasure[COLOR_REVERT]) and can survive many naval actions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frigates[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are real warships: While frigates are fast, ships of the line are the most powerful warships of the colonial fleet. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Man-o-War[COLOR_REVERT], ruler of the seas, is Europe's most powerful ship and only available to the European monarchs and their expeditionary forces. Their design is a closely guarded secret, meaning no colony will ever be able to build one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Merchant ships can be built in any settlement with a drydock. All-purpose ships and warships require a shipyard. The amount of tools required for the construction of ships depends on the cargo space of a ship. The faster a ship type is, the more cloth is required to build it. Powerful ships require more guns to build than less powerful ships.

TEXT.English: Servants, Criminals and Slaves
TEXT.French: Engagés, bagnards et esclaves
TEXT.German: Schuldknechte, Kriminelle und Sklaven

TEXT.Spanish: Servants, Criminals and Slaves

TEXT.English: [H1]SERVANTS, CRIMINALS AND SLAVES[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forced Labour[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To build up the [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]economy[\LINK] of your colonies, you will need many [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]colonists[\LINK] for all the dirty work, but training or recruiting [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]experts[\LINK] can be expensive and time-consuming. Fortunately for the enterprising governor there is a cheaper, faster, but somewhat less ethical option: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]forced labour[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]There are four different types of colonist in this game who do forced labour: [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]indentured servants[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]petty criminals[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African slaves[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native slaves[\LINK]. Each of these groups has different strengths and weaknesses, and each is obtained through different means.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working with Forced Labour Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlements[\LINK] forced labour units all work best when assigned to professions that gather raw materials from the fields, like [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]farmers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER]hunters[\LINK]. Each of them gets a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]production penalty[COLOR_REVERT] when working inside a building. Some professions are not available at all to forced labour units, and most of them can't be trained in Native villages. Indentured servants can, however, learn a specialty through the [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]education[\LINK] system but, because they receive a penalty when producing [LINK=YIELD_EDUCATION]education[\LINK] as well, this may take a very long time. Slaves, Native or African, cannot enter education buildings to learn a specialty.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing, Revolting and Gaining Freedom[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Being unhappy with their situation, forced labour units often attempt to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]flee[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]revolt[COLOR_REVERT]. If they succeed they leave the city, cross your borders and wander aimlessly through the wilderness as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]independent[COLOR_REVERT] units. They will continue to do so until you send a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]military unit[COLOR_REVERT] to pursue and fight them, after which they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]captured[COLOR_REVERT] and join your colonies again. Make haste, however. If your [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European neighbours[\LINK] get to the escaped unit first, they can claim it for their own.[PARAGRAPH:1]Forced labour units can only flee or revolt once they're set to work in a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]settlement[COLOR_REVERT], so one way to keep them from taking flight is by equipping them with [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]tools[\LINK] and putting them to work as [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioneers[\LINK], a profession available to indentured servants and petty criminals, but not to slaves who are kept under stricter control.[PARAGRAPH:1]Some of these units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]freed[COLOR_REVERT] if they've worked a long time. It doesn't matter if they worked in a settlement or outside as pioneers; in both cases there is the possibility that they will become Free. If this happens, the unit is changed into a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]free colonist[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]converted Native[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_FREED_SLAVE]freed slave[\LINK]. This event happens by random chance, so there is no way of predicting when a particular unit will become free.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Indentured Servants[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured servants[\LINK] are the only one among these four groups who can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. They are the cheapest colonists available there, and they also appear on the docks as [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]immigrants[\LINK]. Of all these four groups, indentured servants are the least likely to run away, and the most likely to earn freedom at some point. Their production penalty when put to work inside a building is also smaller than the penalty of the other three units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Indentured servants are also the only forced labour unit who can be sent into [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] villages to be trained as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]experts[COLOR_REVERT], just like free colonists and [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]converted Natives[\LINK]. They also can be given military professions, as well as the [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]missionary[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Petty Criminals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty criminals[\LINK] are the lowest members of the social ladder in Europe, and they are sent by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] to the New World as a form of punishment for minor crimes. Every once in a while the King will contact you with the offer to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]buy[COLOR_REVERT] a few of them for a very [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]low price[COLOR_REVERT], much lower even than indentured servants and, once it's paid, they arrive immediately in your colonies without having to be transported from Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]However petty criminals are even less eager to work for you than indentured servants are, which is why they flee more often. It's also much harder for them to gain their freedom.[PARAGRAPH:1]Furthermore they cannot be trained in Native villages, and their penalty for working inside a building is higher. They cannot take up [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]military professions[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]missionary[COLOR_REVERT] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]African Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African slaves[\LINK] can be purchased for particularly low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], while the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] occasionally offers you African slaves.[PARAGRAPH:1]African slaves are good workers, and they get a production bonus of +1 for all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]raw materials[COLOR_REVERT]. They do not have much use apart from that. They cannot become missionaries or military units, and they often flee. Like criminals and servants, African slaves can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]earn their freedom [COLOR_REVERT]by hard work to become [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]freed slaves[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native slaves[\LINK] function exactly like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]African slaves[COLOR_REVERT] in terms of production bonuses and penalties, likelihood to flee and the long wait to become free. They are obtained in quite different ways, however.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sometimes a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native tribe[COLOR_REVERT] may offer to sell their prisoners of war to you. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native raids[COLOR_REVERT] can also go horribly wrong for the raiders and, if they are captured, they become slaves as well. Finally, if you are at [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]war[\LINK] with a Native nation and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]raze[COLOR_REVERT] one of their settlements, there is also a chance of obtaining a slave, if there are enough survivors to be enslaved.

TEXT.German: [H1]Schuldknechte, Kleinkriminelle und Sklaven[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Zwangsarbeit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um die [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Wirtschaft[\LINK] der Kolonien aufzubauen, wird eine grosse Menge an Arbeitskraft in Form von [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Kolonisten[\LINK] benötigt um all die schwere Arbeit zu erledigen. Aber Ausbildung oder Rekrutierung von [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Experten[\LINK] ist teuer und zeitaufwendig. Glücklicherweise gibt es aber auch für den aufstrebenden Gouverneur eine billiger und schnellere Möglichkeit Arbeitskräfte zu beschaffen, auch wenn diese nicht ganz so ethisch korrekt ist: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zwangsarbeit[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]Im Spiel gibt es verschiedene Formen der Zwangsarbeiter: [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknechte[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminelle[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Afrikanische Sklaven[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Versklavte Ureinwohner[\LINK]. Jede diese Gruppen hat individuelle Stärken und Schwächen und ist über unterschiedliche Wege erhältlich.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Funktionsweise der Zwangsarbeit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Zwangsarbeiter werden in [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlungen[\LINK] am Besten zum Sammeln von Rohstoffen eingesetzt. In Berufen wie [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]Bauer[\LINK] oder [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER]Jäger[\LINK]. In Berufen, die in Gebäuden ausgeführt werden, haben diese Einheiten meist [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Produktionsabzüge[COLOR_REVERT]. Einige Berufe sind für Zwangsarbeiter auch komplett gesperrt. Meistens können sie auch nicht in Ureinwohnerdörfer zu Spezialisten ausgebildet werden. Theoretisch können sie jedoch das [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Bildungssystem[\LINK] nutzen, produzieren aber aufgrund ihrer Produktionsabzüge sehr wenig [LINK=YIELD_EDUCATION]Bildung[\LINK] und brauchen daher meist sehr lange.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Flucht und Erhalt der Freiheit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Unzufrieden mit ihrer Situation versuchen Zwangsarbeiter oft die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flucht[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]revoltieren[COLOR_REVERT]. Dann verschwinden sie aus der Stadt und wandern ziellos ausserhalb der Grenzen als unabhängige Einheiten herum. Eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Militäreinheit[COLOR_REVERT] kann dann hinter ihnen her geschickt werden, um sie in einem Kampf zu besiegen und wieder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]einzufangen[COLOR_REVERT]. Dann kann man sie wieder wie zuvor in der Stadt einsetzen. Ein Entflohener kann natürlich auch von einer [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]rivalisierenden Kolonialmacht[\LINK] eingefangen werden.[NEWLINE]Die Flucht geschieht nur, wenn die Einheit innerhalb einer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siedlung[COLOR_REVERT] eingesetzt wird. Wird ein Zwangsarbeiter beispielsweise als [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionier[\LINK] eingesetzt, wie es bei Schuldknechten oder Kriminellen möglich ist, bei Sklaven jedoch nicht, geschieht dies nicht.[PARAGRAPH:1]Einige Zwangsarbeiter können auch ihre [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freiheit erlangen[COLOR_REVERT] wenn sie lange und hart arbeiten. Der Beruf, ob innerhalb einer Siedlung oder ausserhalb, spielt dabei keine Rolle. Wenn dies geschieht, verwandelt sich der Zwangsarbeiter in einen [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Freien Kolonisten[\LINK] oder [LINK=CONVERTED_NATIVE]Konvertierten Ureinwohner[\LINK] oder [LINK=FREED_SLAVE]Befreiten Sklaven[\LINK]. Dies geschieht zufällig, aber mit steigender Wahrscheinlichkeit über die Zeit. Der genaue Zeitpunkt kann jedoch nicht vorhergesagt werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Schuldknechte[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknechte[\LINK] können in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] rekrutiert werden. Sie sind die günstigsten Kolonisten und erscheinen oft auch als [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigranten[\LINK] am Dock. Von allen Zwangsarbeitern haben sie die geringste Wahrscheinlichkeit zu fliehen und die höchste um zum Freien Kolonisten zu werden. Ihr Produktionsabzug ist auch eher gering.[PARAGRAPH:1]Schuldknechte sind auch die einzigen Zwangsarbeiter, die in Dörfern der [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] ausgebildet werden können. Sie können auch Militärberufe annehmen oder [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]Missionare[\LINK] werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kleinkriminelle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminelle[\LINK] stehen auf der tiefsten Stufe der gesellschaftlichen Leiter und werden gelegentlich vom [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] als Bestrafung in die neue Welt geschickt. Von Zeit zu Zeit bietet der König den Kolonien solche Kleinkriminellen zum [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kauf[COLOR_REVERT]. Der Preis ist meist sehr sehr günstig. Sie erscheinen dann direkt in den Kolonien.[PARAGRAPH:1]Kleinkriminelle sind über dieses vorgehen jedoch meist sehr verärgert und tendieren daher recht schnell zur Flucht oder Revolte. Auch ist es bei ihnen deutlich seltener, dass sie zum Freien Kolonisten werden, als bei den Schuldknechten.[NEWLINE]Eine Ausbildung zum Spezialisten in einem Ureinwohnerdorf ist nicht möglich. Ihre Produktionsabzüge bei Berufen in Gebäuden sind sehr deutlich. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Afrikanische Sklaven[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Afrikanische Sklaven[\LINK] können sehr günstig in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] gekauft werden. Gelegentlich bietet auch der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]König[COLOR_REVERT] einige Afrikanische Sklaven zum Kauf an.[PARAGRAPH:1]Afrikanische Sklaven sind sehr gute Feldarbeiter und Minenarbeiter. In fast allen Berufen für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rohmaterialien[COLOR_REVERT] erhalten sie einen kleinen Bonus. Ansonten gibt es für sie wenige sinnvolle Einsatzzwecke. Sie können keine Militärberuf annehmen, keine Pioniere werden und auch nicht als Missionar tätig sein. Aufgrund der sehr schlechten Behandlung, die ihnen durch die Versklavung zu teil wurde, flüchten oder revoltieren sie auch oft. Wie bei Schuldknechten und Kleinkriminellen, ist es ihnen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]möglich ihre Freiheit durch harte Arbeit zu erlangen, dies dauert jedoch länger[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ureinwohnersklaven[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Ureinwohnersklaven[\LINK] verhalten sich fast identische, wie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Afrikanische Sklaven[COLOR_REVERT], was Produktion, Berufe, Flucht, Revolte oder Fähigkeit zur Erlangung der Freiheit angeht. Man erhählt sie jedoch durch ganz andere Wege.[NEWLINE]Gelegentlich verkauft ein befreundeter [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stamm von Ureinwohnern[COLOR_REVERT] den Kolonien seine Kriegsgefangenen. Bei [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ureinwohnerüberfällen[COLOR_REVERT] kann es auch passieren, dass die Übeltäter gefangen und zur Strafe versklavt werden. Im [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] mit einem Ureinwohnerstamm werden üblicherweise bei der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Eroberung einses Dorfes[COLOR_REVERT] oder bei einem [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fehlgeschlagenen Überfall raubender Ureinwohner[COLOR_REVERT] als Gefangene gemacht, die dann zu Sklaven werden.

If this happens, the unit is changed into a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Free Colonist[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Native[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_FREED_SLAVE]Freed Slave[\LINK]. This event happens by random chance, so there is no way of predicting when a particular unit will become free.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Indentured Servants[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servants[\LINK] are the only one amongst these four groups that can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. They are the cheapest colonists available there, and they also appear in the docks as [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigrants[\LINK]. Of all these four groups, Indentured Servants are the least likely to run away, and the most likely to earn their freedom at some point. Their production penalty when put to work inside a building is also smaller than the penalty of the other three units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Indentured Servants are also the only Forced Labor Units that can be sent into [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] Villages to be trained as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experts[COLOR_REVERT], just like Free Colonists and [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK]. They also can be given military professions, as well as the [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Petty Criminals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK] are the lowest members of the societal ladder in Europe, and they are sent by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] to the New World as a form of punishment for minor crimes. Every once in a while, the King will contact you with the offer to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buy[COLOR_REVERT] a few of them for a very [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Low Price[COLOR_REVERT], much lower even than Indentured Servants, and once it's paid, they arrive immediately in your colonies, so they don't have to be transported from Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, Petty Criminals are even less eager to work for you than Servants are, which is why they will flee much more often, while it is also much harder for them to gain their freedom.[NEWLINE]Furthermore, they cannot be trained in Native Villages, and their penalty for working inside a building is higher. They are not allowed to take up [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Professions[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missionary[COLOR_REVERT] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]African Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] can be purchased for particularly low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], while the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] als occasionally offers you African Slaves.[PARAGRAPH:1]African Slaves are good workers, and they get a production bonus of +1 for all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raw Materials[COLOR_REVERT]. They do not have much use apart from that. They cannot become missionaries or military units, and they often flee. Similar Criminals and Servants, African Slaves [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]can earn their freedom [COLOR_REVERT]by hard work as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freed Slaves[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK] function in exactly the same way as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT], in terms of production bonuses and penalties, likelihood to flee and inability to be freed. They are obtained in quite different ways, however.[NEWLINE]Sometimes, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribe[COLOR_REVERT] may contact you to sell their prisoners of war to you. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Raids[COLOR_REVERT] can also go horribly wrong for the raiding natives, and if they are captured, they become slaves as well. Finally, if you are at [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] with a Native Tribe and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raze[COLOR_REVERT] one of their settlements, there is also a chance of obtaining a Slave, in case there are enough survivors to be enslaved.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]SERVANTS, CRIMINALS AND SLAVES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forced Labor[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To build up the [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Economy[\LINK] of your colonies, you will need a large amount of [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Colonists[\LINK] to do all the dirty work, but training or recruiting [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Experts[\LINK] can be expensive or time-consuming. Fortunately, for the enterprising Governor there is a cheaper, faster, but somewhat less ethical option: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forced Labor[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]There are four different types of colonists in this game who do forced labor: [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servants[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK]. Each of these groups have different strengths and weaknesses, and each of them is obtained through different means.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working with Forced Labor Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Forced Labor units all work best in [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK] when assigned to professions that gather raw materials on the fields, like [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]Farmers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER]Hunters[\LINK]. Each of them gets a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Production Penalty[COLOR_REVERT] when set to work inside a building in the colony. Additionally, some professions are not available to forced labor units, and most of them can't be trained in Native Villages either. They can, however, learn a specialism through the [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Education[\LINK] System, but because they receive a penalty when producing [LINK=YIELD_EDUCATION]Education[\LINK] as well, this may take a very long time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing, Revolting and Gaining Freedom[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Being unhappy with their situation, Forced Labor Units often attempt to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flee[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolt[COLOR_REVERT]. If they do, they leave the city, cross your borders and wander around aimlessly in the wilderness as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independent[COLOR_REVERT] Units. They will continue to do so until you send a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Unit[COLOR_REVERT] after them, attack them and defeat them with it, at which point they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Captured[COLOR_REVERT] and join your colonies again. It doesn't matter if they worked in a Settlement or outside as Pioneers; in both cases there is the possibility that they will become Free. If this happens, the unit is changed into a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Free Colonist[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Native[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_FREED_SLAVE]Freed Slave[\LINK]. They are the cheapest colonists available there, and they also appear in the docks as [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigrants[\LINK]. Of all these four groups, Indentured Servants are the least likely to run away, and the most likely to earn their freedom at some point. Their production penalty when put to work inside a building is also smaller than the penalty of the other three units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Indentured Servants are also the only Forced Labor Units that can be sent into [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] Villages to be trained as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experts[COLOR_REVERT], just like Free Colonists and [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK]. They also can be given military professions, as well as the [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Petty Criminals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK] are the lowest members of the societal ladder in Europe, and they are sent by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] to the New World as a form of punishment for minor crimes. Every once in a while, the King will contact you with the offer to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buy[COLOR_REVERT] a few of them for a very [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Low Price[COLOR_REVERT], much lower even than Indentured Servants, and once it's paid, they arrive immediately in your colonies, so they don't have to be transported from Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, Petty Criminals are even less eager to work for you than Servants are, which is why they will flee much more often, while it is also much harder for them to gain their freedom.[NEWLINE]Furthermore, they cannot be trained in Native Villages, and their penalty for working inside a building is higher. They are not allowed to take up [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Professions[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missionary[COLOR_REVERT] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]African Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] can be purchased for particularly low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], while the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] als occasionally offers you African Slaves.[PARAGRAPH:1]African Slaves are good workers, and they get a production bonus of +1 for all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raw Materials[COLOR_REVERT].
