TEXT.English: Specialists
TEXT.German: Spezialisten

TEXT.English: [H1]SPECIALISTS[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Specialists[COLOR_REVERT] are highly trained [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]units[\LINK], who can make impressive amounts of a particular yield much more efficiently than normal colonists. Employing specialists is the key to making your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colony[\LINK] the most productive possible.[PARAGRAPH:1]By assigning specialists to their [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]areas of expertise[\LINK], they will give your colony all manner of bonuses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Specialists[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can acquire specialists in one of five ways - by recruiting them from the [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] Screen (at a stiff fee); by hoping the specialist you want appears as an [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]immigrant[\LINK]; by building a [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]schoolhouse[\LINK] or one of its upgrades and training them yourself; by sending a colonist to live among the [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] and learn a trade; or by assigning them to a profession and having them learn a specialty through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]experience and hard work[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]You can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]remove[COLOR_REVERT] a unit's specialty if you so desire. By selecting the "Clear Specialty" order from a specialist, you can turn that specialist permanently into a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]free colonist[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Specialist Types[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several different [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]varieties[COLOR_REVERT] of specialists, but they break down into four main types:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Raw Materials Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]All units with the word [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"Expert"[COLOR_REVERT] at the beginning of their name are raw materials-producing specialists. These specialists, when assigned to the profession that allows them to get their material of choice, will produce - in most cases - double the usual amount. Most of these specialists can be acquired only by sending your colonists to Native villages that teach it although, once you have the first specialist, you can use your [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]education[\LINK] system to train more.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Manufactured Goods Masters[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]All units with the word [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"Master"[COLOR_REVERT] at the beginning of their name are specialists skilled at creating manufactured goods. When assigned to the profession that lets them craft their goods of choice, masters will make double the usual amount. In order to create the added goods, however, they will have to have access to an [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]increased amount[COLOR_REVERT] of raw materials.[PARAGRAPH:1]Manufactured goods producers can be bought in Europe, they can arrive as immigrants, and they can be trained through your education system or through learning by doing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Intellectual Specialties[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Elder statesmen[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]firebrand preachers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_PRIEST]devout priests[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_DOCTOR]renowned medics[\LINK] are four unique specialists that create [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]abstract yields[COLOR_REVERT]: [LINK=YIELD_BELLS]liberty bells[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CROSSES]crosses[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HEALTH]health[\LINK]. Like raw material producers, they produce their yields without consuming something else to do it but, like manufactured goods producers, they work in [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]buildings[\LINK] in the settlement. They can be recruited in Europe, trained in [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]universities[\LINK] or through learning by doing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]External Specialists[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Hardy pioneers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]seasoned scouts[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]veteran soldiers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]evangelists[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuit missionaries[\LINK] all practice their expertise outside your settlement. Once assigned to their appropriate profession - which you can do from the settlement screen or by using the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"Change Profession"[COLOR_REVERT] order while the specialist is outside the settlement - they can provide many special bonuses. Be aware that of these specialists, only the [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuit missionary[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]evangelist[\LINK] do not require a supply of of goods in order to take up their destined profession.[PARAGRAPH:1]These can immigrate from Europe, but the seasoned scout and missionary specialists cannot be purchased directly there. They can also be trained in education buildings and through learning by doing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Super Specialists[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are two units in the game that can be called [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]super specialists[COLOR_REVERT]: the [LINK=UNIT_NOBLE]famous nobleman[\LINK] and the [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]bishop[\LINK]. These give bonuses for liberty bell and crosses production respectively that are even higher than the bonuses provided by the normal specialists for these professions. They cannot be trained, however, and may be obtained only through certain [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomacy events[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]SPÉCIALISTES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les spécialistes sont des unités très bien entraînées, capables de produire des quantités impressionnantes de matières premières et de marchandises sans consommer plus de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]nourriture[\LINK] qu'un colon normal. Pour maximiser la productivité de votre colonie, il est essentiel que vous engagiez des spécialistes et que vous leur attribuiez la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profession[\LINK] correspondant à leur nom. Ils procureront ainsi toutes sortes de bonus à votre colonie.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquérir des spécialistes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Vous pouvez acquérir des spécialistes de quatre façons : en les recrutant à grands frais par le biais de l'écran d'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], en espérant que ceux vous recherchez [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]immigreront[\LINK] dans votre colonie, en bâtissant une [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]école[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]académie[\LINK] ou une [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]université[\LINK] et en les formant vous-même, ou en envoyant une unité vivre parmi les [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK] et en laissant le soin à ces derniers de la former. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Catégories de spécialistes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Il y a toutes sortes de spécialistes différents, mais on peut les classer dans quatre grandes catégories :[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Experts des matières premières[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toutes les unités dont le nom se termine par "expérimenté" sont spécialisées dans la production de matières premières. Si vous leur attribuez la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profession[\LINK] leur permettant de produire leur matière première préférée, ces spécialistes en produiront (le plus souvent) deux fois la quantité normale.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maîtres des produits manufacturés[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toutes les unités dont le nom commence par "maître" sont des spécialistes pour produire d'énormes quantités de produits manufacturés. Si vous leur attribuez la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profession[\LINK] leur permettant de créer leurs produits préférés, ces spécialistes en créeront deux fois la quantité normale. Pour créer les produits supplémentaires, toutefois, ils devront disposer de plus de matières premières.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hommes d'Etat accomplis et prêcheurs de haine[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]L'[LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]homme d'Etat aguerri[\LINK] et le [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]prédicateur exalté[\LINK] sont deux producteurs uniques qui franchissent la ligne séparant producteurs de matières premières et producteurs de produits manufacturés. L'[LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]homme d'Etat aguerri[\LINK] et le [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]prédicateur exalté[\LINK] sont des producteurs de matières premières, produisant respectivement des [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Cloches de la Liberté[\LINK] et des croix. Mais pour cela, ils ont besoin de bâtiments spéciaux - un [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]hôtel de ville[\LINK] dans le cas de l'[LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]homme d'Etat[\LINK] et une [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]église[\LINK] ou une [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]cathédrale[\LINK] dans le cas du [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]prédicateur exalté[\LINK] - tout comme les autres maîtres artisans. Les bonus procurés par ces deux unités s'appliquent uniquement quand elles travaillent dans leur bâtiment respectif.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Spécialistes à l'extérieur[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]pionniers intrépides[\LINK], les [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]éclaireurs chevronnés[\LINK], les [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]soldats vétérans[\LINK] et les [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionnaires jésuites[\LINK] travaillent tous en dehors de votre [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonie[\LINK]. Une fois que vous leur avez attribué la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profession[\LINK] adaptée, ils peuvent vous procurer différents bonus spéciaux. Parmi tous ces spécialistes, notez que le [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionnaire jésuite[\LINK] est le seul à pouvoir exercer la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profession[\LINK] à laquelle il est destiné sans utiliser de biens.[H1]APPRENDRE PAR LA PRATIQUE[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Devenir expert[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si les colons libres travaillent suffisamment longtemps dans certaines professions, ils peuvent alors devenir des experts. Plus un colon libre travaillera longtemps dans une même profession, plus il aura de chance de devenir un expert. Le procédé peut être plus long pour certaines professions très qualifées. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gagner sa liberté[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] De la même manière, les engagés et les bagnards peuvent également devenir des colons libres. Plus la profession qu'ils exercent est qualifiée, plus le procédé sera rapide.
TEXT.German: [H1]Spezialisten[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Spezialisten sind gut ausgebildete Einheiten, die beeindruckende Mengen an Rohmaterial und Gütern zu den gleichen [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Nahrungs[\LINK]kosten wie ein normaler Kolonist produzieren können. Durch den Einsatz von Spezialisten können Sie Ihre Produktivität erheblich steigern. Weisen Sie einem Spezialisten einen [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Beruf[\LINK] zu, der zu seiner Bezeichnung passt, und er wird Ihrer Kolonie eine Vielzahl an Boni verhelfen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Spezialisten erhalten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sie können Spezialisten auf vier verschiedene Arten erhalten: Rekrutieren Sie Spezialisten im [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]-Bildschirm (zu einem hohen Preis), warten Sie darauf, dass der Spezialist, den Sie erhalten möchten, als [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigrant[\LINK] zu Ihnen kommt oder bauen Sie eine [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]Schule[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]Akademie[\LINK] oder [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]Universität[\LINK] und bilden Sie Ihre Spezialisten dort selbst aus. Sie können eine Einheit auch zu den [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK] schicken, um dort zu lernen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die Spezialfähigkeit einer Einheit kann auch wieder entfernt werden. Wählen Sie den Befehl "Spezialfähigkeit löschen", um einen Spezialisten dauerhaft zu einem Freien Kolonisten zu machen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Arten von Spezialisten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Es gibt verschiedene Spezialisten, die sich in vier Hauptgruppen unterteilen lassen:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rohstoffexperten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alle "erfahrenen" Facharbeiter sind Spezialisten, die Rohstoffe produzieren. Wenn Sie ihnen den [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Beruf[\LINK] zuweisen, der zu ihnen passt, verdoppelt sich - in den meisten Fällen - ihre Rohstoffproduktion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fertigwaren-Meister[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alle Einheiten, deren Bezeichnung mit "Meister" beginnt, sind darauf spezialisiert, sehr große Mengen einer bestimmten Fertigware herzustellen. Wenn Sie ihnen den [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Beruf[\LINK] zuweisen, in dem sie die Güter ihrer Wahl produzieren können, verdoppelt sich ihre Produktion. Dafür benötigen sie dann allerdings auch mehr Rohstoffe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Weise Staatsmänner und Mitreißende Prediger[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Weise Staatsmänner[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Mitreißende Prediger[\LINK] sind Sonderfälle und bewegen sich an der Grenze zwischen Rohstoff- und Güterproduktion. [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Weise Staatsmänner[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Mitreißende Prediger[\LINK] sind in dem Sinne Rohstoffproduzenten, dass sie [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Freiheitsglocken[\LINK] beziehungsweise Kreuze produzieren. Damit sie das jedoch tun können, brauchen sie Zugang zu bestimmten Gebäuden - das ist im Falle der [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Staatsmänner[\LINK] ein [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]Rathaus[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Prediger[\LINK] benötigen Zugang zu einer [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]Kirche[\LINK] oder [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]Kathedrale[\LINK] - genau wie alle anderen Meister. Nur wenn diese Spezialisten in ihren jeweiligen Gebäuden arbeiten, werden die entsprechenden Boni gewährt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Spezialisten außerhalb der Siedlung[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Kühne Pioniere[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Routinierte Späher[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuitenmissionare[\LINK] wenden ihre besonderen Kenntnisse außerhalb Ihrer [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK] an. Wird ihnen der passende [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Beruf[\LINK] zugeteilt - was Sie entweder im Siedlungsbildschirm tun können, oder indem Sie "Beruf wechseln" wählen, während sich der Spezialist außerhalb einer Siedlung befindet - bieten sie verschiedene besondere Boni. Von den genannten Spezialisten benötigt nur der [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuitenmissionar[\LINK] keine Ressourcen für die Ausübung seines angestrebten [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Berufs[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]AUFSTIEG UND FLUCHT[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Fleißig arbeitende Bürger können gesellschaftlich aufsteigen und zu Experten werden. Schuldknechte und Kleinkriminelle dagegen haben es mitunter satt, für die freien Bürger zu schuften, und fliehen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Aufstieg zu Experten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Freie Kolonisten[\LINK] können durch "Learning by doing" (LbD), also durch längeres Arbeiten in einem Beruf, zu einer Experteneinheit werden. Je länger eine Einheit in ihrem Beruf arbeitet, desto wahrscheinlicher steigt sie zum Experten auf. Allerdings ist die reguläre [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Ausbildung in Städten[\LINK] (zum Beispiel in Schulen) grundsätzlich immer schneller als der zufällige Aufstieg. Dafür ist die zufällige Ausbildung immer kostenlos, außerdem ist die Einheit bereits während der Ausbildung produktiv.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unterbrechungen der Arbeit sind folgenlos, solange kein anderer LbD-Beruf für eine komplette Spielrunde ausgeübt wird. Bei KI-Fraktionen ist diese Einschränkung aufgehoben. Grundsätzlich ausgenommen sind alle Berufe, die außerhalb des Stadtbildschirms ausgeübt werden, mit Ausnahme des Pioniers. Bei Experten, die regulär eine Akademie oder sogar eine Universität zur Ausbildung brauchen, sind die Aufstiegs-Wahrscheinlichkeiten reduziert bzw. sehr reduziert. Zudem sind die Aufstiegs-Wahrscheinlichkeiten an die Spielgeschwindigkeit angepasst.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Aufstieg zu Freien Kolonisten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknechte[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminelle[\LINK] können durch Arbeit in einem LbD-Beruf zu Freien Kolonisten werden. Unterbrechungen der Arbeit sind folgenlos, solange kein anderer Beruf als ein beliebiger LbD-Beruf für eine komplette Spielrunde ausgeübt wird. Je höher der LbD-Lernlevel des aktuellen Berufes ist, desto größer ist die Aufstiegswahrscheinlichkeit zum Freien Kolonisten. Bei Schuldknechten ist der Aufstieg doppelt so wahrscheinlich als bei einem Kleinkriminellen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Flucht[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Schuldknechte und Kleinkriminelle können fliehen und dadurch verschwinden. Nicht möglich ist das, wenn diese Einheiten einen Beruf außerhalb des Stadtbildschirms wahrnehmen oder wenn eine Stadt nur einen einzigen Bevölkerungspunkt hat. Bei KI-Fraktionen ist dieses Feature grundsätzlich deaktiviert. Bei Kleinkriminellen ist der Aufstieg anderthalbmal so wahrscheinlich als bei einem Schuldknecht.[PARAGRAPH:1]Im Spiel gibt es auch Einheiten, die man als [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Super Spezialisten[COLOR_REVERT] bezeichnen kann: der [LINK=UNIT_NOBLE]Berühmte Edelmann[\LINK] und der [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]Bischof[\LINK]. Diese sind für Freiheitsglocken bzw. Kreuze mit Abstand die effektivsten Einheiten. Sie können weder ausgebildet noch gekauft werden. Man kann sie nur durch seltene [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie-Events[\LINK] oder [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Gründerväter[\LINK] erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]SPECIALISTI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gli specialisti sono unita altamente addestrate, in grado di produrre incredibili quantità di materie prime e di beni con lo stesso costo in [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]cibo[\LINK] di un normale colono. L'impiego degli specialisti è il segreto per rendere la tua colonia il più produttiva possibile. Assegnando uno specialista alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] che trovi nel suo nome, otterrai diversi tipi di bonus per la tua colonia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ottenere specialisti[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puoi ottenere gli specialisti in quattro modi: reclutandoli dall'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] (a un prezzo molto caro), sperando che lo [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]specialista[\LINK] che ti serve appaia come immigrante, costruendo una [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]scuola[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]college[\LINK] o un'[LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]università[\LINK] e addestrandoli per conto tuo, oppure inviando un'unità a vivere in mezzo ai [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] per imparare un mestiere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Puoi anche rimuovere la specializzazione di unità se vuoi. Selezionando "Rimuovi specializzazione" tra gli ordini di uno specialista, puoi trasformarlo permanentemente in un libero colono.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Categorie di specialisti[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ci sono diverse varietà di specialisti, ma si dividono in quattro categorie principali:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Esperti di materie prime[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Tutte le unità con la parola "esperto" (tranne lo scout) nel nome sono specializzate nella produzione di materie prime. Questi specialisti, quando vengono assegnati alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] che permette loro di produrre la materia prima preferita, ne produrranno nella maggior parte dei casi in quantità doppia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mastri artigiani[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Tutte le unità con la parola "mastro" nel nome sono specializzate nella creazione di enormi quantità di beni. Questi specialisti, quando vengono assegnati alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] che permette loro di fabbricare i beni che preferiscono, ne produrranno in quantità doppia. Per poter fabbricare i beni in più, però, dovranno poter accedere a una maggiore quantità di materie prime.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Statisti anziani e predicatori fanatici[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Statisti anziani[\LINK] e [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatori fanatici[\LINK] sono due singolari unità che si trovano a cavallo tra i produttori di materie prime e i fabbricanti di beni. Gli [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]statisti anziani[\LINK] e i [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatori fanatici[\LINK] sono produttori di materie prime, dato che producono rispettivamente [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]campane della libertà[\LINK] e croci. Ma per farlo devono poter accedere a edifici speciali: un [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]municipio[\LINK] nel caso dello [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]statista[\LINK] e una [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]chiesa[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]cattedrale[\LINK] nel caso del [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatore[\LINK]. I bonus vengono applicati solo quando questi specialisti operano all'interno dei rispettivi edifici.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Specialisti esterni[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Robusti pionieri[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]scout esperti[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]soldati veterani[\LINK] e [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionari gesuiti[\LINK] praticano le proprie abilità all'esterno dell'[LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK]. Una volta assegnati alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] appropriata (cosa che puoi fare dalla schermata dell'insediamento o usando l'ordine "Cambia professione" quando lo specialista e al di fuori dell'insediamento), possono apportare una serie di bonus speciali. Nota bene che, di questi specialisti, solo il [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionario gesuita[\LINK] non ha bisogno di qualche tipo di bene per assumere la propria [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK].[H1]LEARNING BY DOING[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Hard working citizens may rise in society and become experts in their professions. Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals however might also become fed up working for the free citizens and flee from your colonies, if they do not become free citizens through their hard work. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer a citizen is working in one and the same profession the higher his chances are to become an expert. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer an Indentured Servant or Petty Criminal work in a city or as pioneer, the higher their chances are to be accepted into society as free citizen. Indentured Servants have higher chances than Petty Criminals. The higher renowned the profession they are working in, the faster this process. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Unhappy Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals might flee. With Petty Criminals, this is twice as likely as with Indentured Servants.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]ESPECIALISTAS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Los especialistas son unidades muy entrenadas, capaces de producir tanto cantidades impresionantes de materias primas como mercancías, al mismo coste en [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] que un Colono normal. La clave para hacer a tu colonia lo más productiva posible es emplear a especialistas. Al asignar a un especialista la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] que corresponde a su nombre, éste aportará a la colonia todo tipo de bonificaciones.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Adquisición de especialistas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puedes adquirir especialistas de una de estas cuatro maneras: contratándolos en la pantalla de [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] (a un costoso precio); esperando que el especialista que necesitas llegue como [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]inmigrante[\LINK]; construyendo una [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]Escuela[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]Colegio universitario[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]Universidad[\LINK] y entrenándoles tú mismo; o enviando a una unidad a vivir entre los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] para que aprenda un oficio.[PARAGRAPH:2]También puedes eliminar una especialidad de la unidad si así lo deseas. Si seleccionas "Borrar especialidad" de las órdenes de un especialista, puedes convertir a ese especialista en Colono libre permanentemente.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tipos de especialistas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hay varios tipos diferentes de especialistas, aunque se dividen en cuatro categorías principales:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Expertos en materias primas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toda unidad con la palabra "experto" al final de su nombre es especialista en la producción de materias primas. Dar una [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] a estos especialistas les permite producir el material que les es propio, con lo que generarán, en la mayoría de casos, el doble de lo normal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maestros de mercancías manufacturadas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toda unidad con la palabra "Maestro" al principio de su nombre se compone de especialistas hábiles en crear enormes cantidades de mercancías manufacturadas. Asignarlos a una [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] que les permita crear las mercancías que les son propias hará que los Maestros creen el doble de lo normal. Sin embargo, para crear más mercancías deben tener acceso a una mayor cantidad de materias primas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Estadistas mayores y Predicadores exaltados[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Los [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Estadistas mayores[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicadores exaltados[\LINK] son los dos únicos productores que comparten características de la producción de materias primas y de la producción de las manufacturadas. Los [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Estadistas mayores[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicadores exaltados[\LINK] son productores de materias primas, pues fabrican [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Campanas de la libertad[\LINK] y Cruces respectivamente. Pero, para ello, deben tener acceso a edificios especiales: un [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]Ayuntamiento[\LINK] en el caso del [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Estadista[\LINK] y una [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]Iglesia[\LINK] o [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]Catedral[\LINK] en el caso del [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicador[\LINK], como ocurre con otros Maestros. Solo se aplicarán sus bonificaciones cuando trabajen en sus respectivos edificios.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Especialistas externos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Tanto los [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Pioneros avezados[\LINK], como los [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Batidores curtidos[\LINK], los [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Soldados veteranos[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Misioneros jesuitas[\LINK] ejercen su especialidad fuera del [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK]. Una vez que se les asigna una [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] adecuada _cosa que puedes hacer desde la pantalla del asentamiento o bien usando la orden "Cambiar de profesión", siempre que el especialista se encuentre fuera del asentamiento_, pueden proporcionar varios tipos de bonificaciones especiales. Ten en cuenta que, de estos especialistas, solo el [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Misionero jesuita[\LINK] no necesita ninguna cantidad de mercancías para iniciar la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] que se le ha destinado.[H1]LEARNING BY DOING[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Hard working citizens may rise in society and become experts in their professions. Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals however might also become fed up working for the free citizens and flee from your colonies, if they do not become free citizens through their hard work. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer a citizen is working in one and the same profession the higher his chances are to become an expert. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer an Indentured Servant or Petty Criminal work in a city or as pioneer, the higher their chances are to be accepted into society as free citizen. Indentured Servants have higher chances than Petty Criminals. The higher renowned the profession they are working in, the faster this process. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Unhappy Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals might flee. With Petty Criminals, this is twice as likely as with Indentured Servants.

TEXT.English: [H1]TAX RATE[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Taxation[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can make huge profits [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]trading[\LINK] goods with [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], but your success is largely determined by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tax rate[COLOR_REVERT] your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] has imposed upon you. For everything you sell in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT], the King will claim a percentage of your profits. This only applies to goods you sell; you still buy everything in Europe for its regular cost, without having to pay any taxes on top of that.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increases in Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Every once in a while, your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] will declare that he is going to raise your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]taxes[COLOR_REVERT]. There are two ways to respond to this.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]accept[COLOR_REVERT] the tax rise, in which case the tax rate goes up to the specified amount, but nothing else happens.[PARAGRAPH:1]The other option is to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebel[COLOR_REVERT] by throwing a "goods party." This means that one of your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]cities[\LINK] destroys everything it has in [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_STORAGE]storage[\LINK] of a certain good: usually something the colony specializes in, with large amounts stored. You then face a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]boycott[COLOR_REVERT] of that good, meaning that you cannot trade it with Europe or Africa any more, and your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomatic relations[\LINK] with your King suffer. The tax increase, however, is prevented.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maximum Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The upper limit of the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tax rate[COLOR_REVERT] is influenced by various factors. An important one is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]maximum tax rate[COLOR_REVERT]. This is a level above which the tax rate cannot rise so, once you've reached it, you should be relatively safe from your King.[PARAGRAPH:1]This maximum is not fixed though: your King occasionally contacts you with the command to hand over a part of your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]treasury[COLOR_REVERT]. If you accept, the maximum tax rate falls but, if you refuse, it rises. This can also happen if your tax rate already has reached its current maximum.[PARAGRAPH:1]There are also some [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]random events[\LINK] with consequences for your maximum tax rate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other Influences on the Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are other factors which determine your tax rate, your King's tendency to raise it and your maximum tax rate.[PARAGRAPH:1]Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]diplomatic relationship[COLOR_REVERT] with your king is one of them. If the King is angered by your insolence, he will try to force you to return to the fold by raising taxes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Some leaders, like [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK], have the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]charismatic[COLOR_REVERT] ability, which doubles the time between the King's tax increases. These factors are also influenced greatly by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]difficulty rate[COLOR_REVERT] on which you play.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Boycotts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]refuse[COLOR_REVERT] to accept a tax raise when it is proposed by your King, one item will be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]boycotted[COLOR_REVERT]. Boycotts can be lifted if you are willing to pay a very large sum of money to soothe your King's anger.[PARAGRAPH:1]Both high tax rates and boycotts can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]circumvented[COLOR_REVERT], however. One way to do it is by selling your goods in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. In Port Royal there is always a fixed fee you have to pay when selling goods, and this fee never rises or falls.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT] can only be reached by [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]privateers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]pirate frigates[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]smuggling ships[\LINK], you will not be able to conduct large scale trading with it, since none of these three units has more than three cargo slots.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can also buy smuggling ships in Port Royal, and have them sell goods in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT]. Smuggling ships will release you from the need to pay taxes, though smugglers do expect a small [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]payment[COLOR_REVERT] for every transaction they arrange.[PARAGRAPH:1]Boycotted goods can also be sold to Europe via the [LINK=BUILDING_CUSTOM_HOUSE]Custom House[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monarchy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]After declaring [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]independence[\LINK], you usually lose all possibility of trading with Europe and Africa. If you opt for the [LINK=CIVIC_MONARCHY]Monarchy[\LINK] civic when formulating your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cconstitution[COLOR_REVERT], however, you can continue trading with Europe and Africa, and have a fixed tax rate imposed upon you.

TEXT.German: [H1]Steuern[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Besteuerung[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Durch den [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Handel[\LINK] mit Gütern in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] oder [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] können hohe Profite erwirtschaftet werden. Diese werden aber zu einem wichtiten Teil auch von der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Steuerrate[COLOR_REVERT] bestimmt, die der [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] den Kolonien auferlegt. Bei jedem Verkauf in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europa[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Afrika[COLOR_REVERT] schöpft der König einen Prozentsatz über Steuern ab. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Erhöhungen der Steuerrate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Von Zeit zu Zeit, abhängig von der Handelsaktivität, kontaktiert der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]König[COLOR_REVERT] den Gouverneur um ihm mitzuteilen, dass die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Steuern wieder erhöht[COLOR_REVERT] werden sollen. [NEWLINE]Man kann dies [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]akzeptieren[COLOR_REVERT] wodurch eben die Steuerrate um den angegebenen Satz steigt.[NEWLINE]Oder aber man [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]verweigert die Erhöhung[COLOR_REVERT]. Dies führt dazu, dass in einer [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Kolonie[\LINK] die aufgebrachte Bevölkerung waren im [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_STORAGE]Lagerhaus[\LINK] vernichtet. Es handelt sich meist um die am meisten verfügbare Ware. Der König reagiert darauf indem er einen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boykott[COLOR_REVERT] auf diese Ware verhängt, wordurch diese so lange nicht in Europa oder Afrika gehandelt werden kann, bis man eventuell einsichtig wird und eine Strafzahlung in Kauf nimmt um mit der Ware wieder Handel treiben zu können. Die [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Beziehungen[\LINK] zum König leiden natürlich unter solch einer Handlung.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maximale Steuerrate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Höhe der Steuerrate wird durch viele Faktoren beeinflusst. Einer davon ist die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maximale Steuerrate[COLOR_REVERT]. Diese stellt eine Grenze dar, die der König nicht überschreiten wird. [NEWLINE]Dieses Maximum ist aber nicht für immer festgeschrieben. Sie kann aufgrund unterschiedlicher Handlungen der Kolonien gesenkt oder erhöht werden. Werden beispielsweise Geldforderungen des Königs erfüllt und ein Teil des aktuellen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goldvorrats[COLOR_REVERT] übergeben, so sinkt sie. [NEWLINE]Es gibt auch einige [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Zufallsereignisse[\LINK] deren Entscheidungen hier Einfluss haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Andere Faktoren[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beziehungen[COLOR_REVERT] zum König sind ebenfalls entscheidend bezüglich der Häufigkeit von Steuererhöhugen. Ist der König verärgert, ist eine Steuererhöhung deutlich wahrscheinlicher. Ist er erfreut, dementsprechend weniger.[NEWLINE]Eine Führer, wie [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK], haben die Eigenschaft [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charismatisch[COLOR_REVERT], die den Zeitraum zwischen Steuererhöhungen verdoppelt. Auch der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schwierigkeitsgrad[COLOR_REVERT] ist bestimmend.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hinweis[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Da auch die Menge der in Europa oder Afrika verkauften Waren für die Häufigkeit der Steuererhöhungen ausschlaggeben ist, kann man durch den Verkauf in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK] oder den Verkauf auf dem eigenen Binnenmarkt oder bei Ureinwohnern, einen Anstieg der Steuerrate verlangsamen.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]TAX RATE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Taxation[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can make huge profits through the [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trading[\LINK] of Goods with [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], but your success is for a large part determined by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT] your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] has imposed upon you. For everything you sell in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT], the King will claim a certain percentage of your profits. This only applies to goods you sell; you still buy everything in Europe for its regular cost, without having to pay any taxes on top of that.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increases in Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Every once in a while, your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] will contact you with the message that he is going to raise your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taxes[COLOR_REVERT]. There are two ways to respond to this.[NEWLINE]You can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Accept[COLOR_REVERT] the tax rise, in which case the Tax Rate rises with the specified amount, but nothing else happens.[NEWLINE]The other option is to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel[COLOR_REVERT] by throwing a "goods party." This means that a specific [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Colony[\LINK] destroys everything it has in [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_STORAGE]Storage[\LINK] of a certain good: usually something that colony specializes in, and of which large amounts are stored. In addition, you receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycott[COLOR_REVERT] of that good, meaning that you cannot trade it with Europe or Africa anymore, and your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with your King will suffer. The rise in taxes, however, is prevented this way.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maximum Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The height of the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT] is influenced by various factors. An important one is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maximum Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT]. This is a level above which the Tax Rate cannot rise, so once you've reached it, you will be relatively safe from your King.[NEWLINE]This maximum is not fixed though: your King occasionally contacts you with the command to hand over a part of your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treasury[COLOR_REVERT] to him. If you accept, the Maximum Tax Rate falls, but if you refuse, it rises. This can also happen if your Tax Rate already has reached its current maximum.[NEWLINE]There are also some [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] that can influence your Maximum Tax Rate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other influences on the Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are other factors which determine your Tax Rate, your King's tendency to raise it, and your Maximum Tax Rate.[PARAGRAPH:1]Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Relationship[COLOR_REVERT] with your King is one of them; if your King is angered by your insolence, he will try to force you to return to the fold again by raising Taxes.[NEWLINE]Some leaders, like [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK], have the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charismatic[COLOR_REVERT] ability, which doubles the time between the King's Tax Rises. These factors are also influenced greatly by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Difficulty Rate[COLOR_REVERT] on which you play.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Boycotts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Refuse[COLOR_REVERT] to accept a Tax raise that is proposed by your King, it will result in one good being [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycotted[COLOR_REVERT]. Boycotts can be lifted, if you are willing to pay a very large sum of money to soothe your King's anger.[NEWLINE]Both high Tax Rates and Boycotts can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Circumvented[COLOR_REVERT], however. One way to do it, is by selling your goods in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. In Port Royal, there is always a fixed fee you have to pay when selling goods, and the level this fee never rises or falls.[NEWLINE]As [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT] can only be reached by [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Smuggling Ships[\LINK], you will not be able to conduct large scale Trading with it, as none these three units have more than three cargo slots.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can also purchase Smuggling Ships in Port Royal, and have them sell goods in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT]. Smuggling Ships will release you of the burden to pay taxes, though smugglers do demand a small [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fee[COLOR_REVERT] to be paid for every transaction they arrange.[NEWLINE]Boycotted goods can also be sold to Europe via the [LINK=BUILDING_CUSTOM_HOUSE]Custom House[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monarchy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]After declaring [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK], this usually means that you lose all possibility of trading with Europe and Africa. If you opt for the [LINK=CIVIC_MONARCHY]Monarchy[\LINK] civic when formulating your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT], however, you can continue trading with Europe and Africa, and have a fixed Tax Rate imposed upon you.

TEXT.English: Tools
TEXT.French: Outils
TEXT.German: Eisenwaren
TEXT.Italian: Attrezzi
TEXT.Spanish: Herramientas

TEXT.English: [H1]TOOLS[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]You can't build a colony without [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]tools[\LINK]. Tools, which are made by [LINK=PROFESSION_BLACKSMITH]blacksmiths[\LINK] processing [LINK=YIELD_ORE]ore[\LINK], allow players to create [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioneer[\LINK] units, build [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]units[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]buildings[\LINK], and allow [LINK=PROFESSION_CANNONSMITH]cannonsmiths[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]gunsmiths[\LINK] to make [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]cannons[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]guns[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Making Tools[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To create tools, you first need [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ore[COLOR_REVERT] found on a hill, peak, [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]tundra[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]desert[\LINK] tile. Once the ore has been extracted by an [LINK=PROFESSION_ORE_MINER]miner[\LINK], it can then be processed by a [LINK=PROFESSION_BLACKSMITH]blacksmith[\LINK] once you've built a [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_HOUSE]blacksmith's house[\LINK]. If you want to increase the number of tools your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlement[\LINK] can produce per turn, you should hire a [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]master blacksmith[\LINK] or upgrade to a [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_SHOP]blacksmith's shop[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_IRONWORKS]ironworks[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_TOOL_FACTORY]tool factory[\LINK] or [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_TOOL_FACTORY]great tool factory[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Using Tools[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once you have tools, you can put them to use.[PARAGRAPH:1]With enough tools you can assign units to the [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioneer[\LINK] profession, which allows you to make [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]improvements[\LINK] in the tiles surrounding your settlements.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tools are also needed for certain buildings and units. All [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]land transport units[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]ships[\LINK] require a certain number of tools in order to be completed, as do most higher-level buildings.[PARAGRAPH:1]Finally, tools can be transformed by a gunsmith or cannonsmith into guns (if you have an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armoury[\LINK] or one of its upgrades), which can then be used to help construct ships or to arm your citizenry for [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]battle[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]OUTILS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Une colonie ne peut se développer sans outils. Ces derniers sont fabriqués par les forgerons à partir de minerai et permettent aux joueurs de former des [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionniers[\LINK] ainsi que diverses autres unités, de construire des bâtiments ou de fabriquer des armes à feu.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour créer des outils, vous devez avoir accès à une source de minerai en contrôlant une case de colline, de montagne ou de désert. Une fois le minerai extrait par un [LINK=PROFESSION_ORE_MINER]mineur de fer[\LINK], il peut être transformé par un [LINK=PROFESSION_BLACKSMITH]forgeron[\LINK]. Si vous désirez augmenter le nombre d'outils produits chaque tour par votre colonie, embauchez un [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]maître forgeron[\LINK] ou construisez une [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_SHOP]échoppe de forgeron[\LINK] ou une [LINK=BUILDING_IRONWORKS]usine sidérurgique[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Une fois en possession de suffisamment d'outils, vous pourrez affecter des unités à la profession de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] afin de réaliser des améliorations sur les cases entourant vos colonies.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les outils sont également nécessaires pour créer certains bâtiments et unités. Les [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]canons[\LINK] et la plupart des navires requièrent un certain nombre d'outils pour être produits, tout comme beaucoup de bâtiments de haut niveau.[PARAGRAPH:2]Enfin, les outils peuvent être transformés en armes à feu par un [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]armurier[\LINK] (une fois que vous aurez bâti une [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armurerie[\LINK]), qui pourront ensuite servir à armer vos citoyens et construire des navires.
TEXT.German: [H1]Eisenwaren[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ohne Eisenwaren können Sie keine Kolonie aufbauen. Eisenwaren, die von Schmieden hergestellt werden, die [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Eisenerz[\LINK] verarbeiten, ermöglichen es dem Spieler, [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionier-Einheiten[\LINK] zu erstellen, Einheiten und Gebäude zu errichten und [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kannonen[\LINK] oder [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Feuerwaffen[\LINK] herzustellen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um Eisenwaren herzustellen, müssen Sie zunächst Zugang zu Eisenerz haben, wozu Sie ein Hügel-, Gipfel- oder Wüsten-Geländefeld benötigen. Sobald das Eisenerz von einem [LINK=PROFESSION_ORE_MINER]Eisenminenarbeiter[\LINK] gewonnen wurde, kann es von einem [LINK=PROFESSION_BLACKSMITH]Werkzeugschmied[\LINK] verarbeitet werden. Wenn Sie die Anzahl der Eisenwaren erhöhen wollen, die pro Runde in Ihrer Siedlung produziert werden können, sollten Sie einen [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]Meisterschmied[\LINK] einstellen oder die Schmiede aufwerten, z.B. zu einer [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_SHOP]Stadtschmiede[\LINK] oder einer [LINK=BUILDING_IRONWORKS]Schmiedemanufaktur[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Sobald Ihnen Eisenwaren zur Verfügung stehen, können Sie sie einsetzen. Wenn Sie genügend Eisenwaren haben, können Sie Einheiten dem Beruf [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionier[\LINK] zuweisen, was es Ihnen ermöglicht, Geländefelder in Ihrer Umgebung zu modernisieren.[PARAGRAPH:2]Eisenwaren werden auch benötigt, um bestimmte Gebäude und Einheiten zu erstellen. Die Herstellung von Artillerien und von Schiffen setzt eine bestimmte Zahl an Eisenwaren voraus. Dasselbe gilt für die meisten Gebäude auf späteren Stufen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Außerdem ist ein [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]Waffenschmied[\LINK] in der Lage, aus Eisenwaren Schusswaffen zu machen (sobald Sie eine [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Waffenkammer[\LINK] errichtet haben), die Sie dann einsetzen können, um Schiffe zu bauen und Ihre Bürgerschaft für den Kampf auszurüsten.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]ATTREZZI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Non puoi costruire una colonia senza attrezzi. Gli attrezzi, che sono prodotti dai fabbri utilizzando minerale, danno ai giocatori la possibilità di creare i [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionieri[\LINK] e le armi, e di produrre unità ed edifici.[PARAGRAPH:2]Per creare attrezzi devi avere a disposizione del minerale, per il quale servono colline, montagne o deserti. Dopo che il minerale è stato estratto da un [LINK=PROFESSION_ORE_MINER]minatore[\LINK], può venire lavorato da un [LINK=PROFESSION_BLACKSMITH]fabbro[\LINK]. Se vuoi aumentare il numero di attrezzi prodotti a ogni turno dal tuo insediamento, dovresti assumere un [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]mastro fabbro[\LINK], oppure passare a una [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_SHOP]bottega del fabbro[\LINK] o a una [LINK=BUILDING_IRONWORKS]ferriera[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Una volta prodotti gli attrezzi puoi cominciare a usarli. Se ne hai abbastanza, puoi assegnare delle unità alla professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK], che ti permette di realizzare dei miglioramenti nelle caselle attorno ai tuoi insediamenti.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gli attrezzi sono necessari anche per creare determinati edifici e unità. I [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]cannoni[\LINK] e la maggior parte delle navi hanno bisogno di attrezzi, per venire completati, così come molti edifici di livello più alto.[PARAGRAPH:2]Infine, un [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]armaiolo[\LINK] può trasformare gli attrezzi in armi (dopo che avrai costruito un'[LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]armeria[\LINK]), che poi potrai usare per costruire navi e per armare i tuoi cittadini in vista delle battaglie.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]HERRAMIENTAS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]No puedes construir una colonia sin Herramientas. Las Herramientas, fabricadas por los Herreros con el Mineral procesado, permiten a los jugadores crear unidades de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneros[\LINK], construir unidades y edificios, así como crear Armas.[PARAGRAPH:2]Para crear Herramientas, primero tendrás que tener acceso al Mineral, cosa que implica la presencia de una casilla de colina, de pico o de desierto. Una vez que un [LINK=PROFESSION_ORE_MINER]Minero[\LINK] haya extraído el Mineral, éste podrá ser procesado por un [LINK=PROFESSION_BLACKSMITH]Herrero[\LINK]. Si deseas aumentar el número de Herramientas que el asentamiento puede producir por turno, debes contratar a un [LINK=UNIT_BLACKSMITH]Maestro herrero[\LINK] o modernizarlo a una [LINK=BUILDING_BLACKSMITH_SHOP]Herrería[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_IRONWORKS]Metalurgia[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Una vez tengas las Herramientas a tu disposición, puedes empezar a darles uso. Si tienes Herramientas suficientes, puedes asignar unidades a la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK], cosa que te permitirá crear mejoras en las casillas que rodean tus asentamientos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Las Herramientas también se necesitan para crear determinados edificios y unidades. Tanto los [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cañones[\LINK] como la mayoría de barcos requieren un determinado número de Herramientas para terminarse, así como muchos edificios de nivel alto.[PARAGRAPH:2]Finalmente, un [LINK=PROFESSION_GUNSMITH]Armero[\LINK] puede convertir Herramientas en Armas (una vez que hayas construido un [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Polvorín[\LINK]), que puedes usar para ayudar a construir barcos así como para pertrechar a los ciudadanos para la batalla.

TEXT.English: Trade
TEXT.German: Handel allgemein

TEXT.English: [H1]TRADE[\H1][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]To build up an [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]economy[\LINK], you will have to find trading partners who are willing to buy your colony's products. In a game of "We The People" there are five groups a player can trade with, locally or through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]harbours[COLOR_REVERT]: [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]; the different [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] nations; and your [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]rival colonial powers[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]What Can Be Traded[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are a select number of items that you are able to trade. These include money, maps, [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlements[\LINK] and goods.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gold, settlements, and maps can be traded through the [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy Screen[\LINK], but trading [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]goods[COLOR_REVERT] with another colony, Native civilization or harbour requires more than just diplomatic contact.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trading Goods[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To trade goods with another colony or Native tribe, you must first have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT] with that group. This means you cannot be at [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]war[\LINK] with them if you wish to trade.[PARAGRAPH:1]Note that you can always cross the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]borders[\LINK] of Native tribes, and they can cross yours.[PARAGRAPH:1]To trade goods, you must physically send the goods via [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]ship[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]wagon train[\LINK] to a settlement owned by the power you would like to trade with.[PARAGRAPH:1]Once there, you can click the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sell Goods[COLOR_REVERT] icon to ply your wares. This will open the diplomacy screen, on which you can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]barter[COLOR_REVERT] for payment.[PARAGRAPH:1]Every Native settlement also has a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]preferred good[COLOR_REVERT] that it seeks. Bringing this item to a native settlement will get you a better profit. You can find out what a native settlement wants when you speak to that settlement's chief.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trading with Harbours[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are three harbours where your ships can trade: Europe, Africa and Port Royal.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can sell goods at all three of these harbours. In [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT] you're subject to a [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]tax rate[\LINK] imposed upon you by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK], and you have to hand over part of your profits to him. The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]prices[COLOR_REVERT] for each good can also differ between these two harbours, so decide which good you want to sell where.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can also sell [LINK=CONCEPT_CHANGES_TO_TREASURES]treasures[\LINK] in Europe and Africa.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT] is a pirate haven, and you can sell goods here as well. Port Royal is not subject to your King's tax rate, but instead asks a fixed 20% fee of the profits made by selling goods there. In Port Royal you can also buy [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]smuggling ships[\LINK] to evade the King's taxes.[Paragraph:1]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]COMMERCE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Lors d'une partie de Colonization, un joueur dispose de trois types de partenaires commerciaux : l'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], les peuples [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK] et les autres civilisations. Pour plus d'informations concernant le commerce avec l'Europe, consultez la section "[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]". Si vous désirez en savoir davantage sur le fonctionnement du commerce avec les autres civilisations ainsi qu'avec les [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK], la suite de cet article devrait répondre à vos questions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ressources commercialisables[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Dans Colonization, vous n'avez la possibilité d'échanger qu'un nombre restreint de ressources : l'or, les cartes, les colonies et les marchandises.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'or, les colonies et les cartes s'échangent via l'écran [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK], mais le commerce de marchandises (que vous commerciez avec une autre colonie ou une civilisation indigène) nécessite davantage qu'un simple contact diplomatique. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Le commerce de marchandises[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]libre passage[\LINK] est la condition sine qua non à tout échange commercial sur le Nouveau monde, que vous commerciez avec une autre colonie ou avec une civilisation [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigène[\LINK]. Cela signifie qu'il vous sera impossible d'échanger des marchandises avec l'une comme avec l'autre, si une [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerre[\LINK] fait rage entre vous. Notez que tant que vous êtes en paix avec les groupes [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK], vos deux puissances sont liées par un accord tacite et automatique de [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]libre passage[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour échanger des marchandises avec un partenaire commercial, vous devez les acheminer physiquement, par navire ou par [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]chariots[\LINK], jusque dans l'une de ses [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonies[\LINK]. L'icône "Vendre marchandises" vous permettra de les expédier et ouvrira l'écran [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK] depuis lequel vous pourrez négocier un prix de vente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Sachez également que chaque colonie indigène recherche avidement un certain type de marchandise. Procéder aux échanges appropriés vous assurera un profit beaucoup plus important. Vous pouvez apprendre quel type de marchandise recherche une colonie indigène en consultant la fenêtre d'information de la colonie, après avoir parlé à son chef.
TEXT.German: [H1]Handel[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In Colonization gibt es mehrere Parteien, mit denen man Handel treiben kann - [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK], die [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] aber auch andere [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Kolonien[\LINK]. Mehr über den Handel mit Europa finden Sie im Abschnitt [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]. Informationen zum Handel mit anderen Kolonisten und [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK] finden Sie in diesem Abschnitt.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Womit Sie handeln können[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sie können mit verschiedenen Dingen handeln, dazu gehören Gold, Karten, Siedlungen und Güter.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gold, Siedlungen und Karten werden im [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK]-Bildschirm gehandelt, für den Güterhandel mit anderen Kolonien oder Ureinwohnern benötigen Sie mehr als nur einen diplomatischen Kontakt. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Güterhandel[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Zum Güterhandel mit einer anderen Kolonie oder [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK] brauchen Sie zunächst ein [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Offene-Grenzen-Abkommen[\LINK] mit dieser Gruppe. Wenn Sie sich also im [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] mit ihr befinden, können Sie keinen Handel treiben. Grundsätzlich haben Sie mit allen [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK]-Gruppen [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Offene Grenzen[\LINK], solange Sie nicht Krieg gegen sie führen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Zum Güterhandel müssen Sie Ihre Waren per Schiff oder Wagen (z.B.[LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]Planwagen[\LINK]) in eine [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK] transportieren, die der Zivilisation gehört, mit der Sie Handel treiben möchten. Wählen Sie dort "Mit Siedlung Handel treiben". Dadurch öffnet sich der [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK]-Bildschirm, von dem aus Sie Ihre Waren verkaufen können.[PARAGRAPH:2]Jede Ureinwohner-Siedlung bevorzugt ein bestimmtes Gut. Wenn Sie den Ureinwohnern also größere Mengen dieser Ware verkaufen, machen Sie ein gutes Geschäft. Welches Gut eine Ureinwohner-Siedlung bevorzugt, sehen Sie im Infomenü der Siedlung, nachdem Sie mit dem Häuptling gesprochen haben.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]COMMERCIO[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Durante una partita a Colonization, puoi commerciare con tre gruppi: l'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK], i [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] e le altre colonie. Per ulteriori informazioni sul commercio con l'Europa fai riferimento alla sezione [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]. Per ulteriori informazioni sul commercio con gli altri coloni e con i [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK], continua a leggere.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Con cosa commerciare[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]C'è un preciso numero di oggetti con cui puoi commerciare. Tra questi si trovano oro, mappe, insediamenti e beni.[PARAGRAPH:2]Poi commerciare con oro, insediamenti e mappe attraverso la schermata della [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomazia[\LINK], ma il commercio di beni con un'altra colonia o una civiltà nativa ha bisogno di più di un semplice contatto diplomatico. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Commercio di beni[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Per commerciale bene con un'altra colonia o con i [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK], devi prima avere un accordo di [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diritto di passaggio[\LINK] con quel gruppo. Ciò significa che non puoi essere in [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] con la civiltà o colonia con cui vuoi commerciare. Nota che hai automaticamente un accordo di [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diritto di passaggio[\LINK] con tutti i gruppi di [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK], quando non sei in [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] con loro.[PARAGRAPH:2]Per commerciare i beni devi rinviarli fisicamente via nave o tramite una [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]colonna di carovane[\LINK] a un [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK] posseduto dalla civiltà con cui vuoi commerciare. Una volta arrivato dovrai cliccare sull'icona "Vendi beni" per offrire le tue merci. A questo punto, si aprirà la schermata della [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomazia[\LINK], da cui puoi contrattare per il pagamento.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ogni insediamento di nativi preferisce un bene in particolare. Con la vendita del bene preferito otterrai un profitto nettamente maggiore. Puoi vedere il bene ricercato da un insediamento nativo nel pannello informazioni dell'insediamento, dopo aver parlato con il capo dell'insediamento stesso.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]INTERCAMBIO[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]En una partida de Colonization, existen tres grupos con los que el jugador puede comerciar: [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK], los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] y otras colonias. Para obtener información sobre el comercio con Europa, visita la sección [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK]. Para obtener más información sobre tus homólogos y los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK], sigue leyendo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Con qué se puede comerciar[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hay un número limitado de objetos con los que puedes realizar intercambios. Entre ellos Oro, mapas, asentamientos y mercancías.[PARAGRAPH:2]El Oro, los asentamientos y los mapas se intercambian a través de la pantalla [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacia[\LINK], pero el comercio de mercancías con otra colonia o civilización indígena precisa algo más que un simple contacto diplomático. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Intercambio de mercancías[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Para intercambiar mercancías con otra colonia o grupo [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativo[\LINK], antes debes tener un acuerdo de [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]apertura de fronteras[\LINK] con dicho grupo. Esto significa que no puedes estar en [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] con ellos si deseas comerciar. Observa que cuentas automáticamente con una [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]apertura de fronteras[\LINK] con todos los grupos [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativos[\LINK] siempre que no estés en [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] con ellos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Para comerciar, tienes que enviar mercancías físicamente mediante un barco o una [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]Caravana de carromatos[\LINK] a un [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK] que pertenezca a la civilización con la que deseas intercambiar bienes. Una vez ahí, puedes pulsar el icono de vender mercancías para distribuir tus productos. Esto abrirá la pantalla [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacia[\LINK], en donde puedes negociar lo que quieres a cambio.[PARAGRAPH:2]Todo asentamiento indígena tiene una mercancía predilecta que le interesa. Si les vendes dicha mercancía, obtendrás beneficios notablemente superiores. También puedes ver qué busca un asentamiento indígena en el panel de información del asentamiento, una vez que hayas hablado con su jefe.

TEXT.English: Route Planning
TEXT.German: Transportrouten

TEXT.English: [H1]ROUTE PLANNING[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1]With all the intra-[LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlement[\LINK] [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]trade[\LINK] that takes place in a game of "We The People", [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]transporting[\LINK] goods can sometimes get out of hand. To ease your colonies' [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]transportation[\LINK] management, by expanding on the "Religion and Revolution" model, ""We The People"" has developed two systems by which you can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]automate[COLOR_REVERT] the movements of your [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]transport[\LINK] units. You can click on wagons or ships and completely automate the transport of goods. Alternatively you can define transport routes and tell your transport units to use one or more of these pre-defined [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]transport routes[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]"Religion and Revolution" introduced a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Transport Route Menu[COLOR_REVERT], accessible by clicking on the transport unit's order button [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Assign Transport Route[COLOR_REVERT] (keyboard shortcut: "R"). This all grew out of transport routes as used in TAC {The Authentic Colonization).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Basics of Transport Routes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A transport route is three pieces of information: the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]yield type[COLOR_REVERT] (for example [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] or [LINK=YIELD_CIGARS]cigars[\LINK]); the [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]settlement[\LINK] to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]import[COLOR_REVERT] the specified yield type; and the settlement to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]export[COLOR_REVERT] the yield type.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you assign a transport route to a transport [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]unit[\LINK], the transport unit will load the specified yield in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]export[COLOR_REVERT] settlement and unload the specified yield in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]import[COLOR_REVERT] settlement. The transport unit does this automatically, until the transport route is deactivated. Of course transport units cannot transport metaphysical yields like production, liberty bells, crosses or education via transport routes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Transport routes only work between two settlements you own or between a coastal settlement and [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. Foreign settlements are not selectable in the automatic transport route menu.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]List of Available Transport Routes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When you open the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Transport Route Menu[COLOR_REVERT], you see a list of the already defined transport routes, which are available to the selected transport unit. For example, a [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]wagon train[\LINK] can only use transport routes which are located on the same landmass and which don't lead through [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]territories[\LINK] where the wagon has no right of passage, or where enemy units are nearby.[PARAGRAPH:1]The list of already defined transport routes is [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sortable[COLOR_REVERT] by yield type, import settlement or export settlement. Simply click on the corresponding column in the header of the list. There are checkboxes to the left of each list entry. If you click on a row, its checkbox is [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]activated[COLOR_REVERT] and the selected transport route is assigned to the active transport unit. To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]deactivate[COLOR_REVERT] the trade route you just have to click the row a second time and the corresponding checkbox will be deactivated.[PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]create[COLOR_REVERT] a new transport route you have to click on one of the buttons for "yields", "import" or "export". The next step is to select the yield type, the import settlement and the export settlement in the menu "create new transport route" that has just opened. To change a selection you just have to click on the button "yields", "import" or "export" again and choose another yield type or settlement. Of course you can choose only those settlements which can be reached by the transport unit.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you are satisfied with your selection of the yield type, the import settlement and the export settlement, you have to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]confirm[COLOR_REVERT] the transport route by clicking on the "+" button in the upper right corner of the menu. The transport route will then be added to the list of available transport routes and the interface reverts to the "list of available transport routes" menu.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you decide to leave the menu "create new transport route" without actually creating a new transport route, you have to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]deselect[COLOR_REVERT] the yield type, import settlement and export settlement by clicking on the small red cross in the selection dialogues. You will then return to the "list of available transport routes" menu.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Using More Than One Transport Route with One Transport Unit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To assign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]more than one[COLOR_REVERT] transport route to a single transport unit, simply use the checkboxes in the "list of available transport routes" menu. To assign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]all transport routes[COLOR_REVERT] to the active transport unit, you can click the green check mark in the upper right corner of the window. After that you can deselect single checkboxes by just clicking into the row.[PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cancel[COLOR_REVERT] a complete selection just click on the green check mark. The green check mark will change into a red cross. If you click the red cross, all trade routes will be deselected for the active transport unit.[PARAGRAPH:1]Transport units with multiple trade routes assigned to them begin with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]export settlement[COLOR_REVERT], in which the specified yields of the highest total [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]gold value[COLOR_REVERT] are stored. The transport unit checks which settlement has the highest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mathematical product[COLOR_REVERT] (amount of yield * sell price in Europe) in order to set a priority for the highest profit. This can eventually lead to problems, when multiple trade routes with very cheap and very expensive yields are combined for one transport unit. The transport unit might tend to load the expensive yields exclusively while ignoring the cheap yields.[PARAGRAPH:1]Don't assign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]too many[COLOR_REVERT] trade routes with different yields to a single transport unit or it might not work the way you want it to. Ordering a transport unit to load [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]lumber[\LINK] in settlement A and to load [LINK=YIELD_SILVER]silver[\LINK] in settlement B might cause problems, because the transport unit will probably rather load small amounts of expensive silver instead of large amounts of cheap wood.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Export to Europe[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK] can use trade routes between coastal settlements and harbours like [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. The transport ships will deliver the wares to Europe, but they won't sell their wares automatically. The player has to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sell[COLOR_REVERT] the goods, because [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]trade[\LINK] cannot be automated.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you click the ship's order button [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sail to the New World[COLOR_REVERT], a list of coastal settlements appears, which are available as a destination for your ship. The export settlements, which are part of a transport route for the active transport ship, are marked with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]red arrow[COLOR_REVERT] that points to that settlement. If you click on a settlement that is marked with a red arrow, the ship will sail there and use its assigned transport routes as usual.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you click on a listed settlement in the European port screen, the ship will sail to the settlement and then proceed with its assigned transport routes. If you want to delete or change the assigned transport routes of a ship, you have to open the Transport Route Menu when the ship has returned to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]New World[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]The automation of a ship is deleted if it loads cargo or immigrants in the European port.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Minimum Warehouse Supplies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]It is possible to define a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]minimum warehouse inventory[COLOR_REVERT] of a specific yield in export settlements. A yield cannot be loaded by transport units using automated transport-routes if there is less than its minimum supply value.[PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]define[COLOR_REVERT] the minimum warehouse supply switch to the settlement screen and open the menu [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Governor[COLOR_REVERT] in the middle of the right side of the screen. Click "exports" and set a check mark for the specific yield, then enter a minimum warehouse supply number.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Deleting Transport Routes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several ways of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]deactivating[COLOR_REVERT] transport routes.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you want to stop a transport unit using [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]all transport routes[COLOR_REVERT], click on the order button "stop automation" (keyboard shortcut: "backspace"). If you decide to deactivate only a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]part[COLOR_REVERT] of the transport routes for a transport unit, open the transport route menu by clicking the order button "assign transport routes" or by pressing the "R" key. Next deactivate the checkboxes of the routes you want to dismiss.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Enemies in Sight[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If an enemy [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]combat unit[\LINK] approaches an automated transport unit, the automated transport unit will [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]stop[COLOR_REVERT]. Enemy units that don't pose a threat, because they cannot attack, are ignored.[PARAGRAPH:1]When the transport unit stops, the automation is deactivated. The transport routes still exist, but the transport unit does not use them as long as there are enemies nearby. You can simply [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]reactivate[COLOR_REVERT] the automation in the Transport Route Menu.[PARAGRAPH:1]This [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]security alert[COLOR_REVERT] is active by default, but you can deactivate it as well. Just open the Transport Route Menu and click on the white hand icon. If the white hand icon is struck out in red, the security alert is deactivated.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The "Exit" Button[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]By clicking the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"exit"[COLOR_REVERT] button you leave the Transport Route Menu and return to the Game Screen. The chosen settings are saved.[PARAGRAPH:1]Important note: In the Transport Route Menu there is [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]no "cancel" button[COLOR_REVERT]. So make sure that you are satisfied with the current settings before clicking the "exit" button. If you are not satisfied with the current settings, you have to change or reverse them before you click the "exit" button.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mixed Use of Transport Route Menu and "Governor"[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Many players manage their transport routes in an alternative way: they do not control them exclusively by the transport route menu but by first making some settings in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]City Screen[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]In any city screen you find a button, "Governor", in the middle right section. By pressing it you call up a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]list[COLOR_REVERT] of all goods.[PARAGRAPH:1]For any good you may set [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]import[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]export[COLOR_REVERT] by clicking the respective checkboxes. If [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]both[COLOR_REVERT] importing and exporting have been set, this good may be imported into and exported from this city by automated trade routes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Additionally, within the numerical field right of the "exporting checkbox" you may set a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]minimum storage quantity[COLOR_REVERT] for any item essential to this city before exporting starts.[PARAGRAPH:1]For example: You check "Export" in a city for the good [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]food[\LINK] and in a different city (which can be reached by land and/or sea transport from the first city), you check "Import" for food. You have now [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]created[COLOR_REVERT] an automated transport route between these two cities. This route is not yet [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]functional[COLOR_REVERT] - you first have to assign a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]transport unit[COLOR_REVERT] to it, like a [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]wagon train[\LINK] or a ship.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hint: you may set also the minimum storage quantity of, perhaps, 50 within the first city, but this is not mandatory.[PARAGRAPH:1]As a result you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]select[COLOR_REVERT] the desired transport unit by left-clicking it with the mouse and then call for the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Route Management Console[COLOR_REVERT] by clicking the button "Assign Transport Routes" (shortcut "R"). The console now shows all already existing transport routes. All you have to do now is to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]find[COLOR_REVERT] the desired transport routes for this transport unit, to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]check[COLOR_REVERT] the respective box at the left side and then to give the transport unit these orders by clicking the button [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"Finish"[COLOR_REVERT]. When the list is very long and unclear, you may use [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]filters[COLOR_REVERT]. To do so, for example, you might click the button "export" and then select the desired "exporting city". This filters the display so that only those routes will be displayed which start in that city.
TEXT.French: [H1]PLANIFICATION DES ROUTES COMMERCIALES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Avec la multiplication du [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]commerce[\LINK] entre [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonies[\LINK] qui se développe dans une partie de Colonization, le [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]transport[\LINK] des marchandises peut rapidement devenir ingérable. Pour facilier leur gestion, "Religion and Revolution" a importé deux systèmes grâce auxquels vous pouvez automatiser les mouvements des unités de [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]transport[\LINK]. Vous pouvez cliquer sur des convois terrestres ou des navires et complètement automatiser leur transport de marchandises. Alternativement, vous pouvez également définir des routes commerciales et les assigner par la suite à ces unités de transport. "Religion and Revolution" offre ainsi un menu confortable de gestion des routes commerciales, qui est accessible lorsque vous activez une unité de transport et que vous cliquer sur "assigner une route commerciale" (raccourci clavier : "R"). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Les fondamentaux d'une route commerciale [\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Une route commerciale est constituée de trois informations : le type de marchandise (ex: nourritures ou cigares), la colonie exportatrice (provenance) et la colonie importatrice (destination). Si vous assignez une route commerciale à une unité, celle-ci chargera le type de marchandise désiré depuis la colonie exportatrice et la décharger dans la colonie importatrice. L'unité répète le processus automatiquement, jusqu'à ce que la route commerciale soit désactivée. Bien entendu, les unités de transport ne peuvent charger de marteaux, cloches de la libertés, croix, culture, santé ou points d'éducation. Les routes commerciales ne fonctionnent qu'entre deux colonies ou entre un port et l'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. Les colonies étrangères ne peuvent être sélectionner dans le menu.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Liste des routes commerciales disponibles[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Lorsque vous ouvrez le menu des routes commerciales, vous voyez une liste des routes déjà définies, que vous pouvez assigner à votre unité. Ainsi, un convoi terrestre ne peut emprunter que des routes terrestres et qui ne traversent pas de territoires dans lequel il ne bénéficierait pas d'un droit de passage. [PARAGRAPH:1]La liste des routes peut être triée par type de marchandise, colonie importatrice ou colonie exportatrice simplement en cliquant sur la colonne correspondante. Vous trouverez des cases à cocher pour chaque entrée vous permettant d'activer plusieurs routes commerciales pour une même unité.
